68009.name: Ritual
68009.description:
Introduction:

Ri+Val (Ritual) is a game of strategy based on the Books of Rituals.
The books are collections of rituals, where each page is an ancient manuscript with which you can tackle your opponent.
In Ritual every player embodies the spirit of an Immortal Sorcerer who must demonstrate his magical abilities and strategic skills.
Each book is protected by 5 seals: once they are destroyed the Sorcerer can take possession of the opponent's Book:
the ultimate goal is to control as many books as possible becoming the most powerful sorcerer in History!

Setting:
Millenias ago, an ancient powerfull civilazation was at its most high evolution point. All of its society was based on the magic and spiritual power of Nature. There were five Guilds,
Earth, Fire, Water, Air and the Guil of Destiny which rulled them all with justice and equity.
One day Evok, the demon spirit of the Abyss, escaped from his century long imprisonment. He promised revenge over the ones who chained him for so long in Darkness.
Gathering all sorts of evil souls and demons he attacked with fury the Capital of that ancient world.
The flames reached the sky, floods destroyed the land and everything seeemed near to an end...
The most powerfull Sorcerers then united their powers for the final battle against Evok: after an epical fight the evil spirit was resealed in his Jail forever.
Unfortunatly, that ancient world was destined to extinction, therefore the Sorcers wrote down on books all their knowledge and magic power.
Now these books have returned to chose the future of this world: who will be the most powerfull Sorcerer?!

General Game Rules:
Every player has a book which contains 33 Rituals
Evey book is "protected" by 5 Seals (this can be read as every player has 5 life points)
The Rituals are devided in Curses, Blessings and Summonings
which use Runes to be cast in to play.
They also have Element Points and Seal points which show the
power of every single Ritual.

Every turn you have 5 Runes to use.
The Turn is divided into
1-Casting Phase:
put into play the Rituals

2-Combat Phase
fighting phase

3-Closing Phase
resolution of combat

This is the general description of the game's rules,
shortly it will be available on the website.

68013.name: Politique
68013.description:
User Summary:

As the name suggests, this sourcebook focuses on the politics of the world of Scales. the book contains chapters about Dragon traditions and customs, goals, political influence and alliances of each dragon family and technomancer groups, two scenarios ("Claymore" and "Snipe"), and several new magical creatures.

68016.name: Technologie
68016.description:
User Summary:

The second Scales sourcebook focuses on technology.

The book contains chapters about Technomancers, mana-rich geographical places like Stonehenge or the Pyramids, high-tech research, Draconic genetic research and engineering, how the different factions use (or don't use) technology, weapons (magical and otherwise), as well as five scenarios, "Wake up!", Punch", "Scramble", "Maverick" and "Rigor Mortis".

The book also contains several new magical beings.

68017.name: Basic Action Super Heroes! Sci-Fi Edition
68017.description:
This is a Sci-Fi themed variant of the original Basic Action Super Heroes! game.

The basic mechanic is rolling 2d6 and multiplying the result by the appropriate stat (Brawn, Agility, or Mind) plus any applicable modifiers and beating a target number. Simple and easy.

Characters are built on points. While there are plenty of options here, it won't take you hours to build a character and you could jot all relevant stats down on a 3x5 index card.

This version includes guides for creating alien races. There are also rules for starship combat. Scenarios range from Victorian Steampunky Sci-Fi to Sci-Fi Fantasy to Post Apocolyptic genre.

68018.name: Terror and Blasphemy
68018.description:
A free adventure created cooperatively by members of EN World.

From the publisher:

The marilith, Blasphemy, has spent many years building up her complex and gathering minions to her aid. It is up to a strong group of adventurers to remove her from this plane, permanently, either for the good of all or in an effort to replace her as a rising evil force for others to fear.

With thirty encounter areas, and many traps, this adventure is big enough to be run over several sessions. Although designed as a 14th-level adventure, many of the encounters and tactics used by the creatures within border on the VERY difficult side. Experienced DMs might want to be prepared to give their players a break if they begin to complain, cry, or whimper...

68019.name: Murder on the Silken Caravan
68019.description:
Publisher blurb:

Volunteers are needed to escort the body of a deceased venture-captain across the parched Qadiran desert to Katheer. The Silken Caravan offers passage, hauling exotic treasures across the perilous sea of sands. You'll brave bandits, spies, and unwelcome mourners hell-bent on paying respects to your dead companion. Worse still, the caravan's mistress, a satin-swathed Qadiran princess, has designs of her own on you and your cargo.

68020.name: The Hydra's Fang Incident
68020.description:
Publisher blurb:

After an Andoren village is razed by the Hydra's Fang, a renegade Chelish slaver-ship, outrage threatens the stability of both nations. You and your fellow Pathfinders are sent to capture the Fang before the Inner Sea is pitched into political frenzy.

68021.name: The Frozen Fingers of Midnight
68021.description:
Publisher blurb:

Skelg the Ripper, envoy from the Land of the Linnorm Kings, lies wasting in his villa on the outskirts of Absalom. A frigid curse followed Skelg from his northern homeland and grips his bearish heart in its frosty embrace. As the bizarre freezing ailment pushes Skelg to the brink of death, the Society dispatches you and your fellow Pathfinders to uncover the secrets of the freezing curse before Absalom falls to its icy grip.

68022.name: Halls of Anarchy
68022.description:
From the publisher:

The Silver Coin Guild has a much darker side that goes well beyond the usual purview of thievery. Children have gone missing. Rescuing them and putting an end to this rising evil is not going to be an easy task.

Make sure your players have some extra characters in reserve for this deadly 7th-level trek.

Warning: Has the potential to contain mature themes...

68023.name: Crypt of Damnation
68023.description:
From the publisher:

This crypt is both the former home to the cult of a dark god and a place of lost knowledge.

The history of the crypt is convoluted, and many who once used this crypt to house their dead have gradually died out or moved on, leaving behind only the uneasily slumbering corpses, and worse, to protect their unholy places from un-sacrilege. Since the last cultist passed, the tomb has remained sealed for the most part, though some have found ways to venture within.

Who will brave the interior of this deathtrap next?

68024.name: Five Star Final
68024.description:
This newspaper-themed board game was based on 1931 movie "Five Star Final". The game includes a large (30" x 17") and heavy board, five player tokens, 40 Service Tokens, a deck of yellow Assignment Cards, and a deck of white News Cards.

Players take Assignment Cards from the Editor that show events underway around the board. They then choose how to travel there: by foot, bus, elevated, taxi or subway. By foot is slowest but reaches everywhere; subway is fastest but can mean an additional walk to many locations.

To complete an assignment, reporters first must arrive on the spot by exact roll of either two dice or one of the two. If they fail to land on the space two turns in a row, they have missed the story and must head back to the office. However, if they stroll back, they get a chance to draw an Assignment card on any other Assignment location on which they land, getting partial or full credit for that story instead.

Players who do land on their Assignment locations must then try to draw a News Card that matches their assignments, drawing twice a turn until they do. When they do draw the right match, they normally get one Service Token, but none if sent to Rewrite, and two if labelled Front Page. Then they head back to get another assignment. First player to get five Service Tokens wins.

68025.name: Tomb of Chaos
68025.description:
From the publisher:

This very challenging adventure uncovers a burial place of dark secrets and corrupted use.

Once the tomb of the ancient king Toth Nekamek, lord of a quasi-Egyptian realm who lived several thousand years earlier, its great halls and secret chambers have been violated by unspeakable evil. The outer rooms dedicated to the worship of the jackal-god Chacal, have been desecrated and now house those with nefarious intent but that is only the tip of the pyramid. Deep within must surely lie the secrets and treasures of a forgotten empire, along with their vigilant guardians.

Can those who enter ever hope to come back out alive?

68026.name: Silent Tide
68026.description:
Publisher blurb:

When strange reports of misty undead spread through Absalom, you and your fellow Pathfinders are dispatched to the half-drowned district of Puddles. Notoriously rough, the drooling addicts, flesh panderers, and quick-handed knifers of Puddles are the least of your worries. The night's tide brings with it an ancient armada of some long-forgotten war and you are the only thing between their mist-shrouded ghost fleet and Absalom's utter oblivion.

68027.name: Slave Pits of Absalom
68027.description:
Publisher blurb:

Someone kidnapped Lady Anilah Salhar—the Chelish wife of Dremdhet Salhar, one of Osirion's many Grand Ambassadors to Absalom—and sold her into slavery. With Salhar holding delve permits over the heads of the Decemvirute, the Pathfinders are sent to assist the Osirian Ambassador. Venturing into Absalom's darkest corners to save Lady Anilah, the Pathfinders must face the secrets of the Slave Pits to avoid becoming slaves themselves.

68030.description:
From the back of the box:

Conrad, the notorious colour sheep, is back in action! He eagerly dips his brush alternately into the red, the yellow, the blue, and the green paint pot: Conrad paints everything he has seen on his last trip – and that is quite a lot! Each of you gets three picture cards. Try and move Conrad to the paint pot cards and discard your card of the same colour. Be the first to discard all your cards and win the game!
68030.name: Felix Farbenschaf

68031.name: Rechen-Piraten: Das Kartenspiel
68031.description:
The wild number-pirates once again set off on treasure hunt: Capt. Mathematikus and his parrot Lora sail the Seven Seas. “Treasure island on starboard!“, Lora suddenly caws. Which number treasure will they find today? All players calculate at the same time. Each card displays four arithmetic problems. But only one goes with the operators on the dices. The first player to provide the correct solution receives the card as their reward. Winner is the first to collect five cards.

A pirate-worthy card game for 2 – 4 number pirates

68032.name: Verhext nochmal!
68032.description:
The powerful witch Gundula charmed seven princes. To releases them from the spell, players have to prove their own magical powers and brew a miraculous potion. The princes will be released as soon as the great potion is finished. To mix the elixir and collect prince cards you have to add always two ingredients in the exact order. In the end, you piece your prince cards together and count the points your prince scores. The larger the prince, the more points he scores!

A bewitched card game for 2 – 4 bright junior witches

68033.name: The Many Fortunes of Grandmaster Torch
68033.description:
Publisher blurb:

When four statues of unspeakable power were found in a tomb in Osirion and then stolen, the Pathfinder Society assumed they were gone forever. When they appeared again in the illicit inventory of a Qadiran smuggler in the massive trade city of Sedeq, the Society wasted little time dispatching you there to recover them. Finding the smuggler dead and a familiar face from Absalom responsible, your task quickly becomes a race to retrieve the statues before their brutal power can be unleashed on the citizens of the Satrap. Can you find the statues in time or will Sedeq be swallowed in a plague like none Golarion has ever seen?

68034.name: Cold Steel Reign Player's Guide
68034.description:
From the back of the book:

From iconoclastic game designer Patrick Ellison, Mad hermit Games brings you Cold Steel Reign, a fantasy Wild West roleplaying game like no other. Set in a post-apocalyptic alternate history, Cold Steel Reign weaves a gritty talke of dark fantasy, tinged with the flash of gunfire. This is what Wild West roleplaying games were meant to be.

68035.name: Among the Living
68035.description:
Publisher blurb:

Famed Pathfinder Bodriggan Wuthers disappeared from his dig site beneath the House of the Immortal Son in Taldor's gilded capital of Oppara. Once a grand temple to Aroden, the Immortal Son is now Oppara's most opulent theater. Sent to locate Wuthers, the Pathfinders must attend an opera with members of the Oppara elite in order to gain access to the secretive theater's dig site. When a cult crashes the performance and the nobility change into hideous walking dead, the Pathfinders are forced to choose between finding Wuthers or saving themselves.

68036.name: Eye of the Crocodile King
68036.description:
Publisher blurb:

Arcanamirium transmuter Maren Fuln found a magically sealed amulet in the school's library and kept it as a shiny bauble. Little did he know the amulet contained an entity far worse than he imagined, and by unsealing it, he loosed a revenge-obsessed horror into the sewers beneath the school. Can the Pathfinder Society halt the beast’s plan in time, or will he build his army of revenge and sow chaos in Absalom?

68037.name: The Asmodeus Mirage
68037.description:
Publisher blurb:

Appearing only once a century in the western deserts of Katapesh, the Asmodeus Mirage has plagued Golarion for thousands of years. Powered by a crystal bone devil skeleton and legendary for trapping unwary travelers, the Society has a vested interest in studying and cataloging the source of its power. You have been sent deep into the deserts of northern Garund to enter the Mirage—but there's a catch! The Mirage only exists on Golarion for 24 hours every 100 years. Get trapped in the Mirage, and you may never see Golarion again.

68038.description:
This set adds 6 gateway cards.

The cards are randomly added to the field to provide 'gateways' forward and backwards.

The cards allow players the ability to 'gate' through the line of cards, unfortunately the 'jump' is made to a random gate.

This expansion can now be obtained as a free download on their site.
68038.name: Dragon War: Gateways Set

boardgameimplementation.188690: Battles of the  Thirty Years War 1642 - 1651

68039.description:
After having passed most of the summer season waiting for event, Christian of Denmark decided to stir himself up and join the other part of his army to combat Tilly, left a little unmanned after having lost several detachments to guard conquered cities. His movements where to slow, and when the two armies joined battle, Tilly was probably a little superior to his opponent. Christian was unable to avoid the clash, and he suffered a defeat.

Each combat unit represents from 250 to 1500 soldiers, and it is rated, from left to right, for combat morale and movement. Each infantry strength point is around 150 men, each cavalry strength point around 80 men. Each leader is rated for Command (indicating how many activation chits that leader has) and Movement.

Each hex is about 75 meters.
Each turn is half on hour.

Contains:
6 page rules
11x17" map (in 2 8.5x11" parts)
1 player aid
216 counters and markers
68039.name: Sword of Fire

68041.name: Ordo Draconis (Issue 2 - Winter 2010)
68041.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The second issue of Ordo Draconis, the journal of the Dragon Warriors (Revised Edition) Roleplaying Game, expands its horizons to feature nearly three times the content and artwork of the first issue and adds statistics for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game! This new volume focuses on Cornumbria, a Saxon and Celt-inspired coastal region in the west of Ellesland. Players and GMs will find plenty of material to fuel their campaigns, including


"For Whom the Bell Tolls", a 36-page murder mystery based around a Cornumbrian abbey, featuring 10, full-colour maps.
The Thane, a new warrior class for Dragon Warriors
Darbon Barony, an in-depth look at a Cornumbrian fief
Codex Cryptozoologica, featuring the horrid Buggane
Fireside Tales, a spooky story from the Coronach Marshes
Location! Location! Location!, an 18 page exploration of Eastmarch: a town set amidst the swirling mists of the Coronach Marshes described including a map of the town and an area map of the Fief.
Along the Road, a series of mini-encounters to spice up your campaigns
The Thuland Campaign, the second in a series relating an epic PBM campaign
A review of Magnum Opus' newest release, Friends or Foes
What's in a Name?: authentic Cornumbrian words and phrases
Stats for Dragon Warriors and Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

68042.name: Marakush: Anderia
68042.description: Back cover blurb: "Further explore the world introduced in The Dragon Reaches of Marakush. Enter the region of Anderia, partake of the lush and verdant geography, marvel at the inhabitants and their Machiavellian politics.'

68043.name: Marakush: Treachery
68043.description: Back cover blurb: "Ynys Heddwch, the Isle of Peace, has become the unwitting backdrop for a treacherous struggle between the clans of Treron and Donethal. As the two vie for power in a series of cattle raids on the mainland, a band of adventurers become embroiled in this feud while visiting the Isle. Hired by a traveling minstrel, can they succeed in foiling the plot of one of the factions?"

68044.name: Creatures Bestiary
68044.description: Excerpted back cover blurb : This book contains all the Creatures and Monsters you'll ever need to play Chivalry & Sorcery 3rd edition!... An indispensable aid to any Game Master, as well as a great reference material for players. The Chivalry and Sorcery Creatures Bestiary is a tremendous supplement jam-packed with information. Oh, and a word of warning, "Beware the Trolls"!

rpgitemversion.21346: Savage World: Edycja Polska. Wersja kolekcjonerska

68045.name: Savage Worlds: Edycja Polska
68045.description:
From publishers website - translated from polish:

Savage Worlds, multi-awarded role playing game, at last in Poland. Get ready for a new way of gaming, different to what you seen before!

It will be savage! Savage Worlds is the fastest rpg system on the market, in which you can take part in a furious chase, huge mass battle or exciting duel - doesn't matter if your weapon is a rapier or a plane. Simple rules will let you create exordinary heroes, who will start as novices, but thanks to their adventures, will become living legends...

68046.description:
(from Ad on CSW:)

This is an operational level game, for two players, of the battles that took place in January and February 1944 near the small Russian town of Korsun.

Units are battalions and regiments for the Germans and regiments/brigades and divisions for the Soviets.
Map scale is 3.2 Kms/hex and each turns represents two days.

Battle for Korsun comes with a full colour 32" x 20" map in 4 sections, 297 mounted color counters, rule book and charts in a ziplock bag.
68046.name: Battle for Korsun

68047.name: Fight! The Fighting Game RPG - Handbook
68047.description:
Excerpted from the back of the book:

Create your own Fighters, complete with unique move sets and character traits drawn directly from the worlds of fighting video games.

Design your own Special Moves with an effect-based system featuring over 130 elements.

Engage in combat with rules focused specifically on genre emulation, including a focus on combos, defense and countering, and distance and positioning.

Create your own campaigns based on the models found in the stories of fighting video games. Battle in tournament arenas, in gritty back alleys, and everywhere in between with the fate of the city, the world, or the universe at stake!

Fight! The Fighting Game RPG contains all you need to tell stories of over-the-top martial arts action and adventure as seen in the worlds of fighting video games.

68048.name: Mists of Mwangi (OGL 3.5)
68048.description:
Publisher blurb:

Pathfinder Lugizar Trantos recently returned from the Mwangi Expanse with haunted eyes and a pack full of strange idols. Absalom's famed Blakros Museum purchased his pieces and Lugizar vanished. The strange monkey idols he pulled from the misty jungles of Mwangi carry with them a fell curse, and now their power has laid claim to the museum. Can the Pathfinder Society uncover the source of the curse in time, or will the Blackros Museum be forever lost to the mists of Mwangi?

68049.name: Black Waters
68049.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Pathfinder Society seeks the ancient ruby ring of the salamander and it falls to a team of Pathfinders to find it. Last seen in the Tri-Towers Yard, a once elite academy for the youth of Absalom, the ruby ring is now lost in the Drownyard, all that remains of Tri-Towers after it was destroyed a decade ago in the great quake. The Pathfinders must risk the strange black ichors and salty brine to find their prize—will they risk their very souls as well?

68050.name: The Prince of Augustana
68050.description:
Publisher blurb:

When an old beggar shows up filthy and injured on the doorstep of the Augustana Pathfinder Lodge in Andoran and demands to be recognized as Andoran's one true Emperor, Venture-Captain Wallace is inclined to chase him off. But when the old beggar reveals a wayfinder and tells a tale of demons and portals to another world beneath the streets of Augustana, Wallace summons you from Absalom to investigate. Will you make it through sewers, swarms, and sanctuaries to uncover the truth or will the dangers of the Augustana underworld consume you forever?

68051.name: Blood at Dralkard Manor
68051.description:
Publisher blurb:

Venture-Captain Juberto Savarre plans to retire soon, and he’s set his sights on spooky Dralkard Manor in southern Andoran. With the locals swapping tales of hauntings and missing persons, Savarre sends Pathfinders in to uncover the truth. Are the stories just tall tales or will the Pathfinders find themselves drenched in blood at Dralkard Manor?

68052.name: To Scale the Dragon
68052.description:
Publisher blurb:

The last remains of a sage from an age long past rests high atop the snow-covered tips of the Fog Peaks in Southern Galt and the Society wants his bones in order to study them and learn from them. They've sent you into a wintry wilderness of primordial beastmen and snow creatures not seen below the snow line to do just that. With the Aspis Consortium also seeking the bones, the race is on to beat them to the top and, once the bones are recovered, to make it back down alive.

68053.name: Where Dark Elves Rule
68053.description:
From the Introduction:

The characters travel to an alternate world to obtain a unique item for a sorcerer. Although the alternate world is very similar to their current world, here the Dark Elves rule the surface world.

68054.name: The Wreyland Serpent
68054.description:
From the back cover:

Instant Adventure for 4-6 characters levels 12-15

"I am Princess Athanake"

The woman who stands before you is young and beautiful, attired in gowns of the finest green velvet, and bearing with calm grace a circlet of gold upon her brow. She captures, in the slightest gesture and inflection, a porcelain perfection that you can once believed to exist only in storybooks and myth. She is a princess.

"I wish that it were under happier circumstances and calmer skies that I welcomed you to Anach, so that we might prepare a royal feast and listen to your tales in better company. Unfortunately, that is not to be, at least for now. Instead of telling tales, I fear that I must ask you to make new ones.

"Three days ago Royal Miners discovered the hidden lair of the Wreyland Serpent, a black dragon who has ravaged our lands for as long as memory allows. All but one of the men who worked there were savagely butchered by the creature."

She delicately extends a hand to one side, and a waiting courtier immediately steps forward and places a scroll within her grasp. The princess, in turn, extends it to you.

"This is a royal decree, sealed less than a quarter hour ago, giving you whatever lawful authority is necessary to prosecute our interests in this matter.

"I beg you. Deliver my people from this beast."

68056.name: Perils of the Pirate Pact
68056.description:
Publisher blurb:

When the Black Marquis lost all of the men he could trust on a failed treasure hunt, he did the only thing he could: turned to the Pathfinder Society for help. Offering an ancient lost text in return for assistance, the Black Marquis of Deadbridge sends you deep into the spider-haunted Echo Wood of the River Kingdoms to track down his missing pirates and recover an ancient treasure for the Society. You'll face brigands, pirates, spiders and more—but will you survive the perils of the Pirate Pact?

68057.name: Dice Floor
68057.description:
A game for 2 or 3 players, played with 36 dice per player. Each player tries to score higher than their opponents in rows and columns of a 6x6 grid they fill in with dice.

Each player will fill in his grid die after die, but all players will be using the same die value on a given turn.

In the end, the player with the most high scoring lines wins the game.

68058.name: Magie
68058.description:
User Summary:

The third and last Scales sourcebook focuses on Magic.

The book has chapters about Dragon Magic, with new and improved rules (including new Crafts and new Effects), evolution of magical beings (including a scenario describing the Transformation phase for a minotaur character), Quetzacoalt Rituals, new rules for Gestalt improvements, enhanced rules for Technomancers and Alchemy, and three scenarios, "Midgard", "Sila" and "Hunting".

As usual, the book ends with the description of twelve new magical beings, including sample characters.

68059.name: Vargr
68059.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Callously viewed by other races as thieves, vagabonds and pirates, the wolf-like Vargr are a complex and varied race whose society is light years beyond their stereotype. Alien Module 2: Vargr peels back the layers of prejudice to reveal a fascinating race who have a powerful effect on their region of the galaxy.

This book is packed with information for both players and referees. New rules for careers allow players to create their own Vargr characters, which are then well served by technology and ships designed by and for the Vargr. Chapters are devoted to playing a Vargr and how their society and culture are structured. Finally, we have also included a complete sector to explore, meshing seamlessly with the Spinward Marches - the Gvurrdon sector.

68060.name: La vérité est ici
68060.description:
User Summary:

Following the cancellation of the Scales line due to poor sales (the last novel of the Scales trilogy was never published, and a last planned sourcebook - "Nature" - never made it past the planning stage), Siroz - Asmodée released this pdf file on its website. The 11 pages document explains every remaining secret of the Scale universe, and includes scenario ideas for gamemasters interested in including these revelations in their campaign.

68061.name: Spinward Marches Map Pack
68061.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

The Spinward Marches awaits your exploration in this huge poster map, featuring every system, trade link and starbase in the sector. Beautifully illustrated in full colour, this map is the first in a series that will allow you to explore the entire Third Imperium and beyond, joining posters together to form one gigantic map!

Includes a full key to aid navigation.

68063.description:
This is it, pilot. The ultimate battle.

Your fleet is flying toward the enemy, breaking formation to engage individual ships. Each ship charges toward an enemy sector, raising shields to prevent attacks. You have three classes of ships, and your goal is to destroy enough fighting capacity of the enemy fleet to defeat it.

A Star Fleet Scramble set includes:

- A Star Fleet Scramble flexible A4 board.

- 9 blue acrylic ships: 3 battlecruisers (largest), 3 destroyers (midsized), and 3 corvettes (smallest).

- 9 red acrylic ships: 3 battlecruisers (largest), 3 destroyers (midsized), and 3 corvettes (smallest).

This is the 3rd nestorized Icehouse game.
68063.name: Star Fleet Scramble

68064.name: 1,001 Characters
68064.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

A referee's treasure trove, 1,001 Characters provides a quick and easy reference to over a thousand non-player characters, ready for play! Divided into easy-to-use sections, a referee will quickly be able to find the appropriate alien bounty hunter, starport administrator or backwater hunter easily. Each character comes with name, equipment, skills and background, giving them life and personality right from the page.

68065.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Japan’s imperialistic ambitions to dominate the entire Pacific may seem a mad gamble when viewed from a comfortable 21st Century perspective, but it should be remembered that, in the 1940’s, empires still existed. European powers had commanded vast tracts of the Pacific region for centuries, and the British Empire remained the largest in history. On the other side of the world, Germany had dominated almost the whole of continental Europe, so the idea of powerful nations taking territory by force was an attractive idea that, today, might seem repugnant.

Despite naval actions in oceans over the globe, it was Japan’s entry into the war that truly turned hostilities into a World War. By attacking Pearl Harbour, Japan ensured the United States was put into a position whereby it could no longer remain neutral. No longer was the fighting confined to Europe and Africa, with warships trading blows overseas. Now the people of almost every continent were directly affected by war.

Ultimately, Japan failed in its gamble. Before it fell, however, it had dealt the United States a grievous blow, and all but ended the hold European countries had in the region (not least because they had their own problems back in Europe). Once forced on the defensive, Japan proved to be a terrible enemy, its people willing to fight to their last breath, ferociously resisting the advance of the Allies as its forces were gradually pushed back to the Japanese islands.

The end of the Pacific war marked the end of the Second World War as a whole, an ending that was mushroom-shaped and terrifying., leading on to a new struggle that would hold the world in its grip for the rest of the 20th Century.

This supplement for Battlefield Evolution: World at War contains army lists and new rules for the following armies, in all periods of the Pacific War.

British Army and Commonwealth
Chindits
Imperial Japanese Army
Imperial Japanese SNLF
United States Marines Corps
68065.name: Battlefield Evolution: Pacific War

68066.name: Palast der Goldenen Tiger
68066.description:
(from the back of the book)

The splendid markets and impressive buildings of the city of Malrhira are known far across the borders of Tharpura - and not at last also its wise ruler, the Satrap Thyrodatus.
However, in the last Oktals a shadow has fallen on Malrhira: Heavily armed Pardir patrols tyrannise the population, and most friends and confidants of the Satrap have been incarcerated as traytors or vanished without a trace. Under these circumstances the famous fights take place, which are held in memory of the fall of a tyrant from old time. It requires some courage, but also clever heads and a strong sword arm to find out the background of this strange change - a splendid opportunity for foreign adventurers to make themselves a reputation ... or die by the attempt.

Weit über die Grenzen Tharpuras hinaus kennt man die prächtigen Märkte und beeindruckenden Bauten der Stadt Malrhira­ - und nicht zuletzt auch ihren weisen Herrscher, den Satrapen Thyrodatus.
In den letzten Oktalen aber ist ein Schatten auf Malrhira gefallen: Schwerbewaffnete Pardir-Patrouillen tyrannisieren die Bevölkerung, und die meisten Freunde und Vertrauten des Satrapen sind als Verräter eingekerkert oder spurlos verschwunden. Und unter diesen Umständen finden nun die weitberühmten Kampfspiele statt, die zur Erinnerung an den Sturz eines Tyrannen aus alter Zeit abgehalten werden. Es bedarf schon einigen Mutes, aber auch kluger Köpfe und eines starken Schwertarms, um den Hintergrund dieser merkwürdigen Veränderung herauszufinden -­ eine prächtige Gelegenheit für auswärtige Abenteurer, sich einen Ruf als Helden zu machen ... oder bei dem Versuch zu sterben.

68067.name: Äonenstaub
68067.description:
Translated from the Back of the Book:

The cult of Chrysir is rampant throughout the empire, and if it is on secrets that accompany relics and artefacts of this wind god, it's quite sure that the future will bring long journeys for the characters - maybe even travels on the wind itself. What these trips reveal, however, are secrets of so deep a past that even the wind does not whisper of it any more.

What secrets lie hidden in Ciriadda? Do they hide the the key to immense power or do they bring death from the depths?
Äonenstaub (Dust of the Aeons) confronts the heroes with ancient magic, the rites of the cult of Chrysir, customs of a tribe of the Leonir and aerial piracy - and is suitable for heroes of any profession and culture.

68068.name: Die Spur des Sternenprinzen
68068.description:
Translated from the Back of the Book:

Long ago the star princes served the Thearch and the people, the principles of the Stellars and honour. However, this time was many centuries ago. Still, legends tell of warriors and healers, singers and magicians who served once in this exclusive order, of their heroic deeds and the artefacts they left behind. More than one collector has tried in vain to recover these objects, and thus it is a pure coincidence that lets the heroes witness a merciless fight for one of the artefacts and sends them on an expedition. The Trail of the Star Prince (Spur des Sternenprinzen) leads the characters through towns, wilderness and ruins, and everywhere lurk dangers, competitors bet on their failure, and unexpected obstacles must be overcome - exactly the right job for intrepid and curious adventurers.

68069.name: Der Ewige Tod
68069.description:
Translated from the Back of the Book:

Sidor Corabis, melting pot of the people and cultures of Myranor. On their way in the former Co-Centropole the heroes can help a Neristu from a predicament. After a little while they meet her again, and receive insight into the strange culture of the Neristu which is otherwise barred to strangers

When the Elder of the thieves' guild dies, it turns out that some things that are necessary for his burial were stolen by a competing gang of thieves. Of course guests - the heroes - are asked to get them back. Because it is a matter of saving the dead from the worst that can happen to a Neristu: the everlasting death (Ewige Tod).

Besides the adventure, this book contains extensive background material on the Neristu, their culture and lifestyle, and moreover new professions and a special fighting style for 4-armed fighters.

68070.name: Tränen der Götter
68070.description:
(from the back of the book)
The deadly desert Narkramar harbors not only many dangers, but also countless uninvestigated secrets - and one of them are "tears of the gods" (Tränen der Götter). An expedition was already sent out and failed pitifully. However, were they only devoured by teh desert? What lies hidden behind the myth of this magic liquid? And which unknown power tries to prevent the discovery?
A party of experienced and intrepid heroes travel the steppes of Makshapuram and, finally, lifeless stretches of Narkramar. On the trail of old secrets they are confronted with pitiless pursuers, the followers of dark cults and ancient hostility - and of course with the problem of survival in the most hostile region of eastern Myranor...

Die tödliche Wüste Narkramar birgt nicht nur viele Gefahren, sondern auch zahllose unerforschte Geheimnisse - und eines davon sind die "Tränen der Götter". Eine Expedition wurde bereits danach ausgeschickt und scheiterte kläglich. Doch waren es allein die Weiten der Wüste, die sie verschlangen? Was verbirgt sich hinter dem Mythos um diese wunderkräftige Flüssigkeit? Und welche unbekannte Macht versucht ihre Entdeckung zu verhindern?
Tränen der Götter führt eine Gruppe erfahrener und furchtloser Recken durch die Steppen von Makshapuram und schließlich in die leblosen Weiten der Narkramar. Auf den Spuren alter Geheimnisse werden sie mit unbarmherzigen Verfolgern, den Anhängern düsterer Kulte und einer Jahrtausende alten Feindschaft konfrontiert - und natürlich dem Problem des nackten Überlebens in dem wohl lebensfeindlichsten Landstrich des östlichen Myranors...

68071.name: Tödliche Tiefen
68071.description:
(from the back of the book)

The sea of the swimming islands - another world in the heart of the continent Myranor. Forever flowing fog does practical jokes with everybody that travels on these waters. However, far worse dangers lurk in the water, often inseparably linkedly with the most splendid treasures and the most tempting secrets.
Malum ex Machina: An arcanomechanical construct which looks for what has sunk long ago into the lighless depths sounds like a guarantee for wealth and fame? Even more so if an ambitious Optimata leads the enterprise - what can go wrong?
Midnight blue depths: In front of the coast of Daranel lurk not only pirates and sea serpents, but also people who hate lungbreathers for eternity.
The thieves of Belenya: An ancient treasure lies not far from the city of Belenya, but only who owns a magic sceptre can find it. Who has the courage and the might to brave a long forgotten bastion of a house of fallen Optimates?

Das Meer der Schwimmenden Inseln - eine Welt für sich im Herzen des myranischen Kontinents. Ewig wallende Nebel treiben ihren Schabernack mit jedem, der diese Gewässer befährt. Doch weit schlimmere Gefahren lauern im Wasser selbst, oft untrennbar verbunden mit den prächtigsten Schätzen und verlockendsten Geheimnissen.
Malum ex Machina: Ein arcanomechanisches Konstrukt, das nach dem sucht, was vor langer Zeit in lichtlosen Tiefen versunken ist, klingt das nicht wie eine Garantie für Reichtum und Ruhm? Erst recht, wenn eine ehrgeizige Optimatin das Unternehmen führt - was kann da noch schief gehen?
Nachtblaue Untiefen: Vor der Küste von Daranel lauern nicht nur Piraten und Seeschlangen, ein seit Ewigkeiten die Luftatmer hassendes Volk schmiedet im düsteren Flammenschein untermeerischer Vulkane seine finsteren Pläne.
Die Diebe Belenyas: Ein jahrtausendealter Schatz liegt unweit der Stadt Belenya verborgen, doch nur wer ein magisches Szepter besitzt, kann ihn auch finden. Doch wer ist mächtig und mutig genug, um den Gefahren der seit langem vergessenen Bastion eines gestürzten Optimatenhauses entgegenzutreten?

68072.description:
FINNISH CIVIL WAR is a wargame of the civil conflict in Finland in the early months of 1918. The game is for two players, one representing the elected government of the recently independent state (the White player) and the other the perhaps-irresistible forces of proletarian revolution (the Red Player).

The game comes in two versions:
1) a company/battalion scale one which uses a system heavily modified from the designer's previously published games Freikorps, Konarmiya and War Plan Crimson; and
2) a brigade scale one that uses fewer counters and an even more heavily modified system.

Both versions use the same map (hex grid of southern Finland, at 12 map miles/ 20 km per hex). Special units and chromy bits include: variable-strength Red and White Guard units; Armored Trains; the spring thaw that occurred midway through the war; peace negotiations, German intervention and Russian withdrawal (including the Future Guilt Clause!); General Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim; guerrillas; purges; and the Swedish Talent Agency.

Was available for free download at designer's personal webpage from end of 2009, but in October 2012 the designer concluded an agreement with Compass Games for them to publish this game in Paper Wars magazine. Compass Games has requested that the free version of the game be taken down. Both versions of the game appeared in issue #84 of the magazine, in December 2016.

(source: designer's summary)
68072.name: Finnish Civil War

68073.name: The Trouble with Secrets
68073.description:
Publisher blurb:

Decades ago, an Osiriani Pathfinder named Bossell locked his transformed lover in the vaults beneath the Sothis Pathfinder Lodge. He then vowed that no one would ever discover his secret shame. The old and senile Bossell now relies on his assistant Fendel for everything, and the hapless assistant has disappeared into the vaults after reading his master's journal. You've been sent beneath the Lodge to destroy whatever it is that Bossell's lover has become—will you survive his secret or find yourself transformed as well?

68074.name: Skeleton Moon
68074.description:
Publisher blurb:

When Pathfinder alchemist Andrax d'Aponte contracted a mysterious wasting sickness, he set his mind to feverishly researching the disease and its cures. With the rare skeleton moon hanging in the sky above Absalom, the Decemvirate sends you to an ancient siege castle outside the city to recover d'Aponte's research notes and inquire about his involvement in recent Pathfinder deaths in Osirion. What you find, however, is a man changed by madness and paralyzed by paranoia and fear. Will you survive the night of the skeleton moon?

68075.name: King Xeros of Old Azlant
68075.description:
Publisher blurb:

Panic grips Absalom when a huge crystalline sailing vessel appears suddenly in the harbor. Identified as the King Xeros of Old Azlant, the ship presents a great opportunity for the Pathfinder Society. You and your fellow adventurers are summoned by Venture-Captain Adril Hestram and dropped aboard the King Xeros to explore it and report back. Only, what you find isn't an empty vessel, but a sinister ship with a vile intent.

202998.name: Conflict of Heroes: Guadalcanal – U.S. Army

68076.description:
In 1942, the Japanese empire exploded across the Pacific, conquering everything before them. The only large land mass still held by the Allies was Australia, which they desperately needed as a staging area for a planned U.S. led counter-attack. The Japanese knew of the importance of Australia, but lacked the resources to conquer it, so they decided on the next best thing: Isolate Australia from the United States by building an airfield on the island of Guadalcanal, from which planes could disrupt the Allied supply lines.

The United States, ill-prepared as it was for any offensive actions, immediately attacked with the 1st Marine Division under the command of Major General Alexander A. Vandegrift, caught the Japanese by surprise and easily took control of the airfield. The Japanese 17th Army, under the command of Lt. Gen. Harukichi Hyakutake, counterattacked with an ever-increasing number of troops. For the next four months a titanic struggle took place in the air, on land and on sea as the isolated Marines and U.S. Army fought for their lives to hold their tiny perimeter around the airfield against the might of the Japanese Empire.

Conflict of Heroes: Guadalcanal – Pacific Ocean 1942 recreates this struggle on your tabletop and includes gorgeous beach and jungles maps of the South Pacific, amphibious landing craft, the USMC, Japanese Banzai Charges, night combat, and much more.
68076.name: Conflict of Heroes: Guadalcanal – The Pacific 1942

68077.name: The Eternal Obelisk
68077.description:
Publisher blurb:

When the Pathfinder-obsessed daughter of one Qadira's most powerful trade princes goes missing trying to impress the Society, her father angrily demands the Pathfinders track her down or face expulsion from Katheer. Tracking the missing princess leads you to an underground complex filled with traps, tricks, and a creature so powerful, she's lived for a thousand years. Can you save the princess and uncover the power of the Eternal Obelisk?

68078.name: Fingerprints of the Fiend
68078.description:
Publisher blurb:

When a retired Pathfinder's nephew goes missing after allegedly discovered the fabled city of Rachikan of the ancient Jistka Imperium, he turns to the Society for help. Now you've been sent to the coast of devil-tainted Cheliax to uncover the missing nephew's whereabouts and to, quite possibly, uncover one of the most sought-after legendary cities on Golarion. But you have to move quick! The Aspis Consortium is rumored to be racing to the site ahead of you and their involvement could spell disaster for the Pathfinder Society.

68079.name: Behind the Lens
68079.description:
Join a team of wild life photographers who are taking a collection of photos overseas to an exhibition. Just as they are about to leave they discover that three of their photos are spoiled. By helping each other asnd using your memory work out which photos are'Behind the Lens', but hurry-the lane leaves when it's full.(From the game box).

Behind the lens features 12 endangered species native to New Zealand and their habitats

68080.name: Roger Zelazny's Nine Princes in Amber: The Black Road War
68080.description:
From the back of the book:

CONQUER THE HEART OF AMBER

Amber, that incredible, beautiful, terrifying world where Random rules as king and where Corwin the Murderer wanders free. Amber, world of misbegotten beauty and unrealized power. Land of order, land of oppression, land of destroyed dreams.

You are the son of Eric, and you lay your claim on Amber. You're determined to infiltrate the heart of that kingdom. But are you strong enough to survive its many dangers - and claim its savage throne?

68081.name: Tide of Morning
68081.description:
Publisher blurb:

Venture-Captain Dennel Hamshanks sends you to convince an Andoren druid named Hemzel to allow the Pathfinder Society to study his recently discovered lorestone, a minor magical item that unlocks some of the mysteries of the ancient Andoren druid circles. When you arrive and find Hemzel murdered and the lorestone missing, you must race against time to recover the lorestone and stop Hemzel's murderers from using it against the druids of Andoran.

68082.name: Decline of Glory
68082.description:
Publisher blurb:

When the son of a famous Pathfinder gains control of his father's holdings in Taldor, the Pathfinder Society decides to build a new lodge there as a base to explore the many ruins of that crumbling empire. Unfortunately, the Taldan Phalanx has its eye on the holdings and an ancient curse has turned many of the residents into the walking dead. Can you survive the tangled web of Taldor's politics and fight off the echoes of the past or will you, too, see your glory decline?

68083.description:
Strike it rich with this exciting mining-themed board game!

Gold Mine is a unique tile-laying game in which players build a maze of mine tunnels and control miners that traverse the mine collecting gold nuggets. Players race to be the first to collect enough gold to exit the mine and stake a claim. It may sound easy, but the greedy miners have several tricks up their sleeves in order to gain an advantage—including sneaking through secret passages, fighting for gold, and scaring away other miners with bats.

With a different game board every time, a great balance of luck and strategy, and the addition of optional rules, this game is bound to be a family favorite for years to come!
68083.name: Gold Mine

68084.name: Squiggle Connect
68084.description:
Squiggle Connect is a hilarious drawing game where players compete by changing a squiggly line into a picture. No artistic talent required . . . just your imagination!

It all starts with a roll of the dot cube and then the dots are connected by random lines using the connect cube. Once everyone has their unique squiggly line in front of them, play begins. Players have 60 seconds to transform their wavy and wacky line into a picture. They can be as simple or detailed as they want. When time is up, each player explains their drawing to the other players. This is where you may fall over laughing as you listen to some real nonsense! Once each player has had chance to explain what they drew, voting begins. Each player votes on only one other players drawing using a voting card.

The voting cards offer either a descriptive praise or a nuance of criticism such as "put that in a doggie bag" or "a monkey can do better". Each card also has a point value and players give them to each other based on their picture and description. It’s hysterical!

SQUIGGLE Connect recently won a National Parenting Publications Gold Award!

(from manufacturer's website)

68085.name: Graj z głową
68085.description:
User Summary:

This is one of the Gamemaster's Almanacs published by a Polish company Portal, among with Polish edition of "Play Dirty" and "Graj Fabułą". Author gives advices mainly on how to lead players and their team through the adventure, concentrating on gamemastering art itself, not on any specific gaming system. He presents some ways and tricks to make the players satisfied with their gamemaster.

Publisher Blurb (in Polish):

Graj z głową jest drugą pozycją, która ukazała się w ramach planowanego przez Wydawnictwo Portal cyklu almanachów. Jej autor, Ignacy Trzewiczek, koncentruje się na graczach i tworzonej przez nich drużynie. W odróżnieniu od Graj Twardo autor nie stara się moralizować, a jedynie proponuje szereg sposobów, by stać się ulubionym MG swoich własnych graczy.

68086.description:
Life has always been hard for the gibs. This sub terrain race always had a soft spot for shiny objects. Now that some gems have shown themselves the gibs have all flocked after them.

This light fast paced strategy game can be played in just a half hour and supports 2-4 players. Be the player that has collected the most gems of a single color.

There is a full page of Variants in the new edition to change up game play.

First edition scoring can still be used but 2nd edition has a new Scoring system to stop people from being able to swing the game to dramatically in a single turn.
68086.name: Gibs

68087.name: Hands of the Muted God
68087.description:
Publisher blurb:

When the man who would be the Muted God wordlessly stepped beyond the gates of the Starstone's Cathedral, his thousand and one faithful ringing the Ascendant Court watched with the silent contemplation that is their highest sacrament. When he failed to emerge, many of his penitents abandoned their vows but a small sect remained loyal and worshipful. You and your fellow Pathfinders are sent into the mountains north of Absalom to follow the path of a doomed party and uncover the secrets of the Muted God. His loyal band of followers, called the Hand, will stop at nothing to keep you away from their shrine—even forming an alliance with some of Golarion's most evil denizens.

68088.description:
Doubloon Dippidy is the game that comes with the "collectible" octopus, Dip. The game is similar to LCR. Players start with 2 coins. Players take turns rolling a pair of dice. Depending one what is rolled, the player may have to give coins to the bank or the player on the left or collect to coins. Play continues until only one player has coins left.

The game brings an Octopus, special dice, 30 plastic doubloons & a drawstring bag.
68088.name: Doubloon Dippity

68089.description: Sink or Swin is a die game that comes with the collectible Octopi Grippa. In the game players roll dice until either they come up with a clownfish or seahorse, which takes the die out of for the turn, or another face which is worth 1 to 3 points. Players keep rolling until they are happy with results or out of dice to roll.
68089.name: Sink or Swim

68090.name: Lost at Bitter End
68090.description:
Publisher blurb:

When a Pathfinder Society Priest of Nethys disappears in northern Geb while studying the Mana Wastes, the Society sends you to uncover her whereabouts and find her journals. Arriving in the town of Bitter End, you find it deserted but for a few mysterious creatures never before seen on Golarion. Those creatures quickly lead to more and soon you're embroiled in a mystery that could effect the very fabric of reality. Will you solve the mystery of Bitter End or find yourself lost forever in the Mana Wastes?

68091.name: Our Lady of Silver
68091.description:
Publisher blurb:

You and your fellow Pathfinders are sent to Katheer, the shining capital of Qadira, to witness the wedding of Pathfinder Faireven to the wealthy and beautiful Lady of Silver and bring back a trove of relics given to the Society as part of the wedding dowry. When the wedding is disrupted by unscrupulous thieves, you soon find yourself dodging double-crosses, accusations of grave robbery, and worse. You must find the relics soon, or risk facing the eternal expulsion of the Society from the treasure-filled deserts of Qadira.

68092.description:
Bed of Pearls is the game that comes with the collectible Octopi named Pearl. The game is vaguely similar to Yahtzee. Players roll dice trying to get good combination. A player can keep rolling until he is happy with the roll or rolls out.

However when you finish your roll and pass the dice. The next player can decide to roll all dice allowing you to score or try and build on your roll.
68092.name: Bed of Pearls

68093.name: Lyrics of Extinction
68093.description:
Publisher blurb:

The fabled ruined city of Dokeran, deep inside the heart of the Mwangi Expanse, has been found and it's your job as a Pathfinder to explore it and discover how it fell. After fighting through fiends, enslaved warriors, and the damned spirits of Dokeran's dead, you find that the ruined city has a dark secret—one you might not survive.

68094.name: Rolaweel Three in One
68094.description:
User summary...

Advertised as "Everyone's Game". Basically three different version of spin a spinner and lay down a bland chip on a bland board. In 1926 this was considered Entertaining, Fascinating and Thrilling!

Says so right on the box.

68095.name: Giggles Game of Action
68095.description:
User Summary...

Spin a top and wait to see which giggling child's mouth the balls land in to score points. Laugh with your friends and laugh at yourself - Giggles Game of Action!

68096.name: Monkey Shines
68096.description:
User Summary...

A children's acting game. Pull a cardboard monkey out of the box, read the action silently to yourself and act out as directed. Either award points for the best acting or use the cards to play charades.

68097.name: Pizza Party
68097.description:
(publisher blurb):
A mouth-watering way to learn fractions! This set of 12 realistic 12" (30. 5cm) pizzas is the "main course" upon which eight different fraction games are based. Includes 12 cardboard pizzas cut into halves, thirds, fourths, sixths, eighths, ninths, twelfths, and sixteenths, plus two spinners and an activity sheet. Comes in a sturdy pizza parlor box! For two to six players.

(from box front):
Pizza Party Includes:
- 2 spinners
- Activity Sheet with 8 Games
- 59 Full-Color Fraction Pizza Pieces

Players Will:
- Identify halves, thirds, fourths, sixths, eights, ninths, twelfths, and sixteenths
- Identify fractional parts of the whole
- Match fractional notation to concrete models
- Identify equivalent fractions and fractional parts
- Subtract fractional parts from a whole and other fractions

For 2-6 players
Grades 1-6

(description of the 8 games from the activity sheet):
1. Pizza Cover-Up
Skill/Purpose: Identifying the fractional parts that make up a whole.
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to cover a pizza with pizza pieces.

2. Pizza Play-Off
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying the fractional parts that make up a whole.
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to complete your pizza, with no overlapping pieces.

3. Pizza Pickup
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models.
Goal: The goal is to be the player with the most pieces after eight turns.

4. Penny a Pair
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying equivalent fractions/fractional parts.
Goal: The goal is to be the player with the most points after three rounds of play.

5. Fraction Line-Up
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying equivalent fractions/fractional parts
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to have one pizza piece of each size: 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, 1/6, 1/8, 1/9, 1/12, and 1/16.

6. Pizza Patch
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying fractions that are even parts or multiples of another fraction.
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to have two pizzas in a winnings pile.

7. Undercover
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying equivalent fractions/fractional parts.
Goal: The goal is to be the player with the most points after 20 rounds of play.

8. Empty the Pan
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying equivalent fractions/fractional parts; subtracting fractional parts from a whole/other fractional parts.
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to have no part of a pizza left.

68099.name: Monster & Treasure Assortment: Levels One - Three
68099.description:
From the back cover:

This Monster and Treasure Assortment (Levels One to Three) is one of a set and is designed as a playing aid for Dungeons & Dragons. By using the assortment lists, game judges can generate any number of appropriate monsters or treasure by simply rolling dice - thus saving time in play and preparation.

From the front cover:

This set contains lists of 300 monsters, 300 treasures, treasure storage/guarding/hiding modes, and complete instructions for using the assortment to fill in partially stocked or newly encountered dungeon levels.

From the introduction:

This assortment of monsters and treasures by dungeon level is designed to answer two needs. First, the package provides the Dungeon Master with a ready matrix of encounters when his players are exploring a dungeon encountered in a Wilderness Adventure. Second, and more important, these assorted monsters and treasures are aimed at making the DM's task a lighter one when it comes to readying the major dungeon in which most of his players' Underworld adventures will take place

68100.name: Monster & Treasure Assortment: Levels Four - Six
68100.description:
From the back cover:

This Monster and Treasure Assortment (Levels Four to Six) is one of a set and is designed as a playing aid for Dungeons & Dragons. By using the assortment lists, gamge judges can generate any number of appropriate monsters or treasure by simply rolling dice - thus saving time in play and preparation.

From the front cover:

This set contains lists of 300 monsters, 300 treasures, treasure storage/guarding/hiding modes, and complete instructions for using the assortment to fill in partially stocked or newly encountered dungeon levels.

From the introduction:

This assortment of monsters and treasures by dungeon level is designed to answer two needs. first, the package provides the Dungeon Master with a ready matrix of encounters when his players are exploring a dungeon encountered in a Wilderness Adventure. Second, and more important, these assorted monsters and treasures are aimed at making the DM's task a lighter one when it comes to readying the major dungeon in which most of his players' Underworld adventures will take place

68101.name: Monster & Treasure Assortment: Levels Seven - Nine
68101.description:
From the back cover:

This Monster and Treasure Assortment (Levels One to Three) is one of a set and is designed as a playing aid for Dungeons & Dragons. By using the assortment lists, game judges can generate any number of appropriate monsters or treasure by simply rolling dice - thus saving time in play and preparation.

[The 'Levels One to Three' is an error on the back cover of the Level Seven to Nine set.]

From the front cover:

This set contains lists of 300 monsters, 300 treasures, treasure storage/guarding/hiding modes, and complete instructions for using the assortment to fill in partially stocked or newly encountered dungeon levels.

From the introduction:

This assortment of monsters and treasures by dungeon level is designed to answer two needs. first, the package provides the Dungeon Master with a ready matrix of encounters when his players are exploring a dungeon encountered in a Wilderness Adventure. Second, and more important, these assorted monsters and treasures are aimed at making the DM's task a lighter one when it comes to readying the major dungeon in which most of his players' Underworld adventures will take place

68102.name: Dungeon Geomorphs Set One: Basic Dungeon
68102.description:
From the front cover:

This set contains ten 5 1/4" square geomorphic dungeon level pieces and five 2 1/2" X 10 1/2" additional dungeon level pieces which are semi-geomorphic.

From the introduction:

This set of geomorphs will provide you with an endless number of combinations with which to create your D&D "Underworld" -- be it one dungeon or many. Your geomorphs can be combined to form levels of all sizes, Huge or just a single piece.

Included is a sample dungeon layout with room descriptions and dungeon creation advice.

68103.name: Dragon (Issue 231 - Jul 1996)
68103.description:
The Spying Game
Volume XXI, No. 2
Cover art by Don Ivan Punchatz

Bonus: The AD&D CD-ROM Demo by Steve Winter

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68104.name: O' PenzedoR!
68104.description:
O'penzedor is the first game of young designer Cedric Joint.
The game is about opening doors and facing the magic spells behind it. If you have the right counter-spell among the cards in your hands you succeed and win arcane points; if you lose, you can continue though lose points and you give advantages to your opponents (new counter-spell cards).
Some cards with special power spice up the regular magic spells.
O'penzedor is a very simple and fun card-game with nice artwork from Pierro (Ghost Stories, En Garde, Linq, Mr. Jack).
[user summary of playtesting]

68105.name: El Brumoso Norte vol.II (Fogar de Breogán)
68105.description:
Seven are the Celtic countries: Ireland, Cornwall, Isle of Man, Scottland, Wales... and Galician, the roman Gallaecia, literally the land of the Gauls, named by Julius Caesar.

Galicia, land of witches, wolves, werewolves... and, although the knight of the order of Santiago protect the paths, The way of St James is still dangerous. Get into the holy city of , the land of the white wine albariño is waiting for you, let be teased by the celtic vision of this land where the real world and the supernatural are mixed.

Published in 2000, gather all the information needed to build campaigns in the northwest of the Iberian peninsula.


Siete son los países celtas: Irlanda, Cornualles, Illa do Man, Bretaña, Escocia, Gales... y Galicia, la Gallaecia romana, literalmente Tierra de Galos, nombre que se dice le puso el mismísimo Julio César.

Galicia, tierra de Meigas, Lobos y Lobisomes... y aunque los Caballeros de Santiago custodian el camino, el camino de Santiago sigue siendo peligroso. Adéntrate en la ciudad santa de occidente, la tierra del albariño te espera impaciente a que la descubras, déjate seducir por la visión celta de este rincón del mundo donde se confunde el universo real y lo sobrenatual.

Publicado en 2000, contiene toda la información necesaria para construir campañas en el noroeste de la península ibérica.

Contiene:
Mitos e historias de Galicia, un Bestiario Gallego, creencias y costumbres populares de Galicia, descripción del Camino de Santiago y de la ciudad de Santiago de Compostela y leyendas de Galicia, así como tres módulos listos para jugar que se desarrollan en tierras gallegas.

68106.name: Armoured Wargaming: A Detailed Guide to Model Tank Warfare
68106.description:
User Summary:

Primarily an historical digest of armor unit statistics, the book also contains a dozen pages of rules for 1:300 scale model tank wargaming. Scenarios and mixed- unit rules are, however, left to the reader's imagination.

68109.name: Sniper in the Deep
68109.description:
Publisher blurb:

When rumors stir of a hidden treasure ship in Absalom's Flotsam Graveyard, the Pathfinder Society sends you beneath the Inner Sea to investigate. Mayhem, undersea adventure, and chaos are to be had in this rousing rampage beneath the roiling waters of Absalom's harbor.

68111.name: Encyclopedia of Xanth
68111.description:
A Crossroads Adventure in the world of Piers Anthony's Xanth

User Summary:

You take the part of young Alister, with the Talent to find anything. Alister must locate and procure the Encyclopedia of Xanth in order for Good Magician Humphrey to answer his Question.

Part RPG, part choose your own adventure novel.

68113.name: Ghost of a Chance
68113.description:
User Summary:

In this solitaire RPG/choose your own adventure book, the player takes on the role of Max, an inhabitant of Xanth with the magical Talent of the lantern jaw. He seeks the lost mate of Brun, the Bluebird of Happiness, in order to procure Brun's blessing on his own impending marriage to Onda.

68115.name: Seven No-Trump
68115.description:
User Summary:

In this Crossroads Adventure, players take on the role of Random, the current King of Amber, as he tries to determine the whereabouts of his brothers, the Princes of Amber. The only clue to their disappearance is a set of twisted pictures, which Random must travel through to find his brothers in the shadows of Shadows.

68116.name: Nasty, Brutish and Short
68116.description:
From the Back Cover:

The Orcs of Hârn

The Gargun (also called orcs and Foulspawn) reside in the high mountainous areas of Hârn, where they squabble, maim, kill, and cannibalize each other, or any other species they encounter. The book provides details on Gargun culture, maps of four orc colonies, and six related adventure scenarios.

Bwaft
A natural cave complex situated high in rugged mountains. After centuries of relative peace, the Gargun of Bwaft find themselves involved in a vicious war with the nearby Gargun of Huxuth. "A Walk Among Tombstones" involves the players in this war, while "Dead of Night" provides them the chance to enrich themselves at the expense of Bwaft's inhabitants.

Ejatus
A cave complex with Araki (small orc) population rules by a Khanu (great orc) elite. These Khanu are highly-organized and dangerous, as anyone involved in the "Dance at the Slaughterhouse" scenario will soon discover.

Fana
A rich silver mine seized by Gargun six centuries ago, and still held by them despite dozens of attempts at recapture by the dwarves of Azadmere. The orcs of Fana traditionally skirmish with nearby orc colonies, and are always a menace to traverler. "The Last Worst Hope" deals with another dwarven attempt to retake Fana

Korego
The oldest and largest Gargun colony on Hârn. The orcs of Korego have a long history of conflict with both the local human tribesmen and merchant caravans. "We Deal in Steel" is a mystery involving arms-running. "To Live and Die in Korego" gives the players a rescue mission in which some things are not what they appear.

68117.name: Knights' Companion
68117.description:
From the Back Cover:

So you want to be a Knight - Do you have what it takes?

Inside these pages is all the information you might need to be a Knight. From the Dark Ages to the Renaissance, the role of a Knight is detailed for your enjoyment.

The contents include detailed information on the following: the Tourney and Joust, the Hunt, Courtly Politics and for those who wish to win the favour of their lady - Courtly Love.

Are you the true Chivalric Knight who cares for his people? Do you want to be a King-maker? Are you brave enough to try to win the hand of the Queen herself? Or are you the Knight who finds the Holy Grail?

Open the pages and explore the world you seek...

68118.name: Armourers' Companion
68118.description:
From the Back Cover:

So you want Magic Weapons and Armour? Read on...

In your hands you hold the Armourers Companion, which will allow you to bring the ancient arts of the Armourer Magus into your Chivalry and Sorcery campaign.

Discover the hidden secrets of Forge Magic and the art of thrice forged swords, tested for their purity to hold the greatest magicks.

Inside you will find the new Armourer Magus vocation, along with spells and rules for creating magical weapons and armour, as well as details on the construction of more mundane armaments.

This information will allow your characters to arm themselves effectively against the deadliest perils. Do not settle for second best, hire a master armourer now...

68119.description:
Empire Builder is a classic crayon-rail game by Mayfair, with many followups now available. The core idea of Empire Builder is that players to draw their train routes over a map of the United States. Players start with enough money to build short lengths of track, and by running their trains and delivering loads to various cities acquire more cash to expand their networks.

Super Sadistic Advanced Empire Builder (SSAEB) is an improved and much more challenging version of the base game. Numerous changes have been made: the payoffs on the contract cards have been lowered, the event cards are changed to be much more challenging, two new train types are added, and upgrade costs are increased.

By modifying the basic Empire Builder game with this expansion set, players will have a more challenging and longer game, but one that is more satisfying for hard-core gamers. SSAEB is for die-hard Empire Builder fans only!
68119.name: Super Sadistic Advanced Empire Builder

68121.name: Adventurer (Issue 2 - Jun 1986)
68121.description:
Issue 2
June 1986
The Superior Fantasy & Science Fiction Games Magazine

Cover art by George Jones

68122.description:
While decidedly a primarily ASL forum at this point, this issue did include a purely Squad Leader campaign game, which included a bunch of 'mini' scenarios to play through.

From the Table of Contents:
Soldiers of the Sun by Charles Markuss
Series Replay: A41 Op Hill by Chuck Goetz, Perry Cocke and Pat Jonke
Pigi-Pigi by Steven Swann
The Commando Campaign Game by Rex A Martin
The Doomed Battalions by Charles Markuss
And Here We Damned Well Played by Mark Nixon
Guilt By Accusation? by John Farris, Jay Kaufman and George Windau

Scenarios:
A39 Showdown at Tug Argan Pass
A40 Ad Hoc at Beaurains
A41 OP Hill
A42 Commando Hunt
A43 Probing Layforce
A44 Blocking Action at Lipki
A45 Chakila Sunrise
A46 Rattle of Sabres
A47 White Tigers
A48 Best-Laid Plans
A49 Delaying Action
A50 ...And Here We Damned Well Stay
DA9 Royal Marines
DA10 The Tiger of Toungoo
HA2 The Commissar's House
68122.name: ASL Annual '92

68123.name: Dragon (Issue 234 - Oct 1996)
68123.description:
Beyond the Grave
Volume XXI, No. 5
Cover art by Alan Pollack and Tony DiTerlizzi

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68124.name: Storyboard
68124.description:
From the Back Cover:

Storyboard offers simple yet versatile role-playing. Describe your character in words not numbers. It is compatible with any story or game genre you can imagine.

It requires pencil, paper, dice (optional) and a very active imagination.

68125.name: Dragonfire
68125.description:
User Summary:

Players take on the role of Mirrim, a young dragonrider in the world of Anne McCaffrey's Pern. Accompanied by your green dragon, Path, you strive to clear your name of the theft of Ancients' artifacts from the Southern Wastes, but first you must face Thread and perform the duty of all dragonriders...

68126.name: Revolt on Majipoor
68126.description:
User Summary:

Players take on the role of Parras Corbalin, personal aide to Lord Valentine, in a desperate search for Brynamir, Valentine's son. Parras has but thirty days to locate and rescue Brynamir and must face Lord Valentine's powerful and crafty enemies in order to accomplish his task.

68127.name: Dragonharper
68127.description:
User Summary:

Players take on the role of Robinton, a young man destined to eventually become one of the greatest Masterharpers Pern has ever known. But now, young Robinton is a mere journeyman traveling to his first posting at Benden Weyr. If he fails here, he will be disgraced, and his grand destiny will remain unfulfilled...

68128.name: Drow of the Darklands Pyramid
68128.description:
Publisher blurb:

A rogue band of drow plague the shipping lanes of Osirion and the Pathfinder Society sends you to stop them. When the drow capture a caravan laden with Society relics, you delve into the Darklands to track down the stolen cargo and explore the mysterious Stalactite Pyramid.

68129.name: Assault on the Kingdom of the Impossible
68129.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Pathfinder Society sends you to the fabled Kingdom of the Impossible, the island of Jalmeray, to stop an Aspis Consortium black market relics dealer who is organizing the local bandits and violently robbing Jalmeray and Pathfinder Society caravans laden with relics, artifacts, and magical mysteries. When a venture-captain is murdered by the Aspis Consortium agent, it's up to the PCs to find him and do whatever it takes to stop him.

68130.name: Encounter at the Drowning Stones
68130.description:
Publisher blurb:

Rumored to be the most desecrated site in the Mwangi Expanse, the natives have long feared its malevolent presence. Rumors of suicide, infanticide, murder, and chaos have always been mentioned in the same breath with these mysterious rock formations. The Society sends you there after the location is discovered by a demonologist working for the Aspis Consortium. The Society fears the Aspis have discovered the source of the Drowning Stones' power and its up to you to insure that they don't get their hands on it.

68131.name: Voice in the Void
68131.description:
Publisher blurb:

Mystery strikes again at the problem-plagued Blackros Museum in Absalom and its curator, Nigel Aldain, needs your help. When a famed Osirian tomb raider returns to Absalom and disappears in the museum's basement, Aldain fears the worst. When strange sounds echo from below and several of the curator's night watchmen go missing, he panics and begs the Society to investigate the mystery and save his museum from the darkness that infests it.

68132.name: The Beggar's Pearl
68132.description:
Publisher blurb:

When a thief arrives at the Pathfinder Lodge in Almas bearing stolen artifacts and writings pointing the way to a lost dwarven gallery, you are sent into the rugged Aspodell Mountains to find the famed dwarven explorer last known to be searching for the gallery as well as the gallery itself. Once there you find a tangled web of darklands creatures in the thrall of a charismatic cult leader with ties to the darkest shadows of the First Realm.

68133.name: Kaos (Issue 10 - Aug 1990)
68133.description:
Index:
1 Forside (Front page)
3 Indhold & Leder (Index & Editorial - Kasper Thing Mortensen)
4 Nyheder (Game news)
6 Sagen Om Den Forsvundne Mor (The Case About The Missing Mom - Tue Andersen Nexø)
19 At Your Door - en Cthulhu Now kampagne - Anmeldelse (Review - Jesper Aagaard)
20 TORG - Anmeldelse (Review - Morten Helles)
22 Focus På Brætspil: Blood Bowl (Focus on Boardgames: Blood Bowl - Annemette Wolff)
23 Boggnaskeren (Book Eater - Review: Damned If We Do... - Robin Andersen)
25 Sværd og Trolddom - Anmeldelse (Fighting Fantasy - Review - Lars Wagner Hansen)
27 Spiltræf '90 (Convention information: Spiltræf '90)
28 Bagside (Rear page)

68134.name: Kaos (Issue 11 - Sep 1990)
68134.description:
Index:
1 Forside (Front page - Anders J. Huulgaard)
3 Indhold (Index)
4 Nyheder (Game news)
6 Leder (Editorial - Kasper Thing Mortensen)
6 Brevkasse (Letters)
7 Sværd og Trolddom eventyr (Fighting Fantasy adventure - Lars Wagner Hansen)
11 Abonnements oplysninger (Subscription information)
12 Time of the Dragon anmeldelse (Review - Kristoffer Marner)
13 Old Empires anmeldelse (Review - Matias Stuven)
15 Monstrous Compendium Kara-Tur Appendix anmeldelse (Review - Lars Wagner Hansen)
16 Nye regler til Blood Bowl (New rules for Blood Bowl - Lars Wagner Hansen)
19 The Hunt for Red October (Review of the book, the film and the boardgame - Robin Andersen)
20 The Hunt for Red October Konkurrence (Competition)
21 Focus på Brætspil: Buck Rogers (Focus on boardgames: Buck Rogers - Robin Andersen)
22 Boggnaskeren - Dean R. Koontz (The Book Eater - Dean R. Koontz - Robin Anedrsen)
23 Kalenderen (Calendar)
24 Viking-Con information (Convention information)

68135.name: Dungeon Geomorphs Set Two: Caves & Caverns
68135.description:
From the front cover:

This set contains ten 5 1/4" square geomorphic dungeon level pieces and five 2 1/2" X 10 1/2" additional dungeon level pieces which are semi-geomorphic.

68136.name: Dungeon Geomorphs Set Three: Lower Dungeons
68136.description:
From the front cover:

This set contains ten 5 1/4" square geomorphic dungeon level pieces and five 2 1/2" X 10 1/2" additional dungeon level pieces which are semi-geomorphic.

68137.name: Assault of the Dead
68137.description:
Rulebook:
You and your companions are a ragtag bunch of zombie-fighting survivors waging a battle against a horde of the dead engulfing the city. Your team will travel across the hotspots, stemming the tide of hungry dead and helping the remaining survivors to safe houses. You must work together, using whatever skills are available to save the survivors before the dead rise up and destroy the city. The clock is ticking as every moment in the hotspot their hunger grows. Will you be able to succeed before the attack of the dead?

68138.name: The Green and The Tan
68138.description:
Miniatures rules for plastic Army Men wargaming. Simple, d6-based rule set that simulates WW2 to modern era combat.

From the publisher:
Plays in 30 minutes or less
Useable with any cheap figures or carboard "stand-ups"
No army lists, counters or book keeping required
Weapons include flame throwers, machine guns, mortars and bazooka
Rules for infantry, tanks, helicopters, minefields, and mission objectives
Unit activation based on squad strength / casualties

68139.name: No Quarter (Issue 25 - Jul 2009)
68139.description:
From website:

Summer Rampage bursts onto the scene in No Quarter #25, with everything you need for your warbeasts and warjacks to fight for dominance! Learn the secrets of the Fraternal Order of Wizardry, and travel the waterways with a look at Steamships in the Iron Kingdoms.

Cover Art "Garryth, Blade of Retribution" by Andrea Uderzo

ISSN: 7558200618

68140.name: UNO: Kung Fu Panda
