68140.description: Join Po & the Martial Arts Masters for an UNO card game showdown! Challenge any opponent to a Kickin' Battle with the exclusive card & rule! And Don't forget to yell UNO when you are about to become the Chosen One!

68141.name: Exobichos
68141.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Since the sheller started the space discovery, we know we are not alone in the void, and that it's inhabited by a lot of beings ranging from a microscopic scale to the size of a planet.

Exobichos is a supplement for EXO that describes some of these creatures the players can meet in the spacial voyages. It includes races from distant and very different places in the universe. Some of them dwelling in spacial stations, in spacecrafts; others live in planets, but their physiology or the intervention of third-party creatures have spread them from one place to another; and some others, lived in the void, contradicting what the shellers think. Each of the description of the creatures include ideas for encounters or adventures and how they behave so all the possible situations can be solved.


Desde que los sheller iniciaron la exploración del espacio, sabemos que no estamos solos en el vacío, y que existen multitud de seres desde microscópicos a seres del tamaño de un planeta, algunos de ellos pacíficos y otros hostiles.

Exobichos es un suplemento para EXO 3464 que da a conocer algunas de esas criaturas que los jugadores podrán encontrarse en sus viajes espaciales. Pretende incluir razas dispares geográficamente y variedad de animales de diversas zonas del espacio. Algunos habitan en estaciones orbitales, en el interior de naves espaciales; otros habitan en planetas, pero su fisiología o la mano de terceras criaturas los ha llevado de un rincón de la galaxia a otro; y otros, a pesar de la original creencia sheller, habitan en el mismo vacío del espacio. Cada una de las entradas incluyen ideas de encuentros y aventuras con reglas sobre el comportamiento de las criaturas para resolverlos.

68142.name: Elves' Companion
68142.description:
From the back cover:

Welcome to the Elves Companion, the supplement which blows away the veils that hide the truth behind the Blight infecting the Elves.

Discover the cultures of the Wood Elves, Great Elves and True Elves, their fall from teh realms of Faerie and the reasons behind their self-imposed exile. Within this volume find out why the Elvish Longbow is so important and learn its true place within Elven society, along with information on their religious beliefs, and additions to the Bestiary.

Bring the Elves to life in your Chivalry & Sorcery campaign with these expanded rules; new vocations and background material for the Elves of Marakush.

68145.description: The swimming ring is placed into the water, players receive all discs of one colour. In his turn a player drops one of his discs into the water, it schwims either showing Nessi or the empty side. Then the next player drops a disc, if it hits another disc in the water, this is turned over. When all discs have been dropped, the player with the most Nessis visisble on his discs wins the game. In a variant one can end the game when the first player has 5 Nessis showing.
68145.name: Nessi!

68146.description: Ssssh! With hands and feet only, the players in Pantomime describe the pictures on the cards to other players. Whoever speaks or makes a noise loses.
68146.name: Pantomime

boardgamefamily.21540: HABA Game in a Tin series

68147.description:
In Lesehexe, you want to find as many matching word cards as possible. Start by placing a green starter card (A-M) into the card frame, then search for a matching word card. To check whether the cards have been placed together correctly, try to place the witch's shoes into the cutouts. Who can collect the most word cards?

Lesehexe includes seven different game ideas for practicing letters and simple words, providing players with plenty of variety.
68147.name: Lesehexe

68148.name: Namegivers of Barsaive

rpgissuearticle.156601: Wielkie kłamstwo - Mity Cthulhu w Przebudzeniu Ziemi

68148.description:
From RedBrick Limited website:

"Eight Namegiving races dwell in the land of Barsaive, each with its own culture and traditions. Despite their differences, they are bound by shared experiences, beliefs, and love for their land. Together they embody the heart and soul of Barsaive. This volume provides an indepth look at the Namegiver races of Barsaive:

Dwarfs: stout and stubborn, the industrious dwarfs are the cultural and political leaders of Barsaive.

Elves: beings of deep feeling and spirituality, they seek to restore their culture’s former glory.

Humans: having lived through a history of destruction and war, humans remain versatile enough to adapt to any situation.

Obsidimen: ancient beings of living rock, these stone giants are perhaps the oldest and most mysterious denizens of Barsaive.

Orks: passionate and savage, their love for life is surpassed only by their love for battle!

Trolls: bestial in appearance, these gargantuan mountain dwellers are both fierce and honorable.

T’skrang: flamboyant, reptilian beings, whose swashbuckling bravado reflects their zest of life.

Windlings: small, winged beings whose passion for change makes them mischievous and unpredictable.

The Namegivers of Barsaive book details the eight Namegiver races and provides extended game information, including new Disciplines, talents, knacks, and goods and services, as well as special rules for playing each race in your Earthdawn Third Edition games. Requires use of the Earthdawn Player’s and Gamemaster’s Guides."

68149.description:
User Summary:
An old roll and move race game in german language about Nurburgring circuit.
The players throw the dice to determine the starting positions, then advance their tokens according to the subsequent launch of the dice.
On the track there are points that help competitors to move faster, or force them to lose precious time waiting for a favorable launch.
The first player who crosses the finish line after six turns (but at beginning of the game he may also determine a different number) is the winner.
68149.name: Großer Preis von Deutschland

68150.name: Indiana Jones, Il Gioco
68150.description:
User summary:
The players in the shoes of Indiana Jones trying to collect treasures found in various parts of the world, moving through cards and dice.
The game map divides the world into 5 zones. The players depart from North America, their base, and move on other continents where they are hidden treasures to find.
On every continent there are 3 decks of cards and the last of each deck is a treasure that can be real or false in 2 cases out of three.
The goal of the game is, therefore, to discard the cards placed over the treasure to get to the bottom of the pile and earn the trophy.
The cards are discarded throwing the dice and passing score on the card in various skills, if it not succeeds, the card remains in place.
The more cards you discard the more your skills will increase.
When discovered 4 treasures will be turned into points and the player with most points is the winner.

68151.name: The Flintstones

boardgameversion.21738: La corsa più pazza della preistoria

68151.description:
User summary:
Roll and move race game with cartoon characters...
From back box:
"Everything is ready for departure. Competitors shudder at the wheel of race cars craziest of prehistory.
Here deploy robust Flintmobile , the fast Sabertooth, the reliable Rubblemobile and, finally, the agile Rockasaki.
And now are start!
Along the streets of Bedrock City held the most exhilarating race of prehistory. Vehicles from different performance and unplanned stop decided by your passengers, refueling or police checks, will make the race even more enjoyable. But remember that luck is not enough. A bit of strategy may prove decisive.
Is best a fast vehicle that consumes many gasoline or that slow one but never stop? The choice is yours. So are you ready? The craziest race of prehistory is about to begin. Yabba-dabba-doo!

68152.name: I Numeri Incrociati
68152.description:
User summary:
Addition with numbers like Scrabble.
From box:
"I Numeri Incrociati" are for lovers of figures and calculations that are the crossword puzzles for fans of the vocabulary.
The principle is simple: to achieve, adding the chips numbered one or more of the numbers from the cards drawn at random at the beginning of the game.
At the billboard can cross because each successive combinations can be achieved either horizontally or vertically.

68153.name: Campionato Mondiale Formula Uno
68153.description:
User summary:
Roll and move race game of the early '70.
From rules:
Contestants will choose their cars and take the card boxes and card run.
Will proceed in turn by moving their marker on the track, every move you will throw 2 dice and the number obtained will happen what happens on their card race (eg wildfire: stop for 2 shifts, skidding: advance 2 spaces ...).
If the dice roll indicates the stop in the pits the player must stop at the next garage space on the track and throw a dice to see the consequences (eg, oil change: stop a turn; tire change: advance 2 spaces, etc..)
Win the race who will cut the finish line first.
It's possible can make an entire season of 15 Grand Prix.

68154.name: Campionato Mondiale di Motociclismo
68154.description:
User summary:
Roll and move race game about Moto GP of early '70.
From rules:
At the game can participate from 2 to 5 competitors.
The entire route is divided into 25 fractions by 10 km each. Players will proceed on the track throwing the dice, whose numbers indicate the gear on the vehicle, 6 indicates a stop (not moving).
Before you start you have put along the track the employees to pit which will, to player who stops in the vicinity, the chances of mechanical failure to his bike.
The "Campionato Mondiale di Motociclismo"will be held in several Grands Prix each of which will be ongoing in the 125cc category (will be held at 1 lap), 350cc (to be played in 2 turns) and 500cc (to be played in 3 rounds).

68155.name: Superheroes INC. Arcanos
68155.description:
From the introduction:
Superheroes Inc. is a spanish role playing game that was published first in 1994. In Spain, it was the first role playing game of superheroes, with a comic-book style.

The game system in Superheroes Inc. is the percentual system, based on the original idea from the american Basic Role-Playing system.

Superheroes Inc. describes a complete universe of superheroes and supervillains, secret organizations and cosmic entities. Altogether with an original ambientation placed in Europe, specifically in Spain.

The systems describes the following types of superheroes or metahumans:

* Inhumans
* Avenging
* Arcanes
* Mutants
* Gods
* Technohumans

For each of this types, a basic book was published, containing the core rules and additional information for the type of superheroe described. This is Superheroes INC. Arcanes. Arcanes are normal humans which have devotes their lifes to the study of the Ocult Knowledge. They can use secret and unique spells and control elemental forces. They must control the Magic Energy, spending years to this knowledge and wisdom.


Superhéroes Inc. es un juego de rol español publicado por primera vez en 1994. Fue, en España, el primer juego de rol de superhéroes, con un formato e ilustraciones estilo comic-book.

El sistema de juego utilizado en Superhéroes Inc. es el conocido sistema porcentual, basado en la idea original del sistema estadounidense conocido como Basic Role-Playing.

En Superhéroes Inc. se presenta todo un universo propio de superhéroes y supervillanos, así como organizaciones secretas y entidades cósmicas. Todo ello desde una perspectiva original, ya que la mayoría de las aventuras y tramas, se desarrollaban en Europa y más concretamente en España. El sistema detalla los siguientes tipos de personajes, cada uno con sus listas de poderes y características:

* Inhumanos
* Justicieros
* Arcanos
* Mutantes
* Dioses
* Tecnificados

Para cada uno de los tipos, se publicó un manual básico conteniendo las reglas básicas comunes más algún material adicional para un tipo concreto de personaje. Este es Superheroes INC. Arcanos. Los Arcanos son humanos normales que han dedicado su vida al estudio del Saber Oculto. Pueden utilizar hechizos secretos y controlar fuerzas elementales. Los Arcanos deben manejar la Energía Mágica, dedicando años al saber y el conocimiento.

68157.description:
In Ach Du Lieber Biber, beavers are surfing the waves of the icy river towards the waterfall, but while they do so, they have to beware of the floating junk and other surfers. The player who lets the fewest beavers tip over the waterfall wins the game.

In more detail, the players place the water cylinders on the river and randomly organize the surfing beavers and junk markers on top of them. They take turns rolling a "surfing die" to determine whether they have to progress the water level, with the aid of a wooden lodge across the river, towards the edge of the waterfall.
68157.name: Ach Du Lieber Biber

68158.name: Superheroes INC. Inhumanos
68158.description:
From the introduction:
Superheroes Inc. is a spanish role playing game that was published first in 1994. In Spain, it was the first role playing game of superheroes, with a comic-book style. The game system in Superheroes Inc. is the percentual system, based on the original idea from the american Basic Role-Playing system.

Superheroes Inc. describes a complete universe of superheroes and supervillains, secret organizations and cosmic entities. Altogether with an original ambientation placed in Europe, specifically in Spain. The systems describes the following types of superheroes or metahumans:
* Inhumans
* Avenging
* Arcanes
* Mutants
* Gods
* Technohumans

For each of this types, a basic book was published, containing the core rules and additional information for the type of superheroe described. This is Superheroes INC. Inhumans. Inhumans are beings not considered humans, like aliens or parahumans. Gods and Cosmic Heroes are not included in this group, because they are very different from the rest of alien races. In our planet, well hidden, several humanoid races are living: Dorkan, Terrans, Guímoran, Ursins, Atlanteans and Tes-Khar.
--------------------------------------------------------------
De la introducción:

Superhéroes Inc. es un juego de rol español publicado por primera vez en 1994. Fue, en España, el primer juego de rol de superhéroes, con un formato e ilustraciones estilo comic-book. El sistema de juego utilizado en Superhéroes Inc. es el conocido sistema porcentual, basado en la idea original del sistema estadounidense conocido como Basic Role-Playing.

En Superhéroes Inc. se presenta todo un universo propio de superhéroes y supervillanos, así como organizaciones secretas y entidades cósmicas. Todo ello desde una perspectiva original, ya que la mayoría de las aventuras y tramas, se desarrollaban en Europa y más concretamente en España.

El sistema detalla los siguientes tipos de personajes, cada uno con sus listas de poderes y características:
* Inhumanos
* Justicieros
* Arcanos
* Mutantes
* Dioses
* Tecnificados

Para cada uno de los tipos, se publicó un manual básico conteniendo las reglas básicas comunes más algún material adicional para un tipo concreto de personaje. Este es Superheroes INC. Inhumanos. Los Inhumanos son seres que nos se consideran humanos, tales como alienígenas y parahumanos. No se encuadran dentro de este grupo ni a dioses ni a héroes cósmicos, ya que sus características son muy diferentes del resto de alienígenas. En nuestro planeta, y ocultos existen varias razas humanoides inteligentes: Dorkan, Terranos, Guímoran, Ursinos, Atlantes y Tes-Khar.

68160.name: Superheroes INC. Justicieros
68160.description:
From the introduction:
Superheroes Inc. is a spanish role playing game that was published first in 1994. In Spain, it was the first role playing game of superheroes, with a comic-book style.

The game system in Superheroes Inc. is the percentual system, based on the original idea from the american Basic Role-Playing system.

Superheroes Inc. describes a complete universe of superheroes and supervillains, secret organizations and cosmic entities. Altogether with an original ambientation placed in Europe, specifically in Spain.

The systems describes the following types of superheroes or metahumans:

* Inhumans
* Avenging
* Arcanes
* Mutants
* Gods
* Technohumans

For each of this types, a basic book was published, containing the core rules and additional information for the type of superheroe described. This is Superheroes INC. Avenging. These are civilians motivated by a personal tragedy, and disappointed by authorities and justice, decided to solve it by themselves. They don't have the prejudices of other Superheroes when they have to get rid of criminals and are experts in the use of firearms and martial arts.


Superhéroes Inc. es un juego de rol español publicado por primera vez en 1994. Fue, en España, el primer juego de rol de superhéroes, con un formato e ilustraciones estilo comic-book.

El sistema de juego utilizado en Superhéroes Inc. es el conocido sistema porcentual, basado en la idea original del sistema estadounidense conocido como Basic Role-Playing.

En Superhéroes Inc. se presenta todo un universo propio de superhéroes y supervillanos, así como organizaciones secretas y entidades cósmicas. Todo ello desde una perspectiva original, ya que la mayoría de las aventuras y tramas, se desarrollaban en Europa y más concretamente en España. El sistema detalla los siguientes tipos de personajes, cada uno con sus listas de poderes y características:

* Inhumanos
* Justicieros
* Arcanos
* Mutantes
* Dioses
* Tecnificados

Para cada uno de los tipos, se publicó un manual básico conteniendo las reglas básicas comunes más algún material adicional para un tipo concreto de personaje. Este es Superheroes INC. Justicieros. Los Justicieros son ciudadanos que, motivados por una tragedia personal o familiar, y decepcionados con la actuación de las autoridades y la justicia, deciden lanzarse a las calles y solucionar ellos mismos el problema. No tienen los prejuicios de otros Superhéroes a la hora de acabar con los delincuentes y suelen ser expertos en el manejo de todo tipo de armas de fuego y artes marciales.

68161.name: Scoutspelet
68161.description:
This is a pretty blatant (and surely unlicensed) ripoff of Trivial Pursuit.

Everything in the game revolves around scouting. The categories are "Lord & Lady Baden-Powell", "International", "Events and places", "Swedish history and now", and "Literature and misc". Players roll dice to move pawns around the board and ask questions related to the category-space upon which they land. The goal of the game is to get point-pieces by landing on the prime space for the category and correctly answering a question in that category. The goal is to get point-pieces in all of the categories and then answer a final quesion from a category chosen by the opponents.

68162.name: Harbinger
68162.description:
A cooperative or competitive fantasy role-playing board game, the goal of which is to bring about or stop the Armageddon that will destroy the kingdom. The alignment of the characters chosen determines if the players will fight for or against the Great Evil that threatens to destroy the land.

Players explore the modular map board, revealing tiles as they go. Gameplay is primarily driven through adventure cards in which monsters are fought, treasure is found, quests are solved, and clues are uncovered that can narrow down the identity of the Great Evil. The climax of the game occurs when the identity of the Great Evil is revealed and the final battle is fought which will determine the fate of the Kingdom.

68163.name: Superheroes INC. Mutantes
68163.description:
From the introduction:
Superheroes Inc. is a spanish role playing game that was published first in 1994. In Spain, it was the first role playing game of superheroes, with a comic-book style.

The game system in Superheroes Inc. is the percentual system, based on the original idea from the american Basic Role-Playing system.

Superheroes Inc. describes a complete universe of superheroes and supervillains, secret organizations and cosmic entities. Altogether with an original ambientation placed in Europe, specifically in Spain.

The systems describes the following types of superheroes or metahumans:

* Inhumans
* Avenging
* Arcanes
* Mutants
* Gods
* Technohumans

For each of this types, a basic book was published, containing the core rules and additional information for the type of superheroe described. This is Superheroes INC. Mutants. Humans are considered mutants when they have relevant alterations in their DNA. These alterations produce extraordinary powers in these individuals. There can be several causes for these mutations, but they can be clasified in two groups: genetic or induced. In the first group mutation is caused by an error in the replication of the DNA. In the second group is caused by an external agent.


Superhéroes Inc. es un juego de rol español publicado por primera vez en 1994. Fue, en España, el primer juego de rol de superhéroes, con un formato e ilustraciones estilo comic-book.

El sistema de juego utilizado en Superhéroes Inc. es el conocido sistema porcentual, basado en la idea original del sistema estadounidense conocido como Basic Role-Playing.

En Superhéroes Inc. se presenta todo un universo propio de superhéroes y supervillanos, así como organizaciones secretas y entidades cósmicas. Todo ello desde una perspectiva original, ya que la mayoría de las aventuras y tramas, se desarrollaban en Europa y más concretamente en España. El sistema detalla los siguientes tipos de personajes, cada uno con sus listas de poderes y características:

* Inhumanos
* Justicieros
* Arcanos
* Mutantes
* Dioses
* Tecnificados

Para cada uno de los tipos, se publicó un manual básico conteniendo las reglas básicas comunes más algún material adicional para un tipo concreto de personaje. Este es Superheroes INC. Mutantes. Se consideran mutantes a todos aquellos individuos que tienen alteraciones significativas en su ADN. Esto produce la aparición de poderes extraordinarios en estos individuos. Las causas de la mutación de un individuo pueden ser diversas, pero pueden agruparse de forma general en dos: genéticas e inducidas. En los primeros la mutación se produce por un error en la replicación del ADN, en los segundos la alteración del ADN se produce por un factor externo.

68164.name: Fibonacci's Trump
68164.description:
Fibonacci's Trump is a basic trump/trick-taking card game.

Collect tricks through playing cards depending on the color that is led, using the trump color when able. Points are determined by the symbols on the cards: the number of the symbols that is the same as the Symbol Indicator collected determines how many points you are awarded each round.

Scoring uses Fibonacci's numbers... so the more symbols you collect, the better off you are.

First player to 144 wins.

68166.name: Mutant R.Y.M.D
68166.description:
Mutant R.Y.M.D takes place in our solar system in the year of 2192, in a high technologic reality where man no longer is alone - a dark and destructive force, the Evil, has manifested itself in the outer limits of the solar system to destroy the human society. With hordes of undead legions of twisted beings, with dark technology, mysterious mental forces and malicious infiltrators in the corporations committees, it strives to the center of the solar system to suffocate the sun and enslave humanity.

The world of 2192 is a grateful breeding ground for the Evil's message. In the bottom of society terror, crime and madness thrive even without the intervention of the Evil's cultists. Eternal wars between the corporates is fought in Mercury's underground worlds, in Venus' black ocean depths, on ice cold polar caps and in damp jungles, on Mars' burning plains and in Uranus' gas landscapes.

This is a world for the strong, the faithful, the proud and the honourable. This is a world for heroes.

68167.name: Superheroes INC. Gods
68167.description:
From the introduction:
Superheroes Inc. is a spanish role playing game that was published first in 1994. In Spain, it was the first role playing game of superheroes, with a comic-book style.

The game system in Superheroes Inc. is the percentual system, based on the original idea from the american Basic Role-Playing system.

Superheroes Inc. describes a complete universe of superheroes and supervillains, secret organizations and cosmic entities. Altogether with an original ambientation placed in Europe, specifically in Spain.

The systems describes the following types of superheroes or metahumans:

* Inhumans
* Avenging
* Arcanes
* Mutants
* Gods
* Technohumans

For each of this types, a basic book was published, containing the core rules and additional information for the type of superheroe described. This is Superheroes INC. Gods. Gods are beings from other dimensions that in the past were worshiped by humankind. These days they have lost, to some extent, this function. But some of them don't want to resign themselves to abandon humankind and are still among us. Another possibility is that they are messengers of these beings and that their nature has been transformed to acomplish their mission. Some of them, owe their power to the intervention of cosmic entities (Cosmic Heroes)


Superhéroes Inc. es un juego de rol español publicado por primera vez en 1994. Fue, en España, el primer juego de rol de superhéroes, con un formato e ilustraciones estilo comic-book.

El sistema de juego utilizado en Superhéroes Inc. es el conocido sistema porcentual, basado en la idea original del sistema estadounidense conocido como Basic Role-Playing.

En Superhéroes Inc. se presenta todo un universo propio de superhéroes y supervillanos, así como organizaciones secretas y entidades cósmicas. Todo ello desde una perspectiva original, ya que la mayoría de las aventuras y tramas, se desarrollaban en Europa y más concretamente en España. El sistema detalla los siguientes tipos de personajes, cada uno con sus listas de poderes y características:

* Inhumanos
* Justicieros
* Arcanos
* Mutantes
* Dioses
* Tecnificados

Para cada uno de los tipos, se publicó un manual básico conteniendo las reglas básicas comunes más algún material adicional para un tipo concreto de personaje. Este es Superheroes INC. Dioses. Los dioses son seres provenientes de otras dimensiones a los que en un pasado los hombres adoraban. En los tiempos que corren han perdido, en gran medida, esa función. Pero muchos de ellos no se resignan a abandonar a la humanidad y continúan entre nosotros. Otra posibilidad es que se trate de mensajeros de estos seres, que parten de una naturaleza humana que ha sido transformada con el fin de llevar a cabo su misión. Algunos de ellos, deben su poder al concurso de entidades cósmicas (Héroes Cósmicos).

68169.name: Superheroes INC. Tecnificados
68169.description:
From the introduction:
Superheroes Inc. is a spanish role playing game that was published first in 1994. In Spain, it was the first role playing game of superheroes, with a comic-book style.

The game system in Superheroes Inc. is the percentual system, based on the original idea from the american Basic Role-Playing system.

Superheroes Inc. describes a complete universe of superheroes and supervillains, secret organizations and cosmic entities. Altogether with an original ambientation placed in Europe, specifically in Spain.

The systems describes the following types of superheroes or metahumans:

* Inhumans
* Avenging
* Arcanes
* Mutants
* Gods
* Technohumans

For each of this types, a basic book was published, containing the core rules and additional information for the type of superheroe described. This is Superheroes INC. Technohumans. They are called that because the source of their powers is high technology. In the Age of Technology, development in warfare has enabled humans to become a weapon themselves. There is no need anymore to get the last weapon. Now you can get it integrated in yourself.



Superhéroes Inc. es un juego de rol español publicado por primera vez en 1994. Fue, en España, el primer juego de rol de superhéroes, con un formato e ilustraciones estilo comic-book.

El sistema de juego utilizado en Superhéroes Inc. es el conocido sistema porcentual, basado en la idea original del sistema estadounidense conocido como Basic Role-Playing.

En Superhéroes Inc. se presenta todo un universo propio de superhéroes y supervillanos, así como organizaciones secretas y entidades cósmicas. Todo ello desde una perspectiva original, ya que la mayoría de las aventuras y tramas, se desarrollaban en Europa y más concretamente en España. El sistema detalla los siguientes tipos de personajes, cada uno con sus listas de poderes y características:

* Inhumanos
* Justicieros
* Arcanos
* Mutantes
* Dioses
* Tecnificados

Para cada uno de los tipos, se publicó un manual básico conteniendo las reglas básicas comunes más algún material adicional para un tipo concreto de personaje. Este es Superheroes INC. Tecnificados. Son llamados así, porque la fuente de sus poderes es la alta tecnología. En la Era de la Tecnología el desarrollo de la guerra ha llevado hasta los propios humanos la posibilidad de convertirse a ellos mismos en un arma. Ya no es necesario disponer de un subfusil último modelo ni de un lanzagranadas. Ahora todo esto se puede encontrar integrado en uno mismo.

68170.name: Operation Kirkwood
68170.description:
From the Back of the Book: "There shall be a day when brother betrays brother, when greed and hunger shall set aside loyalty and friendship. A man will betray his people and in his path death and suffering will follow. All of this shall be a part of Dark Symmetry's evil web." - extract from the eleventh prophecy.

User Info: This book bears a primitive version of the Mutant Chronicles' logo, however the adventure actually uses Mutant R.Y.M.D's game rules. On the back of the book, in the fine prints, it says: "OBS! You need a copy of the Mutant R.Y.M.D role playing game to play this adventure.".

68171.name: Der Mueller
68171.description:
From the back of the box:

Nestled deep in the Black Forest of Bavaria lay the town of Shoental. Although the villagers worked hard, the village remained in poverty, because the domination of the dragon Gruenaugen. Gruenaugen demanded half of all goods produced by the village, or the villagers would face destruction from the dragon's wrath. Many a young lad had set forth to slay the dragon, never to return.

The young town miller(der Mueller) spent many hours thinking about the plight of his town. He knew that previous attempts to destroy the dragon by force had been fruitless. He also knew that Gruenaugen loved games, as all dragons feel they are intellectually superior. He invented a game that only the cleverest would win and confronted the dragon with a deal: freedom of the village if der Mueller won, or enslavement of der Mueller if Gruenaugen won. Gruenaugen, feeling he was superior, naturally accepted.

Der Mueller facest the hardest test of his life but overwhelmed the dragon with his strategy and won. Der Mueller returned to the village a hero. Gruenaugen was never seen again.

A strategy game for two players. The object of the game is to capture 5 of your opponent's gems. Each player starts with 8 gems and tries to complete trios to capture theur opponent's gems by placing their gems on the board during phase one, sliding their gems during phase two, and picking up and moving their gems during phase three.

Re-Implements:

Nine Men's Morris

68172.name: X vs Y
68172.description: This is a trivia game of men versus women in which all the questions are based around gender and have numerical responses. Each team answers questions about the opposite gender in regards to love, life, work, appearance, etc. Women could be asked: What percent of men report cheating on their taxes? Men could be asked: On average, how many pairs of shoes does a woman own? Teams attempt to place several cards in order from least to greatest based upon their guessed answers. Packaged inside is an electronic card scanner with automatic scoring (no more cheating here) and an adjustable volume. This electronic base communicates with players throughout the game, so there is no need for an instruction booklet.

68173.name: Rat Zvijezda
68173.description:
Rat Zvijezda (Star Wars) is croatian published game which puts the players in the role of Imperator {Emperor Palpatine}, Darth Vader, Han Solo or Luke Skywalker.
Each character controls one of the powers from the last three parts of Star Wars trilogy - Imperial Fleet (Imperator) and Death Star (Vader) vs. Millenium Eagle {Millenium Falcon} (Solo) and Hoth (Luke).

Armies are composed of fighter squadrons, foot soldiers, cannons and famous allies from series. Combat is conducted primarily through series of dogfights and landing and invading opponent bases. Of course, force duels are present as well.

68174.name: Snack Factory
68174.description:
Donuts, chocolate, and chips!

In Snack Factory it’s up to you to keep the world supplied with their favorite snacks. In each round you will need to balance profit and sales while maximizing productivity to stay ahead of the competition.

Think you have what it takes? Reach for a delicious snack and try your hand at running the best snack factory!

Snack Factory incorporates a climbing style card game with clever scoring mechanics to give players interesting and challenging decisions!

(Publisher Blurb)

68175.name: Audubonopoly
68175.description: It's Monopoly with the theme of the town of Audubon NJ. The game use local stores on the game board.The game was a fundraiser fo the local sports teams, The Green Wave.

68176.name: Dragon Annual 1
68176.description:
Contents

The AD&D game by Steve Winter
Ecology of the Wyvern by Spike Y. Jones
Dungeon Adventures: Wyrmsmere by Christopher Perkins
Arcane Lore: Scrolls of the Ice Mage by Anne W. Davis
Bazaar of the Bizarre: Strange Armor by Michael Lambert
Dragon's Bestiary: Monsters of the Underdark by Keith A Strohm
Rogues Gallery: In Silver Shadows by Elaine Cunningham
Campaign Classics: The Scro by Roger E. Moore
(Forgotten Realms) Gem of the North by Steven Schend (intro by Ed Greenwood)
(Dragonlance Fifth Age) Between the Ages by Douglas Niles (intro by Harold Johnson)
(Ravenloft) Vampires A—Z by William W. Connors
(Greyhawk) Beyond the Flanaess by Skip Williams
(Planescape) A Handful of Keys by Robert R. Prager (intro by Ray Vallese)
(Birthright) Guild of Cerilia by Ed Stark (intro by Carrie A. Bebris)
(Dark Sun) Heroes of Athas by Ed Bonny (intro by Bill Slavicsek)
(Dragon Dice) Allies by Bill Olmesdahl
(Spellfire) Deckbuilding Revisited by Jim Butler
The Dragon Gallery

68177.name: Dédalo
68177.description:
In this game two armies clash and the only thing that will discourage them is the fact of losing their king in battle. All the king’s men will fight to death for him, regardless of the fact that even the king is a fierce fighter.
This last battle takes place in a very strange land, long tunnels that are always changing to confuse anyone that wanders in them.

With similar mechanics as in “NiMeMo” you have to move your army around the board and try to eliminate your opponent’s pieces by blocking them.
As soon as you eliminate the other’s king you win.

Dédalo (in Spanish) comes from Daedalus. In Greek mythology Daedalus was a skilful craftsman and artisan. The Labyrinth on Crete was created by him.
So as in this game we have an ever-changing labyrinth I decided to give it Daedalus’ name on his honour.

68179.name: Shinsengumi: Ikedaya-sodo
68179.description:
On June 8th, 1864, in Kyoto, there was a very famous sword-action between Shinsengumi and Kinnoh-rohshi. Yes, it was Ikedaya.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ikedaya_Incident

It was rumored that the most radical group of Kinnoh-rohshi had planned to kidnap Komei-emperor from Kyoto while they set up fires around Kyoto-city.
Shinsengumi, the patrol group hired by Edo-bakuhu decided to assault the Kinnoh-rohshi's meeting before the final moment. They found the meeting at Ikedaya.

This is a small postcard game. It was distributed on A-game shop's yearend-yearopening campaign between 2009 and 2010.
Basically this game uses the same game engine as 47 Ronin. Each player take action by one of his stack alternatively. Each stack can move and then fight to adjacent enemy stack. This is chess-like puzzle movement. A goes to attack B to open the path. But, the enemy moves C to defend the path just opened. And so on.
Also, if you have issue #1 of Wargame Japanese History, you can use counters from Shinsengumi Chronicle for this game.

Though this is a small game, it is filled with puzzle-like tactics and excitement of swordplay.

updated
This game is reprinted as a second game of Wargame Japanese History #27.

68180.name: Wallis's New Game of Universal History and Chronology
68180.description:
'Locomotive Game'

This game from 1840 is a reworked issue of the 1814 edition of the game and the central area of the game has been updated to reflect later historical events.

The racing track comprises of 143 circles, starting with Adam & Eve and ending with a railway train.

boardgamehonor.13896: 2011 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee

68182.description:
In the middle of the 1930s, an expedition of treasure hunters crashes its zeppelin in the middle of an unknown and mysterious island where legends tell that several old and powerful civilizations have left many sumptuous treasures.

Each player is one of these brave explorers who joined the expedition with old maps giving clues on where some of these treasures can be found. However, it is clear that the land is barely known and dangerous, so, all explorers decide to travel together, in one solid group by hiring beasts of burden and exotic items in the native villages while trying to avoid the many dangers of the inhospitable land of Isla Dorada...

Which one of these brave explorers will find the most valuable treasures, avoid the numerous curses and accomplish it's rewarding destiny?

In Isla Dorada, players will have to move a unique pawn portraying the expedition of explorers. Each player will collect cards of different kinds (movements, actions, destinations, curses, destinies, bonus or malus cards) and will have to build the best hands turn after turn (time is limited to a certain number of game turns) to be able to chose the expedition destinations in a succession of bids and negotiations. Doing so, the players will try to put their hands on treasures while avoiding their cursed destinations and trying to block other player's objectives.

The very easy rules can be learned in a few minutes whilst the rich and elegant game play assure an always renewed experience.
68182.name: Isla Dorada

68183.name: I am a Sports Hero
68183.description:
From the Website:

Roleplaying one of the worst comic ideas ever.

User Summary:

Characters are stereotypical superhero sportsmen that stereotypically battle stereotypical supervillains.

This small game's rules include a brief overview of the types of sporthero, a simple mechanism for resolving random actions using dice, using "snappy banter" (as a hero) or "evil parlance" (as a villain) to take control of narration, and random charts for exceptionally bad and good events.

68185.name: Cubes
68185.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Roleplaying at the Office

Tangibles

Pencils and paper and a standard deck of playing cards without Jokers. I recommend a deck of cards with a corporate logo. If you really want, you could make a poker deck with business cards and some markers.

Meeting Prep

Your Employee possesses three Assets which have point values. You get three points to divide among them (zero being a valid Asset).

Each of these Assets has a countering trait, called a Liability. Each Liability's value is always (4 - countering Asset).

Issues

To start, you grab five cards. You can never have more than five cards in your hand at one time. If you are told to draw more cards, you discard cards of your choice down to five.

There is no GM. This is simply a game of Employees trying to stay sane and under the radar of upper management. In fact, an Employee can't even lose her job unless she quits or does something absolutely drastic and strange. She'll most likely keep getting demoted until she's stuck in the basement with leveraged hardware from the 80's.

Whoever has the best hand gets to introduce the first Issue to the Employees. Try something simple at first, like a broken printer. The winner's Hand is placed face up in the center of the table. Everyone else discards their Hands.

Starting with the person on the winner's left, and proceeding clockwise, each Player concocts some method to solve the Issue. Friendly and cordial groups may ignore turns and simply freeform roleplay until a good solution is found.

When you have a solution, decide which Asset or Liability best fits your approach. What you do next depends on whether you are using an Asset or Liability.

68186.description:
This is it, Boys, we're going in...

The “Go Code” has been received and the war plan decoded; it is time to turn your B-52 into Soviet air space, and head for your primary target. You’ve got 50,000 lbs. of fuel, two H-bombs, a crew looking to you for leadership, and a mission that your country needs you to fulfill.

Toe-to-Toe Nu’klr Combat with the Rooskies is a fast-playing solitaire game. You decide the payload, pick your targets and must then challenge the Soviet Union's defenses.

SAMs (surface-to-air missiles) and Soviet Air Defense fighter/ interceptors will find you as you cross “The Big Board.” Events will relentlessly dog you and your crew as the fate of America, even the world, rests on your shoulders. A single mission can be accomplished in about 15 minutes, or take an hour for the whole campaign game. Take a darkly humorous trip in a less-than-serious game exploding with atomic fun.

BATTLESSON™ Game #8.

Game Data:
Complexity: 2.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 9 on a 9 scale
Scale: Fly a B-52 across the Soviet Union. Each turn represents approximately 30 minutes.

Game Components:
• One 4-page, color Rules booklet with 4 scenarios and Advanced Rules included
• 28 color, die-cut 5/8” round mounted pieces
• One 8.5” x 11” color "Big Board" game map with flight controls
• One 5.5" x 4.25" color player aid mat
• 20 Event cards
• 1 BATTLESSON™ sheet
• Part of an introductory wargame series!
68186.name: Toe-to-Toe Nu'klr Combat with the Rooskies

boardgamehonor.21112: 2011 Charles S. Roberts Best Post-Napoleonic to Pre-World War 2 Era Board Wargame Nominee

68187.description:
Microbadges:


Tattered Flags is a series of Kriegspiel-style historical miniatures/board game depicting battles of the American Civil War (1861-1865). In this first game in the series, each player controls a Union or Confederate force at the Battle of Gettysburg, struggling for The Wheatfield on July 2nd, 1863. Gettysburg: The Wheatfield was carefully crafted to introduce players to system basics of organization, events, maneuver, fire and morale, with future games in this series promising to expand the detail and accuracy of the Tattered Flags system.

Since many players do not have the time, funds or eyesight to paint armies of miniature figures, Tattered Flags comes with colorful cardboard counters, called “Stands” (in the vernacular of miniatures gaming). These games also use a printed battlefield game map in lieu of miniature trees, hills, buildings, etc. Feel free to substitute miniature figures if desired!

There are three scenarios included in Gettysburg: The Wheatfield, each with its own Order of Battle (OOB), Special Rules, Turn Length and Victory Condition. The first scenario is introductory in complexity and is used when someone is first learning and playing the game. The second scenario is the historical scenario depicting the actual fighting that occurred during the afternoon of July 2nd. The final scenario is a dramatic, “what-if” meeting engagement battle.

Game Data:
Complexity: 5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 7 on a 9 scale
Scale: 1 inch = 50 yards; each Stand is approximately 150 men or 3-4 cannon; each turn represents a variable amount of time, perhaps 15 to 20 minutes or so

Game Components:
• One 12 page color rules booklet with lots of illustrated examples
• One 4 page scenarios booklet
• 60 color, die-cut 1" x 1/2" Stands
• 60 color, die-cut 1/2" square markers
• 8 color, die-cut 5/8" x 1.25" Leader pieces
• 1 beautiful, full color game map
• 20 Event cards
• 2 Player Aid sheets
• 1 Game Turn track
• 1 Movement measuring tool
• 1 Combat measuring tool
68187.name: Gettysburg: The Wheatfield

boardgamehonor.21176: 2010 Charles S. Roberts Best Desktop Published (DTP) / Print-and-Play / Postcard Game Nominee

68188.description:
The Wars of the French Revolution, 1789-1802

States of SiegeTM #5

This solitaire game, suitable for group and classroom cooperative game play, tells the story of the French Revolution through its key events and decision points. You must stop the advances of foreign armies and the counter-revolutionary forces within France itself to defend the virtues of Republicanism.

Can you suppress the forces of Monarchy and Despotism to maintain the Republican spirit in France? Can you export the revolution by liberating neighboring states and granting them their liberty? Will you be able to keep order in Paris as it suffers from riot after riot? Enlist today, grab your musket and a banner, and join the Levée en Masse!

Game Data:
Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 9 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit is one Army, each turn represents a variable number of weeks

Game Components:
• One 6-page, color Game Rules booklet
• 12 color, die-cut 3/4” square game pieces
• Five 5/8“ round game markers
• 48 Headline cards (2" x 3")
• One 11” x 17” color game map
• Designers Notes
• Optional Rules
68188.name: Levée en Masse

68190.description:
The Circus Train Expansion Kit includes everything you need to expand the game to accommodate 3, 4 or even 5 players! Strategic planning is even more important as the competition can be fierce. In addition to the new rules for scoring and supporting the new players, the game also includes a new Action card for each player, a new Event card, and lots of new Talent and Performance counters. Four new special characters are also included in the Optional Rules.

Note, the Circus Train Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of Circus Train to use this expansion kit.

Game Data:
Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 5 on a 9 scale
Scale: Weekly turns; bi-monthly pay days and one performance city per turn.

Game Components:
• One color Rules sheet
• 24 Action cards
• 5 Overnight Hire cards
• 1 Event card
• 24 Performance counters
• 3 Circus Train markers
• 28 Talent counters
• 6 Victory Point counters
• 9 Best Performance Score counters
• 3 Reputation Value counters
• 3 Two Week Show markers
• 10 Event card support markers
68190.name: Circus Train Expansion Kit

68191.name: Heavy Metal
68191.description:
User Summary:

The Heavy Metal roleplaying game box set contains everything needed to start playing. It includes empty character sheets and three books:

- "Style de jeu et scénarios" covers the game background, the rules system and scenarios. The game system is rather simple (stats multiplied by a skill level give a percentage change of success). The background describes a dystopian near-future society, where the rich nations of the north live off the resources of the impoverished south and the northern citizens, brainwashed by the omnipresent entertainment Networks live in xenophobic fear of "Southern Terrorists". Characters can either be U.R.C. (Unité de Répression Cybernétique), robotic cops who are judge, jury and executioners, or "Egarés" (the Lost), rebels using their meager resources trying to escape URCs and uncover the truth behind the mysterious Hopson Plan.
The book includes 4 scenarios, "London Leatherboys", "Twist & Shoot", "Bad Religion" and "Le Père Noêl est une ordure".

- "Les Egarés" focuses on the Lost. The book contains character and group creation rules (players create their character as well as the group they belong to, its ideology, financial resources, outside contacts, safe houses...) , a presentation of several rebel groups (ecowarriors, neofascists, hackers, TV show hooligans, cultists, communists...) and a list of equipment (guns, vehicles, broadcasting equipment...)

- "Les U.R.C." describes the Cybernetic Repression Units. It includes chapter about character creation (type chassis, organic or cybernetic brain, choice of software...), roleplaying tips for U.R.C. characters, a description of laws and justice in the Northern Block, and details about the Hopson Plan.

68193.name: Ecran (Heavy Metal)
68193.description:
User Summary:

The Gamemaster screen for Heavy Metal contains a 4 panels screen and an eight pages stapled book with a scenario for U.R.C. players, "Larmes de Star".

68194.name: Courts & Corsets
68194.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Premise

Courts & Corsets seeks to reproduce the intrigue involved in such films as Amadeus and Dangerous Liasons. The goal of the players is to collectively tell a tragic and melodramatic story.

Bidding

The rules of Courts & Corsets rely entirely on a bidding process, by which players are able to influence play with an ever-dwindling resource. In this game, the tokens used for bidding are called Crowns no matter what physical piece is actually used during play. You may use any type of tokens to bid with, provided all players possess the ability to hide their tokens during a bid.

When a bid is called for, the bidding players must secretly select a number of Crowns from their available cache. Once all bidding players have done so, all must fairly display their amount. The highest bidder is considered the winner, and all Crowns bid by winner and losers are discarded (and are unavailable to the players until their caches are legally replenished). Ties are broken by the winning players conducting a second bid, or however many more bids are required to achieve a single winner.

If a situation arises where levels of triumph are needed, the player with the highest bid obtains the best goal, descending bids until the lowest bid achieves the worst result. Ties during these bids are resolved as aforementioned.

68196.name: Narrator's Journal
68196.description:
From the publisher:

The Blue Rose Narrator's Journal is a 35-page PDF designed to assist narrators in planning and organizing their campaigns and adventures. Packed with page after page of forms, the Narrator's Journal is custom-designed to make creating narrator characters, creatures, organizations, and adventures easier.

The forms in this PDF include:

Major Narrator Characters: Three pages on which you can record not only important game information but also details about the character's relationships -- to both the player character heroes and other narrator characters in the campaign -- and roleplaying notes, memorable appearances in the campaign, and minions or servants of the character.
Locations: Map out important locations in the campaign, prepare encounters, and record important events on two pages.
Shadowgates: Keep track of the shadowgates in your campaign, including their locations, appearances, and player knowledge of the gates.
Adventure Outline: Plan each encounter, the highs and lows, and important details of an upcoming adventure.
Adventure/Narrator Review: With this form the players can provide the narrator with feedback so that the narrator can learn what his players like and don?t like about the campaign. This form can be invaluable in steering a campaign in a direction that will make everyone happy.




Plus many more forms, including pages designed for creating new arcana, creatures, weapons, feats, and almost anything else you?ll want to add to your Blue Rose campaign.

68197.name: Patient 13
68197.description:
From the publisher blurb:

You will find in this book
- a short game system, simple and new
- a complete description of the hospital and its characters
- "reactive investigations" to adapt following the PCs actions
- game mastering advices
- a 13 episodes campaign
- and above all, a very deep atmosphere !

User summary:
This is the only book needed to play, it has everything a GM needs to start setting up adventures in the world of patient 13. Other books for this games are not planned.

Official website: http://johndoe-rpg.org/p13/

68198.name: Ecran (Stella Inquisitorus)
68198.description:
User Summary:

The gamemaster screen for Stella Inquisitorus contains a four panels screen and a sixteen pages stapled book with a scenario for angels and stats for 18 spaceships (6 for angels, 6 for demons, 6 for vikings) along with the rules to use them.

68199.description:
Catchup is a simple abstract game with a devilish dynamic. The goal is to have the largest group of stones on the board when the board is full of stones, but as you get closer to winning, your opponent gets more powerful. Whereas most stone-placement games are about position, Catchup is about timing, position, and the interplay between them.

Rules:

1. One player owns the white stones and the other owns the black. White begins by placing 1 stone on any empty space.

2. From then on, starting with black, players take turns. On your turn you may play 1 or 2 stones; 3 if the opponent has just "improved". An "improvement" is taking the lead, extending the lead, or catching up with your opponent's previously leading score.

3. After taking your turn, if the size of your largest group changed, move your pawn to the corresponding spot on the scoring track.

4. The game ends when the board is full. The player with the largest group wins. If the players’ largest groups are the same size, compare their second-largest groups, and so on, until you come to a pair which aren’t the same size. Whoever owns the larger of the two wins.
68199.name: Catchup

68200.name: Notre Tombeau
68200.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This book contains:
- Simple specific rules
- A detailed presentations of all the characters that take part in the story
- Game Mastering advices
- A 12 episodes campaign. Each episodes is meant to last for one or two hours.
- 10 additional encounters and events intended to offer transitions between the investigations.

Additionnal informations:
This book is a stand alone adventure, other publications for this game are not planned.

68201.description:
Topology is an abstract tile placement game. It is played with 52 tiles with double-hex shape. Each of the 2 edges is connected with another edge by a line. There are different combinations of lines, but they never cross.

Before play, one randomly chosen tile is placed in the middle of the table.
Each turn, the players draw 3 tiles and place them on the table adjacent to the tiles already placed. Whenever a ring of lines gets closed, the player who placed the last tile scores points according to the length of the ring.

After all 52 tiles are placed, the player with the highest score is the winner.

AWARDS:

Topology is the 5th winner of the NESTORGAMES continuous abstract game design contest
68201.name: Topology

68202.description:
It's up to you and your ladybug helper to rid your beautiful flower of those pesky aphids.

In this rummy variant, created for families, players collect different sets of coloured ladybugs. For each set laid, your ladybug is moved to a leaf. All aphids that are on that leaf become ladybug lunch and can be removed from your flower. The first player to rid their flower from all the aphids is the winner!
68202.name: Ladybug Lunch

68203.name: Blue Rose Fast Play
68203.description:
User summary:

Freely distributed PDF that highlights the rules to the Blue Rose RPG.


From the introduction:

Blue Rose is a roleplaying game of romantic fantasy, where you and your friends take on the roles of the heroes in this fantastic world. You create your own stories about the champions of Aldis, their triumphs and their tragedies. It is as if you are writing your own fantasy novel where you are the main characters!

Each player assumes the role of a hero from Aldis, except for one player, who takes the role of Narrator. The Narrator describes the action to the other players, and handles the roles of the adversaries and supporting characters in the story, much like the third-person narrator of a novel. Together, the players and the Narrator cooperate to create the story.

You may have played other roleplaying games, or this may be your introduction to new worlds of adventure. Either way, welcome, friends, to the world of Blue Rose.

68204.name: Killing Teknology
68204.description:
User Summary:

Killing Teknology is a catalog of weapons, vehicles and other gear for Heavy Metal. Each item is described on a page, with picture, advertising slogan and game stats. Along with weapons and vehicles, there are surveillance cameras, broadcasting equipment, video games, computers, houses and apartments.

68205.name: Final Frontier
68205.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This book contains a whole, ready to play, 22 episodes adventure.

Additionnal informations:

This game is meant to be a standalone item. A simple game system is included. Other publications for this RPG are not planned.

68206.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 7 - Feb 1991)
68206.description:
(table of content and user summary)

Issue 7 of the WunderWelten magazine, containing:

Editorial
News

Articles, Reports, Fiction
- Thou shall not lie! (on christian replies on RPGs)
- Magischer Monitor (Computer Roleplaying games)
- Weltall in Flammen (Space in flames - on space battles in RPGs and Boardgames)
- Trizeck, an extraterrestrial card game

Traveller
- News
- the journalist as a player character

Car Wars
- Uncle Albert's Arms shop

Fantasy
- generic scenario: Black as night

Battletech:
- ODN-1m Odin (a mech)
- Die lange Flucht (short story)

Miniaturen-Workshop:
- modifying and painting minis

Rezensionen (reviews)
- Literattus Fantasticus (books)
- SpielWelten (RPGs)
- Computerspiele (computer games)

68207.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 8 - Apr 1991)
68207.description:
(table of content and user summary)

Issue 8 of the WunderWelten magazine, containing:

Editorial
News

Articles, Reports, Fiction
- Translations in Computer Games
- Space in Flames part 2
- Battlestar Einstein
- Dogfight computer games

Traveller
.news

Car wars
Großmaul - a mini scenario

Fantasy
universal scenario: black as night part 2

Shadowrun
Böses Erwachen - scenario

DSA
Der Orkenhort - an inn
Fella Fuchshaars Flinke Finger - details on Al'anfa

Battletech
- Attack on St. Andre

Rezensionen (reviews)
- Literattus Fantasticus (books)
- SpielWelten (RPGs)
- Computerspiele (computer games)

68208.name: Hellywood

rpgissuearticle.175661: Linceul de poche: comme un putain de conte de Noël

68208.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This core book contains:
- an original game system based on craps.
- a detailed description of the universe (the city of Heaven Harbor): more than 100 hundred pages, tens of NPCs...
- 8 ready to play playing characters
- two scenarios
- many advices on how to be a game master for this game and set a film-noir mood.

68209.name: Tome of Sorrows Vol. 1: Under the Shadows
68209.description:
User Summary:

A collection of fan-made house rules for the Midnight d20 setting. Published as a 108 page PDF, it covers such topics as:

New human subraces
Commoners as PCs
Prestige classes
New feats
Organizations
Colors of magic
New spells
New magic items
Alternate combat rules
Wilderness survival in Aryth




and more

68210.name: The Prisoner Game
68210.description:
publisher description

This tabletop adventure game is based upon the cult 1960's TV series 'The Prisoner'. The series featured 'Number 6' a former secret agent of the British Government during the Cold War, who is never identified by name. After resigning his position he is abducted and held prisoner in a small, isolated eccentric sea-side resort known only as 'The Village'.

'Card- Board Games' is a new and exciting concept in tabletop adventure games play. From a simple pack of cards you are able to build up a unique playing area from the centre of your dining table. Since the cards are laid strategically then each game you play will be different and pose new challenges for you.

A playing piece and a few counters are all you need to start the game. Its your job to move your playing piece along the paths to the outer limits of the board without other players getting in your way. As the game develops you collect additional cards which will either help you on your way or impede the progress of the other players.

68211.name: Hellywood Screen
68211.description:
User summary:
This screen pack contains a 32 stapled leaflet and a 4 fold A5 GM screen.

The leaflet contains:
- an errata for the core book rules
- additional rules concerning demons invocations
- 16 additional NPCs
- 2 scenerios

68212.name: Cosmic Goldrush
68212.description:
Designer comments:
Cosmic Goldrush is a game where players try to mine for gold and platinum on the asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter. On the always-moving, always-perilous, always-changing belt you got look after your water supplies, as well as yourself. Get stranded too long on an asteroid and you'll find yourself out of the board, quite a lot of poorer than a turn before.

Mine, trade, buy stuff, bug your friends and visit the infamous Space saloon for more new stuff.

68213.name: Forensic, Profiling & Serial Killers
68213.description:
Translated From the back of the book:

Autopsy, fingerprints, criminal psychology, interrogation technique, crisis situations, harvesting and analysis of physical evidence from crime scenes, ... Forensic, Profiling & Serial Killers details the authentic techniques of investigation.

For The Call of Cthulhu, this book helps enacting modern investigators and extends the field of research in contemporary times.
With this knowledge, this book proposes to delve into the intricacies of the psyche of vicious serial killers.

For other investigation RPGs, this book can be taken as a vulgarisation extension concerning investigation techniques.

Forensic, Profiling & Serial Killers is a must-have tool for any game master who wish to write real investigative scenarios. The eleven portraits of characters and twelve profiles of killers are ready to use in your own adventures.

Many anecdotes and case studies are as many sources of inspiration.

68214.name: Virus Wars
68214.description:
Virus Wars is a two-player ancient board game that simulates an evolution of two colonies of viruses, which are growing and absorbing (zombifying) each other. The exact origin of the game is unknown but it was actively played as a paper-and-pencil game in Saint Petersburg State University in 80s. There were several variants of the game with slightly different rules.

Players must make five steps per turn. Each step is either placing a new virus on the board or "zombifying" one of the enemy viruses. The goal of the game is to leave the opponent without legal moves.

68215.name: Tome of Sorrows Vol. 2: The Shadow Ascendant
68215.description:
From the publisher:

Even the Mightiest of all Heroes can Fall...

The Shadow won, but even now, a hundred years after the fall of Erenland to the armies of the North, there are still those who stand their ground and try to undo what careful planning has achieved. But the Shadow is prepared for those called heroes...

The second installment in the Tome of Sorrows series of netbooks for the award winning Midnight setting brings to you new tools and weapons to be used in the name of the Shadow in the North against the insurgence. Inside this book you will find new prestige and legendary classes, a new core class, the Kurasatch Udareen, or mother-wives of Izrador, as well as more than 15 new Villainous Paths, over 30 new creatures and more!

68216.description:
The Front Cover Caption:

The Zombie War Skirmish Miniatures Game

Publisher Web Site Blurb:

Undead Avenue is a new take on the classic "escape from the city" urban Zombie Apocalypse story. You start in a section of downtown sealed off in all directions, maybe by accident, maybe because the government or the police or the National Guard doesn't want anyone, or anything escaping.

Unfortunately that includes you.

Choose your character type and begin your search for weapons,
equipment, allies, and most importantly, a way out. The game has
been designed for individual human miniatures to attempt to escape a zombie infected city. While it can be played as a standalone game, it can also be used as a prelude to the miniatures wargame Undead States of America.
68216.name: Undead Avenue

68217.name: Isengard Sourcebook

rpg.318: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game

68217.description:
From the Back of the Book:

"There is evil afoot in Isengard, and the West is no longer safe."
- Aragorn, "The Two Towers"

Stronghold of Dark Designs...

From the White Hand's lowliest orc to its mightiest general, from Orthanc's deepest chamber to its highest pinnacle, from Saruman's blasting fire to the rings of power crafted by his own hand, the Isengard sourcebook provides everything the Narrator needs to know about this ancient stronghold. Bring this wealth of new challenges to your "The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game" chronicle and let your players pit themselves against this fortress of the fallen Wizard!

The Isengard Sourcebook includes:

- In-depth history stretching back to the days of Isengard's construction by Gondorian master builder Curugond of Lamedon.

- Detailed physical descriptions of the tower of Orthanc, the Ring-wall of Isengard, the labyrinthine caverns beneath both, and many other locations throughout the Wizard's Vale, including 9 full-colour maps.

- Exhaustive statistics for the soldiers, servants, slaves, spies, and more in the employ of the White Hand--including Saruman himself and his inner circle.

- All-new information about the spawning tunnels where Uruk-hai, Half-orcs, and other Orc-spawn are created, including new flaws like Orc-ancestry and Ill-made.

68218.description:
Front Cover Caption:

The Global Expansion to Undead States of America

Publisher Blurb:

While the focus of the core rulebook, Undead States of America, was obviously the United States and North America, the Zombie War is a global one.

This expansion of the basic rules provides new types of terrain for the campaign games, including deserts, swamps, jungles, dense urban populations, and radioactive wastelands.

It also includes detailed maps and rule modifications for other regions on the planet and how to fight the Zombie War raging across the world.
68218.name: Undead Nations

68220.description:
Front Cover Caption:

The Historic Expansion to Undead States of America

Publisher Blurb:

Undead Universe takes a look at the smaller zombie outbreaks throughout time, allowing the players to recreate those earlier battles and playing out the potential undead wars in the past and future.

Undead Universe is intended to be used as an expansion to the core rulebook, Undead States of America. It contains guidelines for zombie wars and outbreaks against ancient armies, medieval armies, the armies of muskets and early rifles, armies in the two World Wars (Nazi Zombies!), and fictional cyberized or powered armor armies of the far future. This book revises how to do the Short Campaign Game in different eras, and introduces a new campaign game where a player fights each major zombie outbreak in history and into the future.
68220.name: Undead Universe

68221.name: The Dungeon Trap Handbook
68221.description:
User Summary:

The "Dungeon Trap Handbook" contains 38 tables for the fantasy game referee to use to roll up random traps for unwary adventurers. It is especially useful for designing on-the-spot traps for a party that has had things too easy up to now. Starting with Table 1, the referee will roll percentile dice, and the result will lead him/her to the next table, the result there will lead to the next table, and so forth for a half-dozen rolls until the trap is complete.

Subsets of the tables can be used to generate the color, smell, taste, and effect of unknown potions or mystical fountains or sacred wells that adventurers are foolish enough to drink from; or they could be used for the effects of magical spells gone awry. A very versatile little booklet.

68223.name: Wildwood
68223.description:
A new area of the Forge.

From the publisher:

The few pockets of humanity scattered throughout this untamed wilderness struggle to survive. Countless hordes of fearsome predators and foul beasts - including the green dragon Mastuu Dargus - freely roam through the twisted, overgrown forests and jungles of Wildwood, preying on the weak and unwary. Yet, concealed within the dense greenery of this heartless domain lies a wealth of undiscovered mysteries and limitless riches for those brave enough to navigate the endless gauntlet of horrifying monsters and lethal dangers. Behind it all is the harsh and cruel master of the lands, Haiel, manipulating all of those within his domain.

The sundered ruins of lost cities and strangely altered patches of wilderness conceal vast and wondrous earthly treasures as well as newfound insight on the world's secrets and the machinations of Haiel. Adventurers seeking to wrest mighty artifacts from their owners and unravel the enigma of this primordial domain must face the frightening denizens lurking within the shattered temples and ominous thickets of these forbidden locales. In Wildwood, one mantra reigns supreme: Survival of the Fittest.

68224.name: Labyrinthine
68224.description: User summary: One player is the Evil Wizard. The Evil Wizard may arrange the sections of the gameboard, representing rooms and hallways, in any way desired. The Evil Wizard places the Princess in the last room. The player(s) representing the questing party wins the game if the Princess can escape from the Evil Wizard. The Evil Wizard player wins by destroying the questing party.

68225.name: Shards of the Stone: Core
68225.description:
Sourcebook containing Fuzion core rules and some setting information for Shards of the Stone.

From the website:

"When the lesser gods were instructed to create Life, they cast their powers into the creation of the mystical CoreStone. This nexus of all of the powers of each of the gods carried within it the perfect symbiosis of passion and reason, of order and chaos, of reality and unreality. It was unparalleled in its beauty and simplicity but became the source of envy among some of the gods and soon became the centrepoint of a grand struggle of gods versus gods.

Soon, the CoreStone shattered, and with it came the devastation of the Core world in the centre of which the CoreStone was entombed. Shards of the Stone were scattered to the poles of the world and great schisms wracked the landscape as mountains fell and lakes rose from their beds to form the peaks of craggy sentinels of the world's distress.

This is the world into which you are entering. This is the conflict that you will soon become an active participant... or victim of. This is the vision that will become your dream... or your nightmare...

Shards of the Stone features the greatest talent in the gaming and fiction industry including Ed Greenwood, Jason Engle, Matt Forbeck, Dan McGirt, Kevin Ranson, Aaron Acevedo, Jared Nielsen and many more. Shards of the Stone is many realms made into one marvelous setting, each with a distinctly unique and imaginative feel with a ShardMaster moderating the realm and helping each one of you as you contribute to the grand setting."

68226.name: Greyhound Racing
68226.description:
A game made in England in the 1950's. There is no publisher listed on the game box. It is a very simple roll and move game on a board with a serpentine track that goes from the start (0) to the finish line (100).
A six is needed to start the race and an exact roll is needed to hit the finish line. There are many penalty spaces on the board that will stop you or move you back. there are some bonus spaces which move you ahead or give you an extra die roll.
It comes in a simple cardboard box with the 5 sentence rules glued to the inside top cover lid. The tri-fold board is ~ 16" x 10" when unfolded. There are 4 different colored plastic greyhounds for pawns. A small plastic die tumbler and die are also included.

68227.description:
Fabula (previously known as Grimm) is a story-telling game where players must fill in parts of a story. One of them is the teller, who read (or imagine) the beginning of a short tale — his/her current draft. Each other player incarnates a tentative hero (a gnome, a princess, a little boy, etc.) who tries to be the main character of the teller's tale. 3 times during the game, the teller asks the other players how they think things happened at that time of the story. They must choose an item depicted on one of the cards laying at the center of the table and use it to continue the story. Depending on how convincing they are to the teller, and how well they integrated their character and the item to the current twist, they get points in the shape of "quill" markers. Each item can only be used once by any player, who keeps it afterwards, and who puts his/her markers on top of the card.

At the end of the three turns, the two players with the most quill markers are selected to compete in the epilogue. The teller reads (or makes up) an idea of an ending to the story. Now, each finalist in turn has 30 seconds to present a relevant proposal for including his character and both items figured on the two remaining cards on the table into the ending. (A sand timer is included.) Both players have to use the same two objects, but the second one speaking cannot use them in the same way than the first (more or less compensating the fact he had more time to prepare his part).

Eventually, the teller decides which of the two finalists wins, depending on the relevance of their proposals.

The game comes with two proposed variants :
- "Experienced players" : all the players tell the same tale, each one adding an element to the same storyline and bound to continue using the plot of the former speakers.
- "Collective" : there are no quill markers and appraisal given by the teller. Every player takes part in the epilogue, and there's no winner.
68227.name: Fabula

99691.name: Railways of the World: The Card Game Expansion

boardgamehonor.8752: 2010 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee

68228.description:
Railways of the World The Card Game is a fast paced card game adaptation of the popular Railways of the World board game series. In Railways of the World The Card Game players use track cards and city cards to build a series of railroad routes and deliver goods!

As the game progresses, players work to connect more cities, upgrade their engines for larger carrying capacity and deliver goods through a network of routes across the table.

Railways of the World The Card Game provides two versions of rules: one the whole family can play, which is also a great way to introduce them to Railways of the World, and one for more experienced fans of the Railways of the World series.
68228.name: Railways of the World: The Card Game

68229.name: Muselabyrinten
68229.description:
The first player who make it through the rotating maze, and with all of his four mouses reaches the tasty cheese in the middle wins the game.

from a merged entry
A clever and fun little game. The maze is a labyrinth with a clear plastic film that you can turn in order to change the maze. Every player has 4 mice each to control and the goal is to get them from their nests to the middle, where the cheese is. The players roll a dice every turn, and the plastic film on top of the maze is moved that many steps, thus changing the layout.

68230.description:
Growling Tigers Under Siege: Defense of Changde 1943（圍城虎嘯:常德保衛戰1943） is a two-player board wargame that simulates the defense of Changde in the end of the Battle of Changde, November 18 to December 3, 1943.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changde

Each turn represents two days and each hex is about 1 km across. One player commands the Imperial Japanese Army（大日本帝國陸軍） and the other player commands the National Revolutionary Army（國民革命軍）.
68230.name: Growling Tigers under Siege: Defense of Changde 1943

68231.name: Disease of an Evil Conscience
68231.description:
Introduction from the PDF

Out in the Scavenger Lands life is difficult, and compassion can seem like a dangerously unaffordable luxury. But despite the propaganda you might hear in the Realm about the savagery of those beyond the Threshold, most of the folk who call the Confederation of Rivers their home consider themselves good people. But what happens when the imperative to survive challenges one’s moral commitment to one’s fellows? Sacrifices have to be made, but when do the needs of the many justify the losses of a few?

This is the second SAS adventure for Exalted Second Edition.

68232.name: Rough Guide to Pavis City
68232.description:
Glorious Jewel of Second Age Glorantha
(A Guide to Old Pavis in the year 894 Solara Tempora)

From the Appendix:

Pavis city is presented in this publication at its most glorius, as seen through the eyes of a reasonably wealthy merchant. However, actually living in the city as a new (and penniless) resident is nonetheless somewhat difficult.

From the Back Cover:

"I shall build a fine city, where all races may come together to seek solace and companionship, and where many religions can exist in tolerance and growing understanding." Pavis (c.827 ST)

Contents:

A Visitors Guide to Pavis City
The History of Pavis City
The Seven Masks of the City Council
City Life
Beyond the Walls

68233.name: Different Worlds (Issue 27 - Mar 1983)
68233.description:
Different Worlds
Issue 27, March 1983
The Magazine for Adventure Role-Playing

Cover art, "Dawn of the East", by Mark Roland
Urban Adventuring Issue

68235.description:
(User Summary.)

Gulp! is a simple card game, in the fashion of War. The cards describe a variety of marine life, and list the other cards that can be "eaten". The set of cards form a partial order: there are a few unique different apex predators that are eaten by nothing, and several instances of the Phytoplankton card that can be eaten - directly or indirectly - by all other cards.

Players each draw a card from the top of the deck: if one card eats the other, then the player claims both; if neither eat the other (or, rarely, both eat the other) then each chooses an additional card, with the winner of the next pair taking all yet-unclaimed cards. Most cards at the end of the deck wins.
68235.name: Gulp!

68236.name: Different Worlds (Issue 28 - Apr 1983)
68236.description:
Special Player-Character Issue
