Front cover: Jarnon of Zeffar – of the primitive and savage blue-skinned Malonians – traveling throughout the known galactic systems, he has adapted high tech weapons from the various cultures he encoutners, ths building his own personal arsenal of super weapons and making him the most reknowned and feared of all the interplanetary bounty hunters – by Gayle Hamilton.

68237.name: Beyond Pavis
68237.description:
Adventures in the valley of the Zola Fel River

The 5th Pavis and Big Rubble Companion.

From the introduction:

We hope that Vol. 5 will provide some more great opportunities to assist and expand gaming in the Pavis region. As the Rough Guide to Pavis City began as a small article intended for Shadows, so too did this edition begin as a flagship article for that publication. However, 'Pavis County' refused to stop writing itself, and then all the backburner ideas on expanding the superb borderlands campaign began screaming for attention when Rick Meints mentioned that he planned the re-release of that excellent old supplement for this year.

Contents

Part One: Pavis County
Pavis County
Indagos Town
The Lightbringer Merchants
Hero Band of the County
Warship of Uleria
The Elves of the Rubble

Part Two: Live Along the River
Newtlings of the Zola Fel
Holiday Glorantha: Horn Gate
Morocanth of the Zola Fel
Raus Town

Part Three:Borderlands!
Back in the Borderlands!
A New Governor
Weiss
A Ruin
Return to the Stone Tower
A Trip to Pavis
Restless Natives
Smugglers
Inhabitants of the Borderlands

Part Four: Bonus Articles
The Kiertianni of Pavis County
Dwarf Drinks

68239.description: From the back of the box: Youngsters will enjoy this exciting race game. Players choose a word card from the 18 colorfully illustrated cards in this game and must match letter cards to complete their word. Everytime they spin the spinner and land on a matching colored space, they receive 1, 2 or 3 letter cards. The player who completes his 3 letter word first must then head to Sir Scrabble's castle and receive the gold key to win the game.
68239.name: Scrabble People Letter-Matching Board Game

68240.name: Atlantis: The Lost World
68240.description:
From the Back of the Book:

"Return to the Second Age of Atlantis; to a time when the race of men was young, and giants still walked the earth..."

ATLANTIS is a complete and comprehensive world setting for fantasy role players and Gamemasters alike. This book contains the original text of THE LEXICON (Atlas of the Lost World of Atlantis) and THE BESTIARY (the Atlantean creature compendium), plus new material never published before.

Includes:

Atlas of Earth in the Second Age...
Detailed regional maps...
Ten cities (human & demi-human races) with annotated maps...
A compendium of hundreds of mythical creatures, Deities, devils, demons, and wild animals native to the Atlantean world...
and much more...

68241.name: Dragon (Issue 240 - Oct 1997)

rpgissuearticle.47010: Bazaar of the Bizarre - Ye Olde Body Shoppe

68241.description:
Add a little mystery and suspense!

Vol. XXII, No. 3
Cover art by Mark Nelson

68242.name: Dragon (Issue 241 - Nov 1997)
68242.description:
Digging up Ancient Empires

Vol. XXII, No. 4
Cover art by rk post

68243.name: Mythus Bestiary
68243.description:
Subtitled "Volume I - Aerth Animalia and Unique Flora", but planned future volumes were never printed.

From the back cover:

Betuhuru? Horntooth? Hippocorn? Blindworm? Green Racer? Strange names for strange creatures... these beasts and hundreds more await you inside the Mythus Bestiary. Prepared especially for use with the Mythus fantasy roleplaying system, the Mythus Bestiary is an encyclopedic reference containing descriptions of over 400 creatures - some animal, some vegetable, some mineral.

The listings inside the Mythus Bestiary are divided into separate treatments of Exterior Aerth, Interior Aerth, and Subterranean Aerth for ease of reference.

A bull the size of an elephant? A scorpion the size of a bull? An elephant the size of a pony? A lizard that could eat a tiger? A tiger with 9-inch fangs? The Mythus Bestiary is more than just a list, however. Each creature is fully detailed and illustrated, from the bovine aurochs (5 feet at the shoulder) and teh Atlantean pygmy elephant of the Exterior, to the Dilophosaurus (a poison-spitting carnivorous dinosaur) and the fin-backed dragon of the Interior. Denizens of the briny deep are not neglected; a sea voyage might be cut short by anything from the lowly barracuda and the great white shark to the sea mugger (a giant oceanic crocodile), the serpent whale, or the true sea serpent (as its name implies, there are several such monsters). There is more to Aerth than just the two worlds on the inside and outside, however. The Mythus Bestiary also deals with the strange creatures inhabiting the dank caves and stygian passages of Subterranean Aerth: cave apes, centaurants, smotherslugs, drownweed and other nightmare monsters.

Reptile Men? Intelligent Foxes? Walking Mushrooms? Living Rocks? In addition to the "dumb animals" noted above, the Mythus Bestiary also includes many tribes of humanoids: primitive cave-dwellers, savage lizard-men, flying bat-people... the list goes on and on.

The world of Aerth can be a dangerous place for the unwary. The Mythus Bestiary will help prepare you for your journey.

68245.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice (Issue 3  - Summer 1979)
68245.description:
Table of Contents

Editorial - Ken St Andre
Dragons: A Specific Overview - Bear Peters
Seareaver's Tomb - DM Dungeon (T&T) - Liz Danforth
Arcane Graffitti - News, Clues and Reviews
Classified Ads
Garden of Blood - Fiction by Roger Zelazny
Yggdrasil - Cartoon by Brian McCrary
Heroic Fantasy (PBM T&T)- Ken St Andre
Letters
Kane: Essay - Steve Trout
Death Angel's Shadow - poetry by Karl Edward Wagner

68246.name: Pseudo-Dragen (Issue 8 - 1987)
68246.description:
Index:
1 Forside: Tilbudet (Front page: The offer - Thorbjørn Fridahl & Maud Pedersen)
2 Indhold (Index)
3 Leder (Editorial - Christian Johansen)
4 Gemte Skatte (Hidden treasures: Druids - Henrik Lundstrøm)
6 Ka-Powww (Live RPG - Christian Johansen)
7 Betalte annoncer (Paid adverts)
8 Taraxacum (Poem - Uldur Robinson)
9 Nyheder (News)
11 Pseudo-nyheder (Rumors & gossip)
12 Vordaks bibliotek (Vordask library - Christian Johansen & Uldur Robinson)
15 Plot-line (Plot ideas - Uldur Robinson, Christian Johansen, Tommy Jensen)
16 Abonnement (Subscription information)
17 Over disken (Over the counter - reviews - Wilderness Survival Guide, Lost Telepaths, The Coriolis Effect, Super Agent Campaign Supplement, Evael Kingdom of the Elves, Thardic Republic - Christian Johansen, Henrik Lundstrøm, Tommy Jensen, Paul Erik Lundstrøm)
24 Pseudo-Biblioteket (Book reviews)
26 CUT (Film reviews: The Fly - Tommy Jensen)
27 Mini-Sek (Miniatures
30 Quiz (Lovecraft quiz)
31 Breve (letters)
35 Events (Club & convention news)
37 Verden Udenfor (The world outside)
38 Annoncer (Contacts & market)
39 Næste nummer (next issue)
40 Bagside (Rear page - Thorbjørn Fridahl & Maud Pedersen)

132120.name: Die Minen von Zavandor: Die verlorenen Spruchrollen

68247.description:
In this third game in Lookout's Zavandor fantasy setting, it's all about dwarves. And mining. And gemstones. And other enhancements for the mines that need to get developed further during the game to have full effect.

4 different gems are the currencies in this game. However, when collecting income you draw cards from 4 different mines (card stacks) with each having its own distribution! The number of gems you earn depends on the upgrade level of your dwarves. Gems are used to either win new objects for their mine through simultaneous 4-way auctions, or to enhance their mines, objects, and victory point count. Another innovative part is that each object has to be upgraded to fully use its benefits, e.g. a level 1 dwarf only gives you 1 income per round, some level 3 dwarves give you 3 income.

On the King's way through the mountain, the requirements for upgrading some special cards always change, and only the player who wins the sapphire auction knows where the next turn will lead to. There are shorter and longer paths to the Coronation Chamber, where the game ends. The game lasts between 10 to 12 rounds.
68247.name: The Mines of Zavandor

68248.name: Chthonian
68248.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Audience

Chthonian is geared mostly for fans of weird fiction, but can easily be modified for other tastes. Central to the game is the concept of the Narrator and Players. The Narrator acts as the author of the Story, describing events and actions taken by secondary characters. Players roleplay the part of Excursionists, the main protagonists of the Story.

When beginning a game of Chthonian it is recommended that the Narrators and the Players are all on the same page. Be sure that everyone knows the Style of play, the themes to be explored throughout, and what their Excursionists are expected to be able and unable to do.

You will notice that there is no Narrator section here. This is because the Narrator needs to know no extra rules outside of Creating an Excursionist and Mechanics. A good Narrator should remember that the Players and the Narrator are creating a Story together, and should encourage suggestions from Players for the Story and allow the Players the full use of their Nodules.

Style

This game is designed to be played with several levels of Style. For fans of action-packed adventures filled with goons that drop like flies from a hero's revolver, the Style is Pulp Adventure. If the Excursionists only slightly better than average at dealing with the supernatural and bizarre, it is called a Weird Tale. The grittiest, and potentially most dangerous Style is a Shocking Discovery, where most Excursionists will wind up dead, mad, or somewhere in between.

Materials

Aside from a pencil and paper, you should have a twelve-sided die, a duodecahedron being the weirdest of the regular polyhedrons. Players use tokens, called Nodules, which can be represented by anything from scratches on paper to pennies to Mancala stones.

It is recommended that you have read some weird fiction appropriate to the Style, in order to play your Excursionist or Narrate to the fullest extent. H.P. Lovecraft is the quintessential author of weird fiction, though there are certainly others.

68249.name: By Air To Australia
68249.description: Roll & Move about the air journey from Croydon Airport England to Charleville Australia with the normal roll & move hazards (Oil Trouble Miss A Turn, Head Wind Throw a 3 Before Proceeding etc)

68250.description:
The Advance of Army Group South:
June - August, 1941

When the Germans launched Operation Barbarossa on 22 June 1941, they faced both their greatest expanse of territory to capture and the greatest concentration of Soviet armor south of the Pripet marsh in Ukraine. Army Group South launched its multi-national forces (including Rumanians, Hungarians and Italians) with their principal target defined – Objective: Kiev.

Facing them was the Red Army weakened from the recent purges of its officers by Stalin. Still, the Soviets put together a strong counter-attack early in the campaign, but their advantages in numbers of tanks committed could not overcome the German's superiority of skill when employing their veteran panzer units. The Axis forces advanced eastward to the Dnieper River and south toward Odessa, but as the front kept expanding, forces were spread thinner to cover the front line.

Objective: Kiev is a new historical board game from renowned game designer Frank Chadwick, iterating the classic Battle for Moscow game system used in The Arduous Beginning, combining ease of learning and design elegance with the kind of dramatic gameplay that Frank has long been famous for. Featuring countless opportunities and variations, Objective: Kiev presents an endlessly fascinating series of puzzles and is a game that you're going to want to play again and again.

Published in C3i magazine #26.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 - 2 weeks
Hex: 31 miles / 50 kilometers
Units: Corps to Army

Game Inventory:
One 11 x 17" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (40 1/2" game counters - 28)
One 6-page Objective Kiev foldout rules booklet
One single-side printed Play Aid card

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium-Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15
68250.name: Objective: Kiev

82735.name: Loot and Scoot Expansion Kit #1: Loot Harder

68251.description:
He Who Dies with the Most Loot
Probably Ran into the Dragon

Dungeons are for looting. Every good adventurer knows that. Unfortunately, there are those pesky monsters to take care of before the real work can begin – counting all the loot.

Loot and Scoot is a fast-playing game of dungeons, dragons and running faster than the hirelings when the going gets too tough. Two to four players construct dungeons, recruit adventuring groups, and loot the most treasure before the Dungeon Boss is found... and killed.

Money is earned by looting dungeon rooms. Those valuable coins are then used to buy more retainers, upgrade your training facilities, recruit more adventurers (from four different classes), and train Squires into Knights (or Level 1 Priests into Level 2 Bishops, you get the idea). In the end, the player who successfully looted the most difficult dungeon rooms is the winner and gets to gloat over their friends back at the Inn.

Game Data:
Complexity: 2.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 4 on a 9 scale
Scale: Individual heroes vs. individual or groups of monsters

Game Components:
• One illustrated, color 2-page Rules sheet
• 80 color, die-cut 5/8" square playing pieces
• 56 color, die-cut 5/8" round game makers
• 4 Dungeon player mats
68251.name: Loot and Scoot

68253.name: The Naked City
68253.description:
From the Back Cover:

The concrete jungle hides a million dreams... and a million ways to die.

The world of The Edge of Midnight is defined by her cities. Skyscrapers tower over blood-stained cement, as criminal syndicates pull the strings in the halls of power. Warlocks and private dicks rub shoulders with gaunt gangsters and femme fatales, each of them searching for that one lucky break to put them on top. There are fortunes to be made here, but the price is steep. Desperation and ambition walk hand-in-hand, and one wrong step could punch your ticket for good. Five of the most important - and dangerous - cities in The Edge of Midnight universe are covered in this collection. From the sun-drenched beaches of Paradiso to the dark alleys of New Eden, from the halls of power in Nova Roma to the gangsters' hideouts of Central City, no stone is left unturned. Each city has complete details on playing and running stories within them, including maps, locations, NPCs, and scenario hooks. Take a walk through the Naked City... it may be the last thing you ever do.

68254.name: Dragon (Issue 242 - Dec 1997)

rpgissuearticle.47123: Arcane Lore - Spells of Sight and Sound

68254.description:
Spells & Magic!

Vol. XXII, No. 5
Cover art by Tony DiTerrlizzi

68255.name: Dragon (Issue 243 - Jan 1998)
68255.description:
Dragon Magazine
Issue 243, Volume XXII No. 6
January 1998

Knights & Paladins

Cover art by Stephen A. Daniele

68256.name: In Liskas Fängen
68256.description:
(from the back of the book)

No hero can live of good deeds alone. To snatch of the charburner's little daughter from the clutches of the kidnappers testifies of generosity, but leaves the pockets empty. Sometimes fresh ducats must be won! The news of a treasure at the the Oblomon comes in handy. Extensive wealth lies there hidden, unguarded, and waits only to be sacked by a resourceful party. So get some beasts of burden packhorses - you cannot carry away so much gold alone - and then leave to the taiga. The only thing you must remind is that other laws rule there, and other gods rule, but this should not frighten you. you will prevail, or...?

68258.name: Firuns Land
68258.description:
(from the back of the book)

Firun's land is a harsh land. For the inexperienced it offers little more than privations, hunger, frost and quite a lot of encounters with pitiless hunters of the north - human or animal. Yes, you should be wise, dextrous and have a lot of stamina and an iron will to live in Firun's land. If this does not frighten you off, tehn get winterproof clothing and go: You will gain experience and conquer a unique world for yourself. However, watch out for thin ice - and for the furry yeti, of course...

68259.name: Yaquirwellen
68259.description:
(from the back of the book)
Where are the disappeared waves of the Yaquir (Yaquirwellen), and - moreover - what they are? To find and answer, a foray to the underworld of Punins is necessary. All in all, a well paid mission for a poor hero. However, be careful: They can trust nobody, and the dubious elements you deal with have now qualms.

68260.description:
From GMT's web site:

The Fast Action Battle (FAB) games, designed by Rick Young (Europe Engulfed, Asia Engulfed, and FAB: The Bulge), takes you to the Allied invasion of Sicily for volume II of the series.

As the Allied player, you will choose your invasion beaches after seeing where the Axis player has deployed his units. Do you choose Montgomery’s historical ‘Husky’ plan, Patton’s alternate plan, or a hybrid plan of your own?

In this game you will find a few new unit and asset types, and also new challenges for both sides. For the attacker, the challenge is the tough Sicilian terrain; and for the defenders, it’s the worsening Italian morale.

Each victory area and functioning port that the Allies secure adds a ‘Fading Italian Morale’ Event Chit into the selection cup, and as each of those are drawn, worsening effects on Italian units are felt along the entire front.

If one side has not secured an automatic victory by the end of turn 9, the Axis player receives bonuses, both for German units that have exited off the island through Messina and also for areas on Sicily that are still Axis-controlled, so there is pressure on both sides to fight for every area.

Event Chits include:


Replacements
Fading Italian Morale,
the Patton Soldier Slap, and
flanking battalion-sized invasions.
68260.name: FAB: Sicily

68262.name: Adventurer (Issue 4 - Oct 1986)
68262.description:
Adventurer 4
The Superior Fantasy and Science Fiction Game Magazine
Cover art by Peet Ellison

68263.name: Goldene Blüten auf Blauem Grund
68263.description:
(from the back of the book)

The shadow of the demonlord has fallen on the land, and dark armies arm themselves for the attack on the civilised empires of Aventurien. The time has come in which heroes and heroines fight side by side with the famous amazones to stop the downfall. But who will carry the banner of the amazones - the golden blossoms on blue - in the battle? Where is Gilia, daughter of Yppolita and future queen of the amazones?

boardgamehonor.21131: 2011 Charles S. Roberts Best Board Game Graphics Nominee

68264.description:
(from GMT's website:)

No Retreat: The Russian Front is a new deluxe edition of the two-player Victory Point Games 2008 CSR Award Nominee wargame that retells the story of the titanic struggle between the invading armies of Nazi Germany versus Communist Russia during WW2 at a player-friendly and manageable level of scope and difficulty. This edition combines both the original game and its two extensions (Na Berlin! and No Surrender!) using deluxe components of “Twilight Struggle Deluxe Edition” quality. With only 40 Army/Front sized counters for the Tournament game, and 70 for the whole campaign, and with very low stacking, it’s a quick-playing yet realistic affair that favours the strategic and offensive-minded player.

Each turn is alight with intriguing on-board challenges plus the surprise of card hand Events as players vie to win in one of three different ways.

In a skillfully blended collation of classic hex-based wargaming and modern card-driven simulations, No Retreat: The Russian Front stays truly story-centric, providing the proper feel of sweeping maneuvers, exploitation and encirclements across the vast steppes and forests of Russia. With a simple-yet-innovative economic model, players will also feel the growing might and sophistication of the Russian’s Red Army, and the degradation of the once-invincible German Wehrmacht, over the epic four year sweep of time that this merciless campaign was fought.

Neither side can afford the disgrace of yielding an inch of ground to their hated foe, so your orders are: “No Retreat!”

Components:

One Standard size mounted map
Two Counter Sheets
One deck of 55 Playing Cards
Rule booklet
Scenario booklet
Player Aid Cards
Two 6-sided dice (1 black and 1 white)




TIME SCALE: 2 months per turn
MAP SCALE: 100km / 60 miles per hex
UNIT SCALE: Armies and Fronts
NUMBER OF PLAYERS: 2

DESIGNER: Carl Paradis
DEVELOPER: Alan Emrich & Carl Paradis
COUNTER ART: Mark Simonitch & Carl Paradis
MAP ART: Mark Simonitch
68264.name: No Retreat! The Russian Front

68267.name: Ingerimms Schlund
68267.description:
(from the back of the book)
Your heroes already defeated the sea ogre? Then they seem to be right to mountan expedition to Ingerimm's throat - a mysterious volcano where dark figures supposedly do their dreadful work. But these surely are only ghost stories, thought up by simple-minded skippers to frighten small children - or possibly not...?!

68269.name: Das Dschungelgrab
68269.description:
(from the back of the book)

The jungle - one calls it the perfect wonder of Tsa, the others call it the green ground of hell. Both are true, because, indeed, nowhere on the whole continent a life so rich and colourful is found as in the jungle, and on the other hand, quick death always lurks here in the form of poisonous snakes or other predators. A fighter is needed who ventures here to unravel the secret of the jungle grave.

68270.name: Die Mondsilberkugel
68270.description:
(from the back of the book)

The moonsilver sphere is a mighty magic artifact. It causes some turmoil among the Oijaniha of the ghost mountain. Some young, ambitious warriors would like to own the magic thing to promote themselves to the top of the tribe. On the other hand the ghosts do not like it at all if one does magic in their jungle in the style of the paleskins. From the dilemma there is only one way out. The sphere has to disappear to the place it came from, to its creator and master. Your hero has taken over this honourable job and goes on the trip. And this leads - as if there were not already enough dangers - through the area of the hostile tribes...
The moonsilver sphere (Mondsilberkugel) is the sequel of the solo adventure Das Dschungelgrab.

68271.name: Career Book 1
68271.description:
Back Cover:

Includes expanded Mishap and Events tables for seven of the core careers in the Traveller Main Book, and two alternative Life and Unusual Event tables for use during character generation.




From Table of Contents:

Expanded Tables: Agent, Drifter, Entertainer, Merchants, Nobility, Rogue, Scholar
New Careers: Adventurer, Bounty Hunter, Clergy, Colonist, Corporate Citizen, Militant Religious, Space Patrol, Worker




User Summary:

Expansion adding several new careers, and providing additional mishaps and events tables for seven of the 13 core book careers.
This is a "drop in an go" type supplement; it doesn't introduce any sweeping change, but GM's don't need to worry about power creep, and it makes no actual changes to mechanics of the game. The additional careers open the game to a number of additional settings adaptations.

68272.name: Career Book 2
68272.description:
From the Back Cover:

CAREER BOOK 2
Inside you’ll find 14 new careers for use in your Traveller game or campaign! Also inside, you’ll find new background skill rules
and new pre-career education options for your characters!
ATHLETE
Striving for accolades, athletes compete in games spanning subsectors. It’s the winning that matters!
CHANCER
Lying, cheating, stealing, and deceit: the tools of the trade of the Chancer, who can only win as long as someone else loses.
COMPANION
Whether you’re down-trodden and poor, or high-class and rich, everyone pays a price in the oldest profession.
COSMONAUT
Making a living in space can be hard work, with cargo pods to be moved, repairs to be made and people to be rescued!
ENFORCER
Thug, bully boy, heavy: names mean nothing to you. Getting a result for your boss means everything!
INSURGENT
Working within the government, you work in the background, helping those who seek to overthrow the government.
MEDIA PRACTITIONER
Lights! Camera! Action! Whether it’s a soap opera, a documentary or a quiz show, you’re the one who makes it shine!
MYSTIC WARRIOR
You’re searching for the truth both within and without, and enjoying a fight along the way!
POLITICIAN
Greed, money, power, and votes: when you’re a politician, you need plenty of these!
PORT AUTHORITY
You make sure the right cargo gets to the right ship, the ships get off the pad and that the taxes on the cargos have been paid!
PRISONER
Whether you’re a common criminal, a political agitator or a prisoner of war: behind bars, everyone has one thought - to get out!
PUPPETEER
These alien experimenters are happy to wait to see the outcome of their experiments on other societies.
SECRET POLICE
The Secret Police know what everyone is doing, what everyone is saying and where everyone is going!
SLAVE
Your life is in the hands of your master or mistress, their every wish a command, and every command an order!




User Summary:

Additional careers without setting nor rules material, intended for "drop in and go" type use.

68273.name: Feenflügel
68273.description:
(from the back of the book)
Even in the midst of Aventurien there are regions where people can disappear without a trace - and this seems to have happened to a young wizard, who started a quest to unravel the mysteries of the red sickle mountains. On behalf of her former teacher the the heroes start a rescue expedition, in which they encounter not only miners and goblins, mountain streams and glaciers, but also centuries-old tracks that even today can bring many thousand ducats: the secret of Fairy wings.

68274.name: Wo keine Sonne scheint
68274.description:
(from the back of the book)

The invasion of the Empire by the followers of Borbarad has deprived it of its eastern province, but there are still sites that have entrenched themselves behind imperial loyalty and belief in the 12 gods. On behalf of the church of Rondra you set out to help those resisters. But, once a prosperous region, Tobrien is now a country where the trees bear poisonous fruit, the rivers run with putrid waters, and everyone is the enemy of his neighbor - a lost land where sun does not shine ...

68275.name: Spur in die Vergangenheit
68275.description:
(from the back of the book)

The visit of the lovely feast of Rahja could have been so relaxing for the heroes, if there wasn't the news that one of their friends has disappeared - in the heart of the civilized Horas kingdom. The heroes suspect an horasian intrigue, but when they go to get to it, they become embroiled in events that are rooted in the distant past - the wizard wars - and yet still they can fundamentally change the present.

68276.name: Schwarzer Druidenwald
68276.description:
(from the back of the book)
Ysilia, the battered city, ruled by the henchmen of the demon master, where the daily work of slavery and hardship exists and the country gives only horror and cruelty. If you're a young man born in that city, and still carries in his heart the desire for freedom and adventure, there is nothing more to do than to set out one day to find your way to freedom. But even if the are hunters are shaken off, there still is one last obstacle to overcome to reach the border of the black country: the Black Druid Forest (Schwarzer Druidenwald)

68277.name: Poznajemy Kolory
68277.description:
Poznajemy Kolory is a children's game for 2-4 players, Ages 4 - 8.

This game is a child's introduction to colors.

The game is designed to encourage children to compare and logical thinking.

Players in this game have only one task - they have to identified as soon as possible the colors thrown a pair of colorful dice and associate them with the colors of cardboards on the table, spread cocks. Who will recognize the appropriate colors on the rooster, that puts him on his chip. Very simple rules of the game makes it fun for young and older children and even adults. The youngest learn the recognition and naming colors.

68278.description:
Expansion to Who's In The Bag.This times. Teams of players race against the clock to guess the phrase based on a certain time. "Early in the Morning", "When I'm 64", "Pancake Day" etc...

Over 400 phrases
68278.name: When's in the Bag

68279.description:
Expansion to Who's In The Bag.
Where's in the Bag is an additional set of location cards that you can add to the main game. So aside from having to help your teammates identify famous characters, you'll now have to communicate locations such as "your trouser pocket" and "The Kremlin"
68279.name: Where's in the Bag

68280.description:
Return of the Others continues the conflict between the Night's Watch and what lives north of The Wall. The Wildling threat has been answered, but the brave men of the Night's Watch are learning that far worse live in the savage wilderness of the north.

Featuring characters like Mance Rayder, Melisandre, Old Bear Mormont, and the legendary Balerion the Black, Return of the Others will bring your A Game of Thrones deck to new heights of conquest and intrigue.

Return of the Others is the sixth installment in the "Defenders of the North" expansion to the A Game of Thrones card game, based on George R.R. Martin's bestselling A Song of Ice and Fire saga. This 40-card pack features 20 different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones metagame.

Note: The 2011 edition of Return of the Others has been updated to the sixty-card format (three copies each of twenty unique cards). The included cards are updated with rules text based on the most recent FAQ and Errata.
68280.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Return of the Others

39953.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game

68281.description:
This is an unofficial fan-made expansion, and is not affiliated with nor endorsed by Donald X. Vaccarino or Rio Grande Games.

Magic has come to your domain. You knew you were taking a risk when you opened the borders to those magic bean salesmen, but surely hiring the troll to collect tolls on your new bridge was the right move? The old fortune teller who came to your castle that fateful night said that your wishes would come true, and now everything you touch is turning to gold, and your servants seem to have been replaced by walking brooms with arms!

You scoffed when your advisers told you those old wizards were dangerous, but now, with strange lights flashing over the nearby mountains at night, you can't help but wonder if they were right. Will you hire a sorceress to cast spells at your behest, or a huntsman to deal with those mysterious wolves that are plaguing the countryside? Only by wit, courage, and a little hard-earned wisdom will you be able to protect and expand your dominion.

Fairy Tale is a free, unofficial, print-and-play expansion for the game Dominion.
Details and a download can be found below in the files section of this page.

It adds 21 new Kingdom cards to Dominion, including 10 Actions, 2 Treasures, 3 Victory cards, 5 Durations and 1 Reaction. The central theme is cards that do multiple things.

Background
Dominion is designed by Donald X. Vaccarino, and is published in the USA by Rio Grande Games. Fairy Tale is an unofficial fan-made expansion is not affiliated with nor endorsed by Donald X. Vaccarino or Rio Grande Games. Fairy Tale was originally designed by D. Brad Talton, Jr. and after William Stewart offered to help, he passed the project on to him and the BGG community.
68281.name: Fairy Tale (fan expansion for Dominion)

68284.name: Talk in Text
68284.description:
Talk in Text
The Code Breaking Puzzle Game

Just how well do you know your mobile phone? Talk in Text is a fabulous new code-breaking puzzle game, where players race to decode text message teasers using a numeric keypad. Includes 160 puzzles and four "phones" to help players decipher the codes! For up to 4 players.

(from Mindware.com)

68285.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice (Issue 4 - Fall 1979)
68285.description:
From the Table of Contents

Editorial - Ken St Andre

Golden Dust, Red Death - a mini solo dungeon by Michael Stackpole

From Under the Mountain: a discussion of Dwarves by James E Coplin

Fantasy Gaming and the Interactive Videodisc by Terry Ballard

Arcane Graffitti - News, Clues and Reviews

Classified Ads

Monkey's Stagger: short story by Tanith Lee

Reader Survey

Letters

Reality Check: The Cowardly Arrow by Rocky Russo

Unbreakable Ties by Ken St. Andre - article on improving combat in Tunnels and Trolls

Weapons Shop by L.J. Harris The Adaga, a weird Moorish weapon

68286.description:
PentaKribb is billed as "Boardless Cribbage". Instead of the traditional board, players are provided a scoring sheet to post their hands and scores. Players are not dealt their own, individual hands. Instead, the dealer turns a single card face up. The players enter that card onto their own score sheet, placing it into the square of their choice in a 4 x 5 grid. This is repeated until all 20 spaces are filled in. The dealer then turns over a single cut card. The result is 5 hands of 5 cards for each player. The scores are added up for all the hands. This is repeated for five deals. The highest score at the end of the five deals wins the game.

From published rules on the box.
68286.name: PentaKribb

68287.name: Master of Orion
68287.description:
"Paraphrase from the manual and Master of Orion is a turn-based, 4X science fiction computer strategy game. The goal of the game is to lead one of ten races to through conquer of a randomly generated galaxy via a combination of diplomacy and combat through the development of technology, exploration and colonization. "

Source: Wikipedia, "Master_of_Orion," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68288.name: Stink Fight!
68288.description:
From the inside of the box of "Leapin' Lemurs" Peanut Butter & Chocolate cereal.

When Ring-tailed Lemurs get mad at each other, sometimes they wipe their scent all over their tails and have a sort of stinky sword fight with them. Seeing as you don't have a tail, this is an easier (and less smelly!) way to have a Stink Fight!

Object: To get your 2 tokens from the START row at the bottom of the board into 2 white spaces in the FINISH row, while avoiding other players or the black 'Aw Stink!' squares.

Components:
7 x 13 board
6 player tokens
Rules
Player provided die

68289.name: 3singes
68289.description:
3singes (3monkeys) is a unique party game, as it handicaps the players. It is based on the chinese three monkeys of wisdom.

One player is blind but knows all (with 3 cards) and must tell the mute player how to mime the phrase to the deaf, without saying to the mute what he is miming, but HOW to do it, and the blind cannot see if the mute mime it correctly.

The deaf players (having iPods or similar things) don't hear what the blind is saying, so they must try to understand the blind's message according to the mute's mimes. If a blind player hears a correct element, he indicates the mute a deaf got a good answer and points are scored.

68291.name: NHL 10

videogamehonor.31885: 2009 Game Critics Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee

68291.description: NHL 10 continues EA's yearly release of the ever popular hockey series. New features include battle for the cup mode, new fighting engine and after the whistle jostling.

68293.name: The Bard's Tale (2004)

videogamehonor.30952: 2004 Spike Best RPG of the Year Nominee

68293.description:
From the game box:

You are the Bard, a selfish rogue weary of pointless sub-quests and rat-infested cellars. Through magical song you summon characters to join you in battle-waging attacks, healing your party and taking damage on your behalf. Ready your weapon as you embark on a quest for coin and cleavage.

68294.name: Enter The Matrix

videogamefranchise.6406: Best of Platinum Hits (Select Best Selling Xbox Games, US)

videogamehonor.29277: 2003 Golden Joystick Best Film-Based Game of the Year Nominee

68294.description:
"Enter the Matrix is the first video game based on The Matrix series of films. It was developed by Shiny Entertainment and published by Atari and WB Interactive for the PlayStation 2, Xbox and Nintendo GameCube game systems, and for the PC. It sold one million copies in its first eighteen days of release, 2.5 million over the first six weeks, and eventually 5 million copies. Enter the Matrix was simultaneously produced with the The Matrix Reloaded and The Matrix Revolutions films."

Source: Wikipedia, "Enter_the_Matrix," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68295.name: Sudeki
68295.description:
From the game box:

Sudeki, one world ripped apart, where shadow battles light, and evil stalks both realms. Four heroes must heal the rift and unite their lands: A sultry wizardess, a powerful swordsman, a soaring gunslinger, and a dark huntress. Together they battle for the soul of two lands, where deception wheres many masks.

68296.name: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell

videogameexpansion.73877: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six 3 Exclusive Companion Demo Disc

videogamefranchise.6406: Best of Platinum Hits (Select Best Selling Xbox Games, US)

videogamehonor.31509: 2002 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Winner

68296.description:
From the game box:

You are Sam Fisher. You have the right to spy, steal, destroy, and assassinate to ensure that American freedoms are protected. If captured, the U.S. government will disavow an knowledge of your existence.

You are a Splinter Cell.

68297.name: Spider-Man (2002)

videogamefranchise.6406: Best of Platinum Hits (Select Best Selling Xbox Games, US)

videogamehonor.29275: 2002 Golden Joystick Best Film-Based Game of the Year Nominee

68297.description:
From the game box:

Bitten by a genetically engineered spider, high school student Peter Parker is suddenly empowered with supernatural abilities, including Spider-Sense, web-slinging and all crawling. Assume the role of Parker as he adapts to his new powers and becomes Spider-Man. But beware - the city's villains won't be pleased to see a new hero on the scene.

68298.name: Ye Booke of Tentacles (Volume 5)
68298.description:
Scenario Special #2

Table of Contents

Herowars
To Live and Die in the Hollow by Lawrence Whitaker and Ranyart Finn
The House of Blades by Simon Bray and Mark Galeotti
The Delicate Sound of Thunder by Ranyart Finn and Lawrence Whitaker
Thanos' Treasure by Simon Bray
Ride for your Wife by Neil Smith

Eternal Champion
Madness, and Other Colours by Lawrence Whitaker
Things to do in Imrryr When You're Dead by Lawrence Whitaker
A Dragon's Dream by Lawrence Whitaker

Call of Cthulhu
How to use Music in Horror Gaming by Sandy Petersen
The Best Halloween Movies by Sandy Petersen
The Scariest Movies you've never Seen by Sandy Petersen
Time for a Ghost Story by Sandy Petersen
The Mall by Sandy Petersen
A Mall by Sarah Evans

rpgitemversion.262184: CD with  jpg and PDF files

68300.name: Grundrisse für jede Gelegenheit
68300.description:
Game Master's Survival Pack - Volume 1

Ground plans for All Game Systems

From the Introduction:

Every game master and self-made adventurer knows the problem: developing a great building. Sometimes you need a castle or a mansion as a setting for your game, but have o time to create an elaborate building. You grab something of your role-playing collection and skim the book for a floor plan your players don't already know and that fits, or you try to avoid the problem with some scribbled lines and a lot of phrases to describe the house. As long term game masters, we have often been in this situation, and now we want to help you as well. That is the reason why this booklet was created, a collection of complex floor plans for all sorts of occasions.

The adventure ideas with a fantasy setting use names, creatures and places of the fantasy world of Glorantha (with permission of Greg Stafford), well known as the default setting of the role playing games "RuneQuest" and "HeroQuest". Even so, the adventure ideas should be easily adaptable for most other fantasy settings.

From the Back cover:

Inside you will find:
Ten floor plans for all occasions. Seven complex buildings, plus three inns in extra large size ready to use.

Each building comes with:
- a sketch of the building to show your players
- two sets of complete floor plans:
one for the players, the other for the GM
- an adventure idea in/around this building.

Suitable for ALL game systems.

68301.name: Shadis (Issue 40 - Sep 1997)
68301.description:
Month of publication unspecified

Volume 6, No. 3

Cover by Susan Van Camp

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68303.name: Shadis (Issue 41 - Oct 1997)
68303.description:
Month of publication unspecified

Volume 6, No. 4

Cover by Keith Parkinson

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68304.name: Shadis (Issue 44 - Jan 1998)
68304.description:
Month of publication unspecified

Volume 6, No. 7

Cover by Ellym Sirac

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

boardgamehonor.13899: 2011 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee

68305.description: Expansion to the space exploration game HIGH FRONTIER, adds an extension to the map that includes Jupiter, Saturn, main belt comets, centaurs, and Trojan asteroids. The expanded rules include slingshots, radiation belts, piracy, combat, solar flares, and space politics and governments. There are also 24 new patent cards, representing reactors, generators, and radiators and an additional thruster. The expanded scenarios include alien invasions, the solitaire game, and two short games.
68305.name: High Frontier Expansion

68306.name: Mob Justice
68306.description:
From the Back Cover:

The mean streets of America are wet with illegal booze and innocent blood. For decades the Mafia have ruled the underworld, propelled into power by the prohibition that those in power in government celebrate as their greatest achievement.

80 years after prohibition began, the underworld is now in chaos. As the smaller gangs move in on the Mafia's turf, gang was is everywhere and the police are either too involved, corrupt, or lazy to help.

Some may stand against the tide, whilst others will ride it out, hoping the flood waters will wash the stains away, or mark everyone equally.

68307.name: Emergency Response

rpg.1648: Silver Age Sentinels: The Superhero Role-Playing Game

68307.description:
From the back cover...

Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned.
Especially a woman with superpowers.

Emergency Response is a thrilling two part adventure set in Empire City that you can drop into any Silver Age Sentinels campaign.

Inside you'll find a twisted mystery full of intrigue and action, new characters stats, and a "how-to" section on designing your own death-traps.

68308.description:
An Expasions to Who's In The Bag
Try to communicate locations such as ‘your trouser pocket ’ and ‘The Kremlin'.
68308.name: What's In The Bag

68309.name: Uncle Ugly's Underground
68309.description:
From the Front Cover:

A complete made-for Tunnels & Trolls dungeon with map and key for the Dungeon Master.

The first level of a new complex of dungeon levels.

68310.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice (Issue 5  - Winter 1979)
68310.description:
From the Table of Contents

Troll Talk/ Editorial - Ken St Andre

A Sworded Adventure - mini solo adventure for Tunnels and Trolls by Ken St Andre

As You Like It: Individual Initiative in Solo T & T by AD Young

The State of the Art: Some comments on T & T solitaire adventure design

Letters

Arcane Graffiti - news, clues and reviews by Michael Stackpole

Classified ads

Weapons Shop: The Katana by LJ Harris

Know Your Foe 101: Concerning GMs by John M, Morrison

Passage to Dilfar: Short story by Roger Zelazny

The Revised T & T: An overview of the differences, then and now by Liz Danforth

Redcap: short story by JE Coplin

Dancing for the Death God: short story by David F. Nalle, art by Dan Day

68311.name: The Complete Book of Yoma Volume 1
68311.description:
From the back cover:

Welcome to the comprehensive, one-stop "monster of the week" resource book for Sailor Moon fans everywhere! Inside you will find full background writeups, physical descriptions, nyumerous pictures, and Tri-Stat game stats for every Yoma, Cardian, and Droid from the first two seasons of Sailor Moon.

Over 70 Yoma. Their mission: destroy the Sailor Scouts!

68312.name: Adventures in Space!!
68312.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Adventures in Space!! is a game of thrilling space stories. It is best played with three to six players, one acting as Space Command and the rest as Players. Space Command acts to provide challenges and move the story along. Players not only face these challenges with a courageous heart, but often improvise and alter the course of the story!

To play all you need are a few six-sided dice and some pieces of paper (referred to here as Playsheets). Make sure one of your dice is different from the rest, as this one becomes your Die of Science! A dictionary or space-age comics might also help you to pick fitting Words of Science.

68313.name: Definity
68313.description:
This game available only in Hungarian yet.
The "quizmaster" read a rarely use word from a card, and the players are to define it.
The fun of this game is, that usually nobody ever heard these words before.
Being everybody ready, the quizmaster collect the answers, and together with correct answer, read it. The players then vote to one, he thinks is the correct.

68314.name: Den Sorte Dværg (Issue 1 - 1991)
68314.description:
Index:
1 Forside (Front page - Tommy Jensen)
2 Indhold (Index)
3 Leder (Editorial - Tommy Jensen)
4 Glemte skatte (Forgotten treasures: AD&D magic items - Christian Johansen)
6 Plotline
8 Film & videotips

11 The world (Nemo Hansen)
15 Åbent brev til viking-con (Open letter for Viking-Con, and an answer)
18 Brevkassen (Letters)
19 Arkivskabet (NPCs)
21 R.I.P. (døde) (Dead characters)
22 Den sorte quiz (The black quiz)
23 Rigor mortis (The future of RPGs - Henrik Lundstrøm)
24 Nyheder og sladder (news and gossip)
26 Anmeldelser (Reviews - Henrik Lundstrøm & Tommy Jensen)
29 The complete demon
40 Bagside (Rear page - Tommy Jensen)

68315.name: Ludo 6 Mands-Ludo
68315.description:
The first player who succeeds travelling around the gameboard, and makes it "home" with all of his four pieces - and, finally beats his last piece off the board, wins the game.
The players have different colored pieces, and during gameplay they use a normal D6-dice, and a special Globe-dice/Star-dice, which gives special move-rights.
The players are able to "beat each other home" when jumping to the same field as an opponent.
The game continues until the last man is alone onboard.
This simple game immediately gives rise to many intrigues and emotional discussions - Believe me :)

68317.name: Den Sorte Dværg (Issue 2 - 1991)
68317.description:
Index:
1 Forside (Front page - Tommy Jensen)
2 Indhold (Index)
3 Leder (Editorial - Tommy Jensen)
4 Den sorte quiz (The black quiz)
5 Harn overview (Niels Lademark Pedersen)
13 Plotline
15 Tips til rollespillere (Advice for roleplayers)
17 Horoskop (Horoscope)
20 Arkivskabet (From the files)
21 Nyheder og sladder (News and gossip)
23 Film og videotips (Films and video)
24 En GM's genvordigheder (Troubles of a GM)
25 The World (Nemo Hansen)
31 Anmeldelser (Reviews)
33 Rollespil - en bog (Roleplaying - a book
34 Brevkassen
36 Bagside (Rear page - Tommy Jensen)

68318.name: Pastora or the Shepherdess of the Pyrenees: A diverting game calculated to kill care and enliven the dreary hours of winter
68318.description:
This Game, like many others of a similar nature, will shew the variety and innocent amusement that may be derived from a Pack of Cards; were the admirers of them as solicitous to acquire the useful lessons with which they are fraught, as they are to appropriate them to the destruction of each other's fortune, they would soon take precedence of every invention for the exercise of the mind.

Pastora or the Shepherdess of the Pyrenees, is represented in the centre of the plate which accompanies the Rules. In the corners representations of playing cards - King of Hearts, Queen of Spades, Jack of Clubs, 10 of Diamonds.

Equipment required: pack of playing cards.

68319.name: Final Fantasy XIII

videogamehonor.29200: 2010 Golden Joystick Best Soundtrack of the Year Winner

68319.description:
"Final Fantasy XIII​ (ファイナルファンタジーXIII Fainaru Fantajī Sātīn) is a role-playing video game developed and published by Square Enix for the PlayStation 3 and the Xbox 360. Released in 2009 in Japan and 2010 in North America and PAL regions, it is the thirteenth installment in the Final Fantasy series. The game introduced a few innovations to the series: a fast-paced combat mechanic, a new system determining which abilities are developed for the characters called "Crystarium", and a customizable "Paradigm" system to control which abilities are used by the characters. Final Fantasy XIII also includes elements from the previous games, such as summoned monsters, chocobos and airships.

The game takes place in the fictional floating world of Cocoon, whose government, the Sanctum, is ordering a purge on civilians who have supposedly come into contact with those from Pulse, the much-feared world below. Lightning, a former soldier from Cocoon, begins her fight against the government in order to save her sister, who has been branded a l'Cie—unwilling servants to the beings known as the fal'Cie, who maintain order on both Cocoon and Pulse—and thus has become an enemy of Cocoon. Lightning is soon joined by a band of allies, and together the group also become l'Cie after their encounter with a Pulse fal'Cie. Together, they rally against the Sanctum, while also trying to discover their "Focus" as l'Cie—the tasks they must complete before their time comes to an end."

Source: Wikipedia, "Final_Fantasy_XIII," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68320.name: British and Foreign Animals
68320.description:
The game is described as 'designed to allure the minds of youth to an acquaintance with the wonders of nature'. The playing surface has 37 playing spaces each with an animal. The game is played with a teetotum marked on eight sides. The animals featured include the otter, armadillo, beaver, sheep, rat, lynx, monkey and fox. The end of the game is marked by the lion. The game comes with a booklet which describes the animals.

Two or three persons may amuse themselves with this agreeable pastime; and if a double set of counters and pyramids are purchased, six persons may play at it.

68321.name: Walker's New Geographical Game Exhibiting a Tour Through Europe
68321.description:
In order to play this European centred race game each player must have a marker, four counters and an eight-sided teetotum. There are 133 playing spaces covering the gameboard. The race begins in London and ends in Athens. A separate booklet sets out the rules. As well as providing information on the history and commerce of the places, the game also encouraged reading and conversational skills.

Published May 1st, 1810.

68323.name: Space Invaders
68323.description:
"Space Invaders​ is an arcade video game designed by Tomohiro Nishikado, and released in 1978. It was originally manufactured and sold by Taito in Japan, and was later licensed for production in the United States by the Midway division of Bally. Space Invaders is one of the earliest shooting games and the aim is to defeat waves of aliens with a laser cannon to earn as many points as possible. In designing the game, Nishikado drew inspiration from popular media: Breakout, The War of the Worlds, and Star Wars. To complete it, he had to design custom hardware and development tools.

Though simple by today's standards, with basic two-dimensional graphics, it was one of the forerunners of modern video gaming and helped expand the video game industry from a novelty to a global industry. When first released, Space Invaders was very successful and popular. Following its release, the game caused a temporary shortage of 100-yen coins in Japan, and by 2007 had earned Taito US$500 million in revenue. Guinness World Records ranks it the top arcade game.

The game has been the inspiration for other video games, re-released on numerous platforms, and led to several sequels. The 1980 Atari 2600 version quadrupled the system's sales and became the first "killer app" for video game consoles. Space Invaders has been referenced and parodied in multiple television shows, and been a part of several video game and cultural exhibitions. The pixelated enemy alien has become a media icon representing video games as a whole."

Source: Wikipedia, "Space_Invaders," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Microbadges

68324.name: An historical game of England: The royal generalogical pastime of the sovereigns of England from Egbert to George 3rd
68324.description:
The game is in the form of a family tree with each monarch named in numbered circles. Those circles before William l are in pink and those after are yellow. Circle one is the DIVISIONS OF THE HISTORY OF ENGLAND, and it leads to Britons, Romans, Saxons and Saxon Heptarchy then Saxon kings, Danish kings, restored Saxon kings, and the various houses from the Normans to the Brunswick.

Published March 10th 1804.

68325.name: Waterhole
68325.description:
Waterhole is a co-operative game whereby the aim of the game is to get the herbivores into the waterhole and back to their home territories without any of them being eaten by the carnivores. This game was originally designed to accompany the teaching pack 'Conflict, Change and Our Future'. It was intended for use in schools for children aged between 9 and 13.

Published in Norwich, UK.

68326.name: The Mount of Knowledge
68326.description:
The game features a path through a landscape, with small circular pictures showing a wood, a river and other features. The first circle, called the Horn Book, reflects one of the teaching methods of the time. Players must stop here to learn the letters of the alphabet. There are various forfeits and rewards along the way. These include punishments for boasting, wasting time and pride, and rewards for repentance, patience and diligence.

You are to be provided with a Teetotum having 8 sides, marked 1 to 8, and each player with a traveller (marker) and 8 counters of which 4 are to be put into the Pool. The highest spinner begins and to proceed regularly to the right hand.

68327.name: Sevendeck
68327.description: The Sevendeck is a deck of playing cards containing seven suits of seven numbers each. The suits are ranked both by color (ROYGBIV) and by the number of angled corners ("points") on their pips. As with a regular deck of playing cards, there are several games that can be played with a Sevendeck, with more on the way. (From publisher web site 7deck.com)

68328.name: Fires of Heaven
68328.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Space opera writ large. It is the 23rd century and humanity is the center of a loose and expanding alliance of worlds, including several alien races. Threatened from within by corruption, and from without by the militaristic Vorn. Fires of Heaven (by Patrick Sweeney) is the largest EABA supplement to date at over 420 pages, with an interstellar atlas, corporate profiles, starship design and combat and more. You need EABA, of course, but otherwise it is a complete SF setting in one massive volume that you can print out individual sections of as needed.

From the Author's Note included in the text:

Most space opera games feature sprawling, ancient galactic empires or federations of hundreds of alien races, with all sorts of hyper-advanced technologies. And while there’s nothing wrong with such universes, I had something different in mind for Fires of Heaven – an interstellar civilization with enough size to provide plenty of adventure, yet not so vast the heroes will never see more than a tiny fraction of it. A young, expanding union of worlds with plenty of room for heroes to explore new worlds, make first contact with unknown alien races, and play key roles in the unfolding story if desired. I also wanted to keep technological and societal advances as plausible as possible, extrapolating from the modern-day save for nods to two science fiction mainstays – faster than light travel and artificial gravity. Finally, I set myself the challenge of basing the systems off current astronomical data on nearby stars and extrasolar worlds.

68330.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice (Issue 6 - Spring 1980)
68330.description:
From the Table fo Contents

Troll Talk/Editorial - Ken St Andre

Tolkien in the Fourth Age - Thomas M. Egan

Queries and Quandaries

Fantasy Superfight: analysis of a possible battle between Conan and Tarzan by Charles R. Saunders

Arcane Graffiti - News, Clues and Reviews by Michael Stackpole

Letters to the editor

Horizons of Computer Gaming by John. M. Morrison

The Name Unspeakable in Tel Urath: short story by Janet Fox

Reader Survey Feedback

The Titan's Tarot: a dramatization of a Tunnels & Trolls encounter on the Isle of Greysmoke by Larry DiTillio

Reality Check II : The Cheater Stick - article about crossbows by Rocky Russo

Renlak's Do-or-Die Puzzle Room - One room dungeon for any RPG by Rick Goodman

68331.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice (Issue 7 - Summer 1980)
68331.description:
From the Table of Contents

Troll Talk/Editorial - Liz Danforth

Stop Thief! - Mini solo adventure for Tunnels and Trolls by Michael Stackpole

Designing Monsters - John T. Sapienza

Weapons Shop: The Yaitish and the Sinalawitan (Spirit Spear) - L.J. Harris

Intruder - a review by Gregory Courter

Letters to the editor

The Squire's Tale - short story by Tanith Lee

Real Time Role-Playing - A.D. Young

The Lovecraft Variant - G. Arthur and Philip J. Rahman

Queries & Quandaries

Troll Teasers : Puzzles

68332.name: Legends of Avadnu
68332.description:
From the back cover:

Herein reside powerful beasts both fell and terrible...

The world’s first epic-level monster collection! Featuring the most powerful creatures from Avadnu’s history, Legends of Avadnu uses material recently made Open Content to create monsters for use in any epic-level d20 System game. Presented in the same format as Denizens of Avadnu, Legends is an electronic product written to support and bolster interest in the Denizens print product.

68333.name: The Scouring of Gate Pass (OGL d20 3.x)
68333.description:
From the publisher:

The dramatic beginning of the War of the Burning Sky Campaign Saga, The Scouring of Gate Pass kicks off a war of epic proportions as a mighty magical empire marches for conquest. Their first stop is the vital mountain road through the city of Gate Pass, where the PCs, not yet aware of the role they will play in the coming conflict, lie in the path of a military juggernaut.

As Gate Pass falls under attack, the heroes are tasked with delivering critical intelligence out of the city and to a distant safe haven. First, though, they must deal with agents of the invading empire, spies from other nations, avaricious bounty hunters, and deadly inquisitors. The information they carry may decide the fate of this conflict, the War of the Burning Sky.

Welcome to the first adventure in the War of the Burning Sky Campaign Saga. Throughout the course of the campaign saga, a party of heroes will become involved in an escalating war between mighty magical nations, and after many adventures, military battles, and mysterious intrigue, it will be up to them to decide who will emerge victorious and rule in the aftermath.

The Scouring of Gate Pass is the first adventure in the 12-part War of the Burning Sky Campaign Saga. As the Ragesian Army maches upon the neutral city of Gate Pass, you must retrieve vital war intelligence from a spy and deliver it to the distant wizards' school of Lyceum.

But first you must find a way out of the besieged city before it falls and the inquisitors, Ragesia's infamous mage-hunting clerics, find you.

Can you survive The Scouring of Gate Pass?

68334.name: Willy's Walk to see Grandmamma
68334.description:
A moral race game.

Equipment required: counters of glazed earthenware marked with the letters A to H, teetotum of bone marked with red and black numbers 1 to 6.

Rules:

The game is played with a teetotum and small blocks marked with letters of the alphabet. A player chooses his letter, then spins the teetotum and his block is placed upon the number turned up, of course, according to the directions on the other side. It is best to choose a chairman and allow none to touch the blocks but him. As each player spins, he should call out '6' for 'A' or '2' for 'B' and no persons should spin till the former spinner's move has been made. The coloured squares mark the numbers to which any advantage or disadvantage is attached. If the player makes more than 79, he must count the over plus back - 78,77, and no one is the winner till he has made the exact number.

68335.name: Ewig ist nur Satinav
68335.description:
(from the back of the book)
You, noble lord or lady, wanted only to take a trip to Vinsalt during the opera season, and the night shouldnt bring a more spectacular event then a headache due to bad wine. But because some gods probably sport a very strange humor, you'll find yourself in the midst of events you previously only read about with astonishment in old tomes:
Old unspeakable curses and blasphemies contribute to the present and entangle you into its spell - a spell from which no escape seems possible ...

68336.name: The royal game of the gathering of nations: Exhibition of the industry of all nations
68336.description:
Spiral race game with coloured lithographs illustrating various places and industries. It terminates in the centre with a view of the Great Exhibition building.

Published in London.

68337.name: Über den Greifenpass
68337.description:
(from the back of the book)
In the small town of Gratenfels an aging magician is kidnapped and a crystal ball, which is supposedly stems from the mage wars, is stolen from the garrison. As the lord of the town at the moment can not spare any of his guards, he is looking for a few brave warriors to investigate this crime. Who is more suitable for this task as a party of young heroes who showed courage?
The trail of the kidnappers leads directly into the wintry Kosch mountains, where more adventures wait for the heroes - from the sinister events in a wizards tower to an encounter with a unicorn - until the hideouts of the culprits are found. But then the adventure begins for real ...

68338.name: Asteroids

videogameversion.139205: Android (Atari Greatest Hits Arcade Emulation) edition

68338.description:
"

Asteroids is a video arcade game released in 1979 by Atari Inc. It was one of the most popular and influential games of the Golden Age of Arcade Games. Asteroids uses vector graphics and a two-dimensional view that wraps around in both screen axes (a toroidal topology). The player controls a spaceship in an asteroid field which is periodically traversed by flying saucers. The object of the game is to shoot and destroy asteroids and saucers while not colliding with either, or being hit by the saucers' counter-fire."

Source: Wikipedia, "Asteroids_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68339.name: Lucha
68339.description:
The lights dim. You don your mask. The crowd outside is restless. The music hits. You push through the curtain. You are the champion the crowd has paid to see. They erupt. The world is different in the ring. You pose. Here you are king. You are a luchadore.

"Lucha" is a unique combination of card and dexterity game for 2-4 players. Players each control a "stable" of luchadores competing for fans. Players gain fans by bouncing their luchadores into a ring and attempting to land them in specific places. Cards are played to execute moves and gain resources. The game all changes during the Main Event in which any luchidore can grab a huge number of fans! Ages 10+.

68340.description:
Tell Tale is an improv game based only on picture cards, with four different game rules:

• Questions/Answers: Each player get eight cards and alternately asks another player a question based on a random picture card, and answers another player's question using another card.
• Debate: Draw a random card to get a topic to debate; both players use five random cards to imagine convincing (?) points to support their side.
• Tell me a Story: Both players alternately imagine a very short story (one sentence per card) using five random cards each.
• Same and Again: Same as the previous rule, except both players use the same set of five cards (shuffled between each player's story).

For all of these rules, the winner of the round is designated by the other players.
68340.name: Tell Tale

68341.name: Rückkehr zum Schwarzen Keiler
68341.description:
(from the back of the book)
The inn of the Black Boar - who does not remember this legendary tavern, in which so many a heroic career began? Nearly a quarter of a century in Aventurien later, it is time see what the inn, its residents and the surroundings of the town of Gratenfels have ...

This collection contains the 4 adventures:

A84.1 - Das Geheimnis des Schwarzen Keilers (The secret of the Black Boar)
A84.2 - Der Erbe von Kranick (The heritage of Kranick)
A84.3 - Das steinerne Schiff (The ship of stone)
A84.4 - Geisterstunden (Witching hour)

68342.name: Shadis (Issue 45 - Feb 1998)
68342.description:
"SHADIS Hits the road!"

Month of publication unspecified

Volume 6, No. 8

Cover by Stephen A. Daniele

Bagged issue came with Free Earthdawn CD ROM

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68343.name: Shadis (Issue 46 - Mar 1998)
68343.description:
Month of publication not specified

Volume 6, No. 9

Babylon 5

Cover by Wireframe Productions for Gamemaster's Resource Kit

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68344.name: Mutterliebe
68344.description:
(from the back of the book)
Cursed by his own mother out of vengeance, Ernbrecht Zweistätter, son and heir of a wealthy cattle baron of Weiden, slowly but inexorably turns into a ravenous wolf. Quick help is needed! Is there a possibility to find a powerful mage who can cancel the change?
Or is it necessary to find the mother and force her to take the curse off her son? Is the curse of a malicious act of revenge, or perhaps even a strange expression of ... mother love?
Who could shed light into the darkness of questions quicker than a clever and determined party of heroes?

68345.name: Das Levthansband
68345.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Even the cheerful are not immune from misfortune, and certainly not in an area where the Orcs are the true masters of the country and the only law seems to be lawlessness: in the Svelltland. And who could have an interest to take possession of an ancient, sacred artifact that may plunge entire regions into chaos if it falls into the wrong hands? What role do the witches of Rorwhed play? What's the deal with the unusual activity of the silver wolves? At the request of the priest of the temple of Rahja at Tiefhusen your heroes are drawn into the events that take influence far beyond the borders of Svelltland soon...

68346.name: Royal Geographical Amusement or the Safe and Expeditious Traveller Through all the Parts of Europe by Sea and by Land
68346.description:
The gameboard showing a map of Europe with the principal and capital cities numbered. Together with printed sheet of rules and descriptive text.

He who has the highest number in spinning the totum, is to begin, and the others are to follow according to their respective numbers. Three Gentlemen or Ladies are supplied to make the tour of Europe. They are represented by the three Turned Pillars, called Travellers, each of the players having one of these, which is to be placed at the stage corresponding to the number turned up. The four counters, of the same colour with the Traveller, are to be employed as Markers, and take the name SERVANTS. The player is to lay down as many of these as he is ordered to wait turns, and when it comes to his turn to spin again, instead of spinning he must take up one Marker, and so on, till they are all taken up.

Published December 1st, 1823.

68347.name: Tal der Finsternis
68347.description:
(from the back of the book)
The Third Battle of Demons is over, with all its consequences for the Empire and the lost provinces. Now it's time to take a new beginning, and so the young heiress Rohaja of Gareth will take the royal title of the heart of the empire as soon as possible. Not an easy task in these troubled times.
Accompany the royal twins Rohaja and Yppolita on a journey through the provinces of Garetien, Almada, Kosch and Darpatien in the employ of the adminstrator of the empire. Encounter wayward noblemen, dark forests and cities with refugees, and the the border of the dark lands themselves ...

68348.name: Shadis (Issue 47 - Apr 1998)
68348.description:
Month of publication calculated, not specified
Being chock full of April Fools content helps :)

Volume 6, No. 10

Cover credited to Archangel Entertainment and the Three Stooges Comedy Archive

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68350.name: Final Fantasy

videogamehonor.29417: 2007 Golden Joystick Mobile Game of the Year Winner

68350.description:
"Final Fantasy is a console role-playing game created by Hironobu Sakaguchi, developed and published in Japan by Square (now Square Enix) in 1987, and published in North America by Nintendo of America in 1990. It is the first game in Square's Final Fantasy series. Originally released for the Nintendo Entertainment System, Final Fantasy was remade for several video game consoles and is frequently packaged with Final Fantasy II in video game collections. The story follows four youths called the Light Warriors, who each carry one of their world's four elemental orbs which have been darkened by the four Elemental Fiends. Together, they quest to defeat these evil forces, restore light to the orbs, and save their world.
"

Source: Wikipedia, "Final_Fantasy_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Individual credits:
Hironobu Sakaguchi: Director
Nobuo Uematsu: Music
Yoshitaka Amano: Character & monster design

68351.name: A New Royal Geographical Pastime for England and Wales
68351.description:
At the gameboard there are 169 principal and county towns joined by lines. The descriptions and rules on either side of the map list each town and any rewards or forfeits to be made. There are no charges for moving from one place to another. One of the better rewards occurs at Stonehenge 'worthy of visiting without expense, from whence you are to be removed to Chester at 148'. One of the harshest is at Knaresborough, 163, 'which has four medicinal springs of different qualities; to drink from them you must pay 1 counter and are conveyed to Bath, 2'.

The game itself is enlightening, for it not only refers to visiting stately homes, cathedrals, churches and other public buildings but also describes events, folklore, and geographical features such as smuggling, the flitch of bacon given at Dunmow and the Giant's Causeway.

Published June 1st, 1787.

Equipment required: teetotum, ivory pillars (markers), counters

68352.name: Grandmama's New Game of Natural History
68352.description: The center of sheet for the board for this game shows an elderly woman seated at a table surrounded by 24 compartments with fairy tale and nursery rhyme characters. There are the same number of cards with these characters together with another 36 cards showing birds and animals printed with descriptions and four lines of verse. Some of these are placed in the compartments. Players take turns to draw the character cards and collect the verse cards from the corresponding compartment. The winner is the player with most verse cards at the end of the game.

68353.name: Columbia or the Land of the West
68353.description:
The game begins with the discovery of America by Christopher Columbus in 1492, and ends with the Treaty of Independence of 1782. It can be played either historically or topographically.

There are 36 dated entries in the rules booklet that describe the history of North America and the United States from 1492 to 1782. There is also a list of 38 states and capitals, including six that are Canadian, still British possessions at the time of the game.

68354.name: Master of the Fallen Fortress
68354.description:
From the back of the book:

Storm the Lost Tower!

The ruined siege castles outside Absalom have long beckoned adventurers looking to make a name for themselves. Now an earthquake has cracked open one of these fabled ruins, and its lost mysteries and fantastic treasures lie exposed for the first time in centuries. But the tower's empty halls once more echo with living footfalls, and a new master has claimed the Fallen Fortress as his own. Can the PCs find a way to get inside its shattered walls? What ancient dangers and fresh threats will they encounter inside its crumbling chambers? And will the PCs be able to defeat the current Master of the Fallen Fortress?

Master of the Fallen Fortress is a dungeon-based adventure for 1st-level chararacters, written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and compatible with the 3.5 edition of the world's oldest RPG. It also serves as an introduction to Pathfinder Society Organized Play (Paizo's constantly evolving, world-wide mega-campaign). The adventure involves exploring an ancient, ruined tower and rescuing the captured Pathfinder held within.

This adventure is set outside the great city of Absalom in the Pathfinder Chronicles campaign setting, but can be easily adapted for any game world. It also contains a preview of the six new iconic characters from the upcoming Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Advanced Player’s Guide, available August 2010.

68355.name: The Fancy Bazaar or Aristocratic Traders
68355.description:
Mainly a card game, with the gameboard being a place to put the counters.

The aim of the Bazaar is fourfold: to aid the Acclimatisation of Society, to help pay the National Debt, to raise a fund to build a bridge from Dover to Calais, and to build a school to teach Grown Children.

The stalls are run as follows: the Fruiterer and Greengrocer is Lady Verysoft, the Grocer is Mrs Plausible, the Pastrycook is Miss Wheedleton, the Toy Dealer is Baroness Goodchild, the Earthenware Dealer is the Duchess of Otherland, the Hosier and Glover is Viscountess Pumicestone, the Poulterer is Miss Silverstone, and the Florist is the Marchioness of Bailbury.

Most of the cards relate to the goods found on these stalls. The players take the part of the various stall holders. The cards are dealt out to the players in turn, who have to follow the instructions of paying counters to the various stalls.

68356.name: Outward bound or ships and their cargoes
68356.description:
The gameboard showing 5 compartments each illustrating a sailing ship. 5 large cards also showing the same ships. 35 small cards representing the captain, pilot and cargo of each ship.

When a player has played all his cards, he is out of the game and may lay his ship and cards aside. If it should happen that only two players remain at the last, the winning player sweeps the board, that is takes all the counters in the five compartments.

68357.name: British sovereigns  or the circle of British history
68357.description:
A puzzle of 37 non interlocking pieces, hand cut, hand coloured lithograph with back covered with cream paper and 88 cards from a set of 90.

The pieces form a gameboard showing kings and queens in two concentric circles of 36 numbered areas. In each corner is a design of roses, thistles and shamrocks. In the centre is a disc giving the title and maker's details on a pink ground. The cards give details of each monarch from William I to Queen Victoria.

Published in London.

68358.description: A little luck and skill are needed for this game but it also trains colour recognition and memory. The two different ways of playing this game offer variety and plenty of fun. The players take turns pushing the bees into the slots in the beehive. As soon as a bee "flies out" the player takes it and puts it down on his/her card. Depending on which variant of the game is being played the winner is either the first player to fill his/her card with bees or the last to do. The players should sit side by side so that they can all see which bee is being pushed into which slot.
68358.name: Busy Bee

68359.name: Classic Treasures Revisited
68359.description:
From the back of the book:

The Ultimate Reward

Every adventurer dreams of glittering treasures and magical relics, and such remarkable rewards spur the quests and ignite the imaginations of history’s greatest heroes, driving them to greatness—or their doom. Yet above coins of gold and gem-studded baubles rise those riches that are themselves the envy of kings, the causes of calamities, and the stuff of legends. With the power to slay titanic beasts, reduce whole castles to ruin, and change the flow of fate, such mythic items fill the stories of sages and treasure seekers the world over. And now, the greatest of these wonders rest within your hands.

This compendium of curiosities reveals the magic and legacy of 10 of the most famous and infamous items and artifacts in the history of fantasy roleplaying. From the head-slicing swipes of the vorpal sword to the awesome magical might of the staff of the magi, the depthless bag of holding to the worldwarping deck of many things, the investigations within reveal the mysterious creations, cunning uses, magical variations, and untold other secrets of these ultimate treasures.

No matter the campaign setting, Classic Treasures Revisited unleashes a hoard of history’s greatest magic items upon your game—along with all the adventures they inspire—and proves that true treasures never tarnish.

68360.name: Giuoco dei personaggi
68360.description:
Game characters

A race game with an oval track of 56 numbered squares, each with a named illustration and a central illustration showing a pair of men battling in front of a building. Three corners are filled with a triangle showing a floral pattern; the fourth, lower left, shows a building.

Published in Venice, Italy.

68361.name: Batman: Arkham Asylum

videogamehonor.31910: 2009 Game Critics Game of the Year Nominee

68361.description: The Dark Knight returns. In this action adventure game, players control Batman in third-person action adventure on the island of Arkham Asylum. As Batman takes the Joker to Arkham (per usual), the Joker has made plans to take over the Asylum with Batman in it. Batman's job is to use his fighting skills, high-tech gadgets, and his sharp wits to find the Joker (and also the Riddler, if the player so desires) and bring him to justice.

68362.name: War of the Burning Sky Campaign Guide (OGL d20 3.x)
68362.description:
From the publisher:
