This free supplement is designed for GMs running the War of the Burning Sky Campaign Saga. It is not intended to be read by players. Players should instead download the Player's Guide.

War of the Burning Sky is a high fantasy campaign saga that thrusts the player characters into a war of mythic proportions.

Ever-escalating conflicts, powered by mighty magic and fervent faith, threaten the heroes' freedom and lives, and even the world itself.

Prepare to orchestrate a magic-powered war with the story, background, and rules material in the War of the Burning Sky Campaign Guide.

War is coming: what happens next?

In this free download, GMs will find: a detailed overview of the entire campaign saga, a timeline for the War of the Burning Sky, details on how to run adbridged campaigns dealing with only part of the saga, advice on tweaking the saga to fit into your own, or another published campaign setting, suggestions for expanding the campaign with numerous hooks for side plots and adventures, rules material covering magic items, alternate class abilities, special feats, new monsters such as the trillith, and more.

68363.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice (Issue 8 - Fall 1980)
68363.description:
From the Table of Contents

Troll Talk/Editorial - Liz Danforth

Rogue's Quest: Mini-solo adventure for Tunnels & Trolls by Antony Dismukes

Troll Teasers - Puzzles y El Frederick and Ken St Andre

Where do you meet...? Contest about where images were published

But Are there Dungeons in Russia? Review of TSR's Top Secret RPG by Mark Zutkoff

Queries & Quandaries

Arcane Graffiti: News, clues and reviews by Michael Stackpole

Weapons Shop: The Kusari-Gama - Antony Dismukes & Tom Rushford

Letters to the editor

The Bells of Shoredan: short story by Roger Zelazny

The Bigger They Are... - article by Michael Stackpole

Daring Dungeon Design - article by John M. Morrison

68364.name: Halo: Combat Evolved

videogamefranchise.6406: Best of Platinum Hits (Select Best Selling Xbox Games, US)

videogamehonor.31489: 2000 Game Critics Best Action Game of the Year Winner

68364.description: You are the ultimate commando - a cybernetically enhanced soldier representing the peak of human military evolution. You are efficient, skilled, and dangerous. A sci-fi shooter that takes place on a mysterious alien ring-world, Halo will have you battling through amazing indoor and outdoor environments, in vehicles, and on foot with the largest arsenal of futuristic weapons, vehicles, and combat roles of any shooter ever.

68365.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice (Issue 15 - Summer 1982)
68365.description:
From the Table of Contents

Fiction
The Opal Egg - Robert E. Vardeman
Pharaoh's Revenge - C. Bruce Hunter

Articles

We Who Are About To Die - Glenn Rahman
When in Rome - Matthew Shaw

Gaming

First Command: A T&T mini solo adventure - Ken St Andre
Magic Stuff in Tunnels & Trolls - Roy Cram
Skills in Tunnels & Trolls - Michael Stackpole

Features
Troll Talk/Editorial - Liz Danforth
Letters to the editor
Arcane Graffiti: Game Reviews - Michael Stackpole
"Oh There It Is": Retail Stores Classifieds
Broken Spines: Book Reviews
Queries and Quandaries - Michael Stackpole et al
Troll Teasers: Puzzles
Limerick Contest

68366.name: Special Forces: Modern Military Boardgame
68366.description:
Special Forces, the world of the guerrilla warfare operative, allowing you to take control of a team of these highly trained operators as they under take missions behind enemy lines.

Players have the option to use a team of operators from a well known and respected regiment or customise their own team. The board comprises of a base section onto which building tiles are placed based on the layouts found in the ‘Missions and Scenarios’ book. After that it is up to the player to decide the best way to complete their objectives. All players take control of the special forces operatives or operators working together to complete the aims of the mission at hand.

68369.name: Fleet
68369.description:
Fleet is a space battle between small fleets for 2-5 players using 1-2 Treehouse sets and a few coins.

Players move 3 or 5 (depending on the setup) Icehouse ships around on the surface, in an attempt to out-maneuver and destroy their opponents. Larger ships can move farther than smaller ships and take more damage to destroy. Use the black hole, wormhole, and special weapon to your advantage against your enemies. Last fleet standing is the winner.

Fleet was designed by Josh Cole. The full rules are available at http://icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Fleet

68370.name: Dezzavold: Fortress of the Drow
68370.description:
From the back of the book:

War is Coming From Below!

Dezzavold: Fortress of the Drow, Green Ronin's companion book to Plot & Poison: A Guidebook to Drow, provides a fully detailed dark elf settlement for your d20 fantasy campaign. You can send your players against Dezzavold or use it as the backdrop for a dark, dangerous campaign. Dezzavold: Fortress of the Drow includes:

The complete history and background of the fortress, from its founding to the current day.
Details on Dezzavold's rulers, people, and defenders.
Three new arachnid monsters.
Two new core classes--the black heart and the netherstrider--and four new prestige classes.
Dozens of fully statted and ready-to-use NPCs.
Full compliance with the 3.5 rules.
City and region maps.
Stunning art from Caleb Cleveland, Jonathan Kirtz, Mike Vilardi, Beth Trott & Liz Danforth
And a whole lot more!




Dezzavold was first introduced in Corwyl: Village of the Wood Elves. While four centuries have passed since the Dark War with Corwyl, the drow have not forgotten their treacherous elven kin. Now, in their city on the edge of the Below, the dark elves ready for war. And their leader, the Black Heart of Nyarleth, will show no mercy!

68372.name: Planet Earth Board Game
68372.description:
From http://www.catchoftheday.com.au/smallfish_info.php?products_...:

Explore, discover & learn about our world!

What are cicadas- insects, plants or animals? Antarctica is in which hemisphere- Northern or Southern? An elephant's tusks are actually teeth- true or false? A interactive game the whole family can enjoy, and test your knowledge as you roll the dice and journey around the board in the Planet Earth Board Game.

* Featuring stunning imagery and incredible facts
* Explore, discover and learn more about Planet Earth
* Educational and fun to play
* Includes game board, player tokens, 55 question cards, dice and player guide

Correctly answer questions about the unique regions of our planet and be the first player with three tokens on home region spaces to win the game. But watch out, other players will be trying to swap their tokens with yours!

68373.name: Relic Raiders: Mystic Tower and the Book of Spells
68373.description:
User Summary:

This is a 3D pop-up game that requires no assembly, yet allows the pathways to be moved during play. Find the ancient relic and escape while avoiding the monsters that dwell within. Of course, monsters can be persuaded to pursue your opponents, instead. Player and monster movement is determined by playing cards, just as in its sister game, Relic Raiders: Haunted Ruins.

68374.name: World's Greatest Party Game
68374.description:
Acting, Searching, Drawing, Creating! More ways to have fun at a party than you can shake a stick at!

Incredible Value -- three complete games in one box

Drawing Game: with a twist -- everyone draws (no special skill necessary) amd all players are involved with the game at all times.

Charades Game: has categories with outrageous content leading to great fun for all.

Scavenger Hunt -- game allows everyone to get up and have fun while creating things and finding stuff in and around the house

Back of box.

A die roll determines the nature of the challenge, This collection offers charades, scavenger hunt and an unusual drawing game in which people try to guess what a player is going to choose to draw from a short list of terms.

68375.name: World's Greatest Word Game
68375.description:
A Fabulous Game for Everyone who Loves Words -- Includes Word Poker, Word Scramble, and Word Builder

Combines three fantastic word games:

Word Scramble: Everyone works at once building as many words as possible using communal letter tiles. Player at the end with the most words wins the game -- fast and furious fun.

Word Builder: Build off other players words and be the first to run out of letters dealt -- play speeds up as the game progresses making for a fun and hectic finish.

Word Poker: Make the best poker hand you can while building words at the same time. Best hand wins unless you can out bluff your opponents during betting. Great combination of play in an incredibly fun game.

68376.name: Shadis (Issue 49 - Jul 1998)
68376.description:
"SHADIS Goes to War!"

Volume 6, Number 12

July 1998

Cover uncredited

This issue showed a total change to the table of contents from previous issues.

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68378.name: Shadis (Issue 50 - Aug 1998)
68378.description:
"Greyhawk Returns"

Volume 7, Number 1

August 1998

Cover "Maximum Black" by Tim Bradstreet

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68379.name: Sushi Panic!
68379.description:
A dexterity balance game along the lines of Buckaroo. Draw a card, place the correct piece of plastic sushi on the unsteady table and if your hand wasn't steady enough KABOOOOM the table flips sending the sushi everywhere!
Quick, easy and with fun, colourful and chunky sushi pieces.

- User summary

68380.name: Shadis (Issue 51 - Sep 1998)
68380.description:
Volume 7, Number 2

September 1998

Cover uncredited, from Dream Pod 9's Heavy Gear

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68381.name: Shadis (Issue 52 - Oct 1998)
68381.description:
"Halloween Celebration"

Volume 7, Number 3

October 1998

Cover credited to the White Wolf team

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68382.name: Shadis (Issue 53 - Nov 1998)

rpgissuearticle.37562: Con Artistry - Con Artists and the Art of the Con

68382.description:
Volume 7, Number 4

November 1998

Cover "Squid Eating Ship in Color #7" credited to Pinnacle

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68384.name: Paladin: Inquisitor
68384.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Play an Inquisitor wielding both Arms and Scripture to fight back the incursion of sin. A church-laden future setting and new rules for Clinton R. Nixon's Paladin.

68385.name: Verbal Volley Middle School Expansion Pack
68385.description:
An expansion to Verbal Volley, with 172 conceptual vocabulary words.

Players ply for eachother of within teams. Players come up with synonyms or antonyms. It's a race against the clock.

68387.description:
Across the muddy no-man's land, your troops advance to victory, in this strategic game of attack and counter attack set in the trenches of World War One.
Winning is achieved in two ways, a bloody victory though assaults driving your opponent from one of their trench sectors, or secondly by the eroding of morale from the constant pounding of artillery, gas attacks and machine gun fire on the trenchzone front.
The game encourages a commander to plan strategically, however commanders will have to alter their battle plans as resources become available through placement of cards into a sector or as a result of your opponent’s actions.
After your initial set up of Artillery Positions, Pillboxes, Barbed Wire and Squads, your sectors are reinforced or reduced by your orders or your opponents actions in each sector. It's your choice as the commander to wait for reinforcements or to take the initiative and advance across no man’s land.
Who will advance to victory?

(Blurb, Designer)

Contents:
•1 Trenchzone Board
•1 Rules
•Rules Reference Card with Victory Tracker
•90 Command Cards
•6 Dice

Player A
–10 x10 strength squads
–20 x5 strength squads
–20 x 1 strength squads
Player B
–10 x10 strength squads
–20 x5 strength squads
–20 x 1 strength squads

•6 Artillery Positions
•12 Pill Boxes
•6 MG Positions
•10 Wire sections
•1 Mud token
•4 Gas tokens
•1 Victory token
68387.name: Trenchzone

68388.name: Donjon: Planescape
68388.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Alternate mechanics for Donjon combined with notes on Planescape gaming.

68390.name: Fighter-D Alpha
68390.description:
User Summary:

Rules for running an RPG based on the Street Fighter computer game using Donjon. Included are:


Character creation rules and downloadable character sheet (PDF format).
Detailed action resolution rules.
Items: their use by characters and the acquisition of treasure.
Combat, including special moves, tag team attacks, and air-juggling enemies.
Character progression through power points and fighter score.
Brief notes on how to run a session.
Monsters, with a range of pregenerated monsters and some rules on how to create more.
Sample fighters as used in the author's campaign.

68391.name: Mentirosa
68391.description:
Mentirosa© is a version of liar's dice that is played with Spanish Poker dice and the exclusive Mentirosa Player Tubes available only in this timeless game set.

The object of the game is to guess what your opponents have rolled without going over.

Unlike traditional poker games that require a poker face and mostly silence, Mentirosa encourages you to trash talk, taunt and tease your opponents. It's the main strategy, hence the name of the game: Mentirosa (Spanish: liar).

EACH SET INCLUDES:

* 6 Mentirosa Player's Tubes
* 6 sets of casino-grade poker dice
* Loser Chips : These chips will help you keep track of the winners and losers.
* Mentirosa Professional or Travel storage case
* Instructions in English and Spanish.

2 to 20 Players (with extra sets) Ages 10 and up.


How to play Mentirosa

In this version of liar's dice, the object of the game is to guess the number rolled, of any suit, among all the dice.

To begin the game, each player rolls a single die in open view of other players. The player
with the highest suit starts the play. If a tie occurs, only those players in the tie roll again.

Players throw five poker dice into their tube. They look in their tube to see what they rolled.

A turn begins when the starting a player makes a call, for example three Jacks. This
means they believe that there are at least three Jacks among all the dice in play.

The next player has two options:

1. Raise the call. This is done by, raising the suit called, raising the number of dice
called, or both. In this example, the next player could call three Queens, three
Kings, three Aces, or four of anything else. Any of these would be higher than the
three Jacks called. Or...

2. Challenge the call. When a player challenges a call, he or she does not believe
that the hand called, in this case three Jacks, exists among all the dice in play.
To challenge, a player raises their tube, revealing their hand and signaling to the
other players to do the same. At this point, the suit in play is counted.

In this example, if there are at least three Jacks among all the dice in play, the
challenger receives a loser chip and a new turn begins. If there are less than three Jacks among the dice in play, the calling player receives a loser chip and a new turn begins.

The loser begins the next turn. There is no passing. Once a call is raised, it is the next player’s turn and he or she has the same two options.The game continues in this manner, player after player, until a call is challenged.

Once a player receives 5 loser chips, they are out of the game. Last man standing wins!


History of Mentirosa

The game of Mentirosa® is known in many countries, by many different names. Its ancestry comes from a close relative, Cubilete, a game known to have been played as early as the Roman Era, especially in Spain.

Traveling to the Americas during the Spanish Empire, it became widely popular in Cuba and other parts of Latin America during the 19th and 20th centuries.

It is rumored that Mentirosa came about when the American GI's in Cuba combined the popular American game, Liar's Poker, with the cups and Spanish Poker dice used to play Cubilete.

Arriving in South Florida with exiled Cubans in the 1950s, Mentirosa’s 21st century rebirth will give a new generation of players the opportunity to enjoy this classic game the way it was meant to be played.

Source: www.mentirosa.org

68393.name: Panzer
68393.description:
User Summary:
One of Gamecraft's Pocket Wars games. A series of short, simple 2-player Abstract Strategy wargames.

This game has players moving their force of 5 'panzer' tokens toward each other in a head-to-head manner along the 5 columns of the game board.

68394.name: Front Line
68394.description:
"Front Line is a military combat-themed arcade game released in 1982 by Taito Corporation.

The original arcade version consists of a joystick, a single button (other than the "player one" and "player two" start buttons), and a rotary dial that can be pushed in like a button, which fires the weapon. The single button is used to throw grenades, and to enter and exit the tank."

Source: Wikipedia, "Front_Line_(arcade_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68395.name: Mass Effect

videogamefranchise.28570: EA Value Games (Best Selling Electronic Arts Games, PAL)

videogameexpansion.69404: Mass Effect: Bring Down the Sky

videogamehonor.31808: 2006 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Nominee

68395.description:
User summary:
Mass Effect is an action RPG and the first game in a space trilogy by developer BioWare. While comparisons may be made to their previous Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic games, Mass Effect gives the player more control over combat and is set in an original universe. Some of the races populating this universe are blue-skinned Asari, synthetic-killing machines called Geth, and large saurian warriors known as Krogan.

During the game you play as Commander Shepard, the first human chosen as an elite S.P.E.C.T.R.E. agent, tasked with investigating an ancient Prothean artifact on the planet Eden Prime. The game plays as a third-person shooter with the ability to pause combat and use the special abilities of both Shepard and squad members (all of which you can level up). As the game progresses you will also collect new weapons and armor to upgrade your squad, and new members will join you on your quest. The game features numerous dialog options, but uses a reactionary system where the player merely chooses what type of response they want without seeing the actual dialog choices. In order to maintain a cinematic experience BioWare chose to voice the main character as well as all NPCs, unusual for a game with such heavy RPG elements.

From the game box:

An ancient threat returns.

One final hope emerges.

As commander Shepard, you lead an elite squad on a heroic, action-packed adventure throughout the galaxy. Discover the imminent danger from an ancient threat and battle the traitorous Saren and his deadly army to save civilization. The fate of all life depends on your actions!

68397.name: Mass Effect 2

videogamefranchise.28570: EA Value Games (Best Selling Electronic Arts Games, PAL)

videogamehonor.31877: 2009 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Nominee

68397.description:
User Summary:
Mass Effect 2 is an action RPG and the second game in a space trilogy by developer BioWare. It continues the story from the first game while streamlining both combat and leveling up. You may choose to import a save file from the first game or create a new one. By importing many of the decisions you made in the first game will have a small impact on the situation in the second.

No longer a Spectre agent working for the alien council, or a commander of a human System Alliance ship, Mass Effect 2 sees Shepard teaming up with the shadowy Cerberus corporation in order to investigate the disappearance of human colonies--and possibly prevent another assault from the Reapers. During your quest you will run into old contacts, as well as recruit new squad members.

Many criticisms of the first game have been addressed. The planet-exploring Mako has been replaced with a faster, nimbler hovercraft called the Hammerhead (while the missions containing the Hammerhead can only be accessed via downloadable content, they are free to anyone who purchased the game new). Secondary missions offer more variety and no longer occur in the same sterile, white-washed facilities that dominated the first game. Infinite ammo has been removed. Weapons now require thermal clips, and sub-machine guns and a variety of heavy weapons have been added to the game. Combat still occurs from a third person over-the-shoulder perspective, but each squad member can now only activate one biotic power at a time--and must wait for it to cooldown before activating another. This speeds up combat by lessening the amount of time spent pausing the game and issuing orders. You still earn points to spend on your squad members by leveling them up, but there are now fewer levels per power and fewer powers available. However, by collecting schematics scattered around the galaxy and researching them on your ship you can acquire new weapons or provide bonuses for your team.

From the game box:

Entire human colonies on many worlds are vanishing. As Commander Shepard, you must assemble the galaxy's deadliest team to save mankind against impossible odds.

They call it a suicide mission.

Prove them wrong.

68398.name: Jade Empire

videogamehonor.31760: 2004 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Nominee

68398.description:
From the game box:

The Jade Empire has withstood countless attacks, but the greatest threats come from within. As a master of the martial arts, will you restore this ancient land to it's glory, or crush it beneath your heel?

68399.name: Dragon (Issue 244 - Feb 1998)

rpgissuearticle.46724: Arcane Lore - Spells of Elemental Air

68399.description:
Take to the Skies! Airships and Wind Warriors!

Vol. XXII, No. 7
Cover art by Roger Raupp

68400.name: Schimmen en Schaduwen Magieboek
68400.description:
From the Rulebook:

Extra rules for the use of magic in the game: Schimmen en Schaduwen.

68401.name: Animal Archives Vol. 2: South American Animals
68401.description:
From the back cover:

Animal Archives 2 presents ten animals that are native to the South American continent. Each animal has its own page for easy printing and integration into your campaign and all of the entries are fully illustrated and referenced against a human silhouette to show your players just what they are up against! This PDF is bookmarked so you can find the animal you need quickly.

In this volume you will find -
Alpaca (Lama pacos)
Jaguar (Panthera onca)
Spectacled Caiman (Caiman crocodylus)
Harpy Eagle (Harpia harpyia)
Electric Eel (Electrophorus electricus)
Golden Arrow-poison Frog (Dendrobates auratus)
Giant Otter (Pteronura brasiliensis)
Golden Lion Tamarin (Leontopithecus rosalia)
Anaconda (Eunectes murinus)
Maned Wolf (Chrysocyon brachyurus)

68402.name: Animal Archives Vol. 3: Fantasy Animals
68402.description:
User Summary:

Presents 10 fantasy monsters for use in d20 campaigns:

Arol
Brushtongue
Cafret
Cat, Snow Sabre
Dist
Dog, Goblin Terrier
Dovo
Nablop
Rund
Shambotar

68403.name: The Rite Review (Issue 1 - Mar 2010)
68403.description:
Contents of this issue:

Cover Illustration by Joe Calkins
Editorial by Steven D. Russell
Relics of Questhaven (Cloak of Biting Shadows; Dragonfang Club of Old Corrode; Nessian Amulet) by Steven D. Russell
50 Questions: Frank Carr the Jade Mandarin talks about Heroes of the Jade Oath (3.5 / Arcana Evolved)
The Stone of Insanity (a variable-level encounter for D&D or Pathfinder RPG) by Bill Collins
Raise Dead (five alternative solutions to the process of raising the dead, to add the unexpected back into your horror campaigns) by Mark Gedak
Faradian of Questhaven (converting a monster that appears in Race for the Crystal Fold to the Questhaven setting for Pathfinder) by Steven D. Russell
Curses! (a few new cursed items with which to vex your Pathfinder players: Ring of Energy Attraction; Ring of Vampiric Regeneration; Moonstone Amulet) by Mark Gedak
Liseli (CR21 Advanced Elder Fiend Succubus Godling) by Steven D. Russell and Shane O'Connor
New Monster: Carrion Wolf (CR6 CE Medium Undead) Our Cover Story by Mark Gedak
New Monster: Strife Elemental (CR3 N Medium Outsider) by Steven D. Russell
New Magic Items: 5 Weapon Properties (Blood Bonded; Breaker; Bushwacking; Ceremonial; Clinging) by Steven D. Russell
Undying Love (a selection of creatures that can fit into the theme of undying love: the Flesh Golem; the Mummy; the Revenant) by Mark Gedak
The Honorable Order of Theurgic Master Craftsmen (an independent craftsmen's guild for Questhaven) by Steven D. Russell
Commissioning Cartography (a few pointers for publishers looking to commission a map) by Jonathan Roberts of Fantastic Maps
Rite Reviews! by Shane O' Conner: The Rite Recommendations for Luven Lightfinger's Gear and Treasure Shop plus Restless Souls

68404.name: Shadis (Issue 48 - Jun 1998)
68404.description:
Volume 6, Number 11

June 1998

Cover "Artie and Hunn" by Ray Lago

Some atrocious editing in this issue, including misspellings and first and last names of authors swapped.

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68405.name: Netz der Mörder
68405.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Gareth! Capital of the Empire! Magnificent palaces, colourful markets, magnificent temples - who can resist the charm of the largest city of Aventurien? You succumb to the temptations that the city offers, and quickly find yourself on the downside: poverty, corruption and crime.

Travion Domonto, the well-known philanthropist and honourable merchant, has been murdered. The guard is currently under pressure and is glad to find only one suspect: you. Can you escape the city before the hangman's rope puts an end to your life? Perhaps even prove your innocence? Or catch yourself in the network of murderers?

68406.name: Zyklopenfeuer
68406.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Even the temple of the goddess of wisdom, Hesinde, is not immune to temptations and delusions: While a scholar is hoping to get the help of a party of heroes for a treasure hunt, already gloomy conspirators became aware of him, and soon the adventurers are tangled in a web of intrigue and secrecy.

Will they succeed in finding a unique treasure? Will they manage to uncover a mystery that is as old as the fall of Bosparan? And what is the mysterious Fire of the Cyclops (Zyklopenfeuer)? Send in a party of brave and heroic people devoted to Hesinde to lift the veil of the past.

68407.name: Super Mario Bros.

videogamefranchise.28200: NES Black Box (1980s NES Games, US)

68407.description:
From the game box:

Do you have what it takes to save the Mushroom Princess?

You'll have to think fast and move even faster to complete this quest! The Mushroom Princess is being held captive by the evil Koopa tribe of turtles. It's up to you to rescue her from the evil clutches of King Koopa before time runs out. But it won't be easy. To get to the princess, you'll have to climb mountains, cross seas, avoid bottomless pits, fight off turtle soldiers and a host of black magic traps that only a Koopa King can devise! It's another non-stop adventure from the Super Mario bros.!

Individual credits:
Koji Kondo: Music

68408.name: Sonic Chronicles: The Dark Brotherhood

videogamehonor.31847: 2008 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee

68408.description:
From the game box:

Explore and epic world filled with untold obstacles and shadowy foes! With Dr. Eggman defeated, Sonic's world is at peace... until a mysterious menace kidnaps Knuckles. Sonic must band with 10 others using teamwork and strategy to combat the Dark Brotherhood.

68409.name: Super Mario Bros. 2
68409.description:
From the game box

This time it's a fierce action-packed battle to free the land of Subcon from the curse of the evil Wart. It's up to you along with Mario, Luigi, Toad and the Princess to fight your way through bizarre multi-level worlds and find him! This time you've got a band new kind of power - plucking power - and now anything you find can be a weapon. But beware! You've never seen creatures like these! Shyguys and Tweeters! Ninji and Beezos! And you've never had an adventure like this! Only cunning and speed can save you now...

Note: released in the US as Super Mario Bros. 2, this is a re-themed version of Doki Doki Panic. Another game titled Super Mario Bros. 2 was released in Japan. This version plays very similar to the original Super Mario Bros.

68410.name: TNA iMPACT!
68410.description:
"TNA Impact!: Total Nonstop Action Wrestling is the first video game released by the professional wrestling promotion, Total Nonstop Action Wrestling (TNA). The game was developed by Midway Studios in Los Angeles and published by Midway Games."

Source: Wikipedia, "TNA_Impact!_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68411.name: Dead Stars
68411.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The infamous Rogue Trader Erasmus Haarlock is set to return, and only the Inquisition stands in the way of his dark revenge...

Dead Stars is the conclusion to The Haarlock's Legacy Trilogy, a definitive series of epic Dark Heresy adventures that began with Tattered Fates and continued with Damned Cities. Terrible threats stir amongst the worlds visited by the mysterious Rogue Trader line of Haarlock. What has been left behind threatens everything the Inquisition has worked for in the Calixis Sector.

Dead Stars takes Acolytes to the forbidden ice world of Mara and the haunted planet of Dusk, where they must make a fateful decision that affects the future of the entire Calixis Sector. Old enemies and allies join the struggle on both sides will the Acolytes be able to survive the terrible conclusion to the Haarlock's Legacy trilogy?

With multiple paths to success, Dead Stars offers a satisfying experience for new and veteran Dark Heresy players alike. This summer, unravel the mystery of Haarlock's Legacy!

68412.name: Xbox 360 Core
68412.description: The original non-HDMI version of the Xbox 360

videogame.89104: Borderlands: Game of the Year Edition

68413.name: Borderlands

videogamehonor.31910: 2009 Game Critics Game of the Year Nominee

68413.description: From the back of the box: Get ready for mind-blowing insanity, as one of four trigger happy mercenaries, taking out everything that stands in your way.

68414.name: BioShock 2

videogamehonor.31880: 2009 Game Critics Best Action Game of the Year Nominee

68414.description: From the back of the box: The undersea city of Rapture stands in ruin. Somewhere deep within, your Little Sister awaits. Once, you protected her and now, amongst hordes of genetically-altered maniacs, she is your only hope for salvation.

68415.name: Crackdown

videogamefranchise.6412: Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)

videogamehonor.32692: 2008 British Academy Game Awards Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Winner

68415.description: From the back of the box: As a genetically enhanced agent of justice, it's your job to rid the city of crime - by any means necessary. You're the extreme solution to an extreme problem, as you attempt to take out 21 gang bosses and restore order to a sprawling metropolis teeming with lawlessness and strife.

68416.name: Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts & Bolts
68416.description: From the back of the box: Banjo and Kazooie are facing their greatest adventure yet, battling long-time nemesis Gruntilda for rightful ownership of Spiral Mountain. Use your wits and imagination to invent wild and wonderful contraptions so Banjo and Kazooie can crush this wicked witch. Rule the road, sky and water in the land of Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts & Bolts!

68417.name: Halo 3

videogamehonor.31831: 2007 Game Critics Best Action Game of the Year Nominee

68417.description: From the Back of the Box: The Covenant controls Earth, the all-consuming Flood is unleashed and the fate of the galaxy hangs in the balance. An ancient secret buried under the sands of Africa for untold millennia may hold the key to our salvation or our doom. Spartan-117, the Master Chief, a biologically augmented super-soldier, must uncover that secret and stop the forces that threaten us once and for all. He is the last of his kind, a warrior born for combat, bred for war... and humanity's only hope.

68419.name: Sonic Adventure

videogamefranchise.6395: Player's Choice (Best Selling Nintendo Games, US & EU)

videogamehonor.29655: 2000 D.I.C.E. Best Visual Engineering of the Year Nominee

68419.description:
User summary and Japanese Wikipedia http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ソニックアドベンチャー:

A 3D action game released in 1998 by Sonic Team for the Dreamcast. The player could choose between six characters and try to clear the different stages, running around in a 3d environment trying to reach the stage goals.

About one year later, Sonic Adventure International was released, with a network ranking applicable to 5 languages. In 2003, a remake of the game was released for the Game Cube, and this version also had a Windows release the same year.

From Amazon: After several years in video game retirement, Sonic the Hedgehog returns as the star of a graphically stunning 3-D adventure game that blows away every other game in the genre. Sonic is joined by five of his friends in a massive quest that spans over 50 game levels filled with remarkable visuals and a pulsating soundtrack. Taking full advantage of the unprecedented processing power of the Dreamcast, Sega's development crew, Sonic Team, has designed several gravity-defying game levels that will keep gamers hooked.

68421.name: Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare

videogamehonor.31496: 2007 Game Critics Best Action Game of the Year Winner

68421.description:
"Call of Duty 4 takes place in a fictional near-future, where a radical leader has staged a coup d'état in the Middle East, and an "Ultranationalist" movement has instigated a civil war in Russia. The events of the conflicts are seen from the perspectives of an American Marine and a British SAS commando, and are set in multiple locations, including the Middle East, Azerbaijan, Russia, and Prypiat, Ukraine. The multiplayer portion of the game features various game modes, and contains a leveling system that allows the player to unlock additional weapons, weapon attachments, and camouflage schemes as they advance."

Source: Wikipedia, "Call_of_Duty_4," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68422.name: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2

videogameexpansion.103099: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 – Resurgence Package

videogamehonor.31498: 2009 Game Critics Best Action Game of the Year Winner

68422.description:
User Summary
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 (also referred to as simply Modern Warfare 2) is a first-person shooter developed by Infinity Ward and published by Activision for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, and Windows PC.

The single player story mode is a direct sequel to Call of Duty 4, and includes several characters familiar to that game. During the single-player game players will take control of five different characters in a world-spanning story of war, terrorism, and espionage.

The Special Ops mode contains challenging stand-alone missions which can be played solo or 2 player co-op (online or split screen). Completing missions earns you "stars" which unlock more missions.

Multiplayer may be played on-line (up to 18 players) or local split screen (up to 4 players). There are many multiplayer game modes including kill-based (eg Team Deathmatch, Free For All) and objective-based (eg Capture the Flag, Demolition) as well as Hardcore versions which feature limited displays and friendly fire. Multiplayer features Classes which allow you to customize your play style by selecting you weapons (assault rifles, pistols, launchers, etc), attachments (scopes, silencers, etc), Perks (upgrades to your character such as faster reloads and silent footsteps), and Killstreaks (air support awarded for multiple kills in a row, ranges from UAV to tactical nukes). All of these may be unlocked and upgraded by earning experience points through kills as well as completing challenges.

177849.name: Eminent Domain: Base Game Scenarios Promo

boardgamehonor.20119: 2012 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee

68425.description:
Survey the galaxy to expand your civilization – will you colonize nearby planets, or take them over by force? Harvest resources for trade, and do research to improve your technology. Build the best civilization and win the game!

Eminent Domain is a civilization-building game in which your civilization's abilities are based on a deck of Role cards. At the beginning of the game each player has the same deck of cards, with just two cards for each Role in it. Every turn you must choose a Role to execute (and like Glory to Rome or Puerto Rico, your opponents will get a chance to follow suit), and in doing so you will add one of those Role cards to your deck. When executing a Role, you can boost its effect by playing cards out of your hand matching the Role you have chosen. For example, the more you Research, the better you get at Researching (because you'll have more Research cards in your deck).
68425.name: Eminent Domain

68426.name: Halo 3: ODST

videogamehonor.31880: 2009 Game Critics Best Action Game of the Year Nominee

68426.description: From the Back of the Box: The year is 2552. The Covenant control the city of New Mombasa. They are searching for something beneath its darkened streets. You are an Orbital Drop Shock Trooper. Your orders: Stay Alive, meet up with your scattered squad, and escape the embattled city. Stop the Covenant and we just might win this war.

68427.description:
[User Summary]

Portal is a single-player action/puzzle game developed by Valve Corporation. The players are tasked with working their way through a dangerous test facility. To do so, they will be using a "portal gun" to create doorways by which they can maneuver around the environment. The game makes use of puzzles involving manipulating objects, physics, re-directing projectiles, and much more. The end result is a puzzle game like no other.

videogamehonor.41705: 2008 D.I.C.E. Best Character Design of the Year Winner

68427.name: Portal (2007)

68429.name: New Super Mario Bros. Wii

videogamefranchise.11430: Nintendo Selects (Best Selling Wii Games, US & EU)

videogamehonor.31910: 2009 Game Critics Game of the Year Nominee

68429.description:
From the Back of the Box:

Mario leaps into an all-new adventure.
Scramble through courses with up to four players at the same time!

Run, stomp, and fly through eight worlds packed with enemies and surprises.

68430.name: Fallout 3

videogamehonor.31826: 2007 Game Critics Best of Show Nominee

videogamecompilation.154163: Fallout 3: Game of the Year Edition

68430.description:
User Summary

Taking over the Fallout franchise from Interplay, Bethesda continues the Fallout RPG saga with Fallout 3. Replacing the isometric view with a fully 3D world, the game can be played in either first or third person views. While occurring in real-time, combat can be switched to a turn-based mode using a re-implementation of the V.A.T.S. system from earlier games, utilizing action points and an auto-targeting system; V.A.T.S. can also be disabled, allowing combat to be played out FPS-style.

The game begins with the development of your character growing up in Vault 101. This process controls your character generation, though the game allows you to override the selections determined by your choices. Following up on the disappearance of your father, your character emerges outside the ruins of Washington D.C., where you are free to explore the various locales. While the primary plot-line revolves around your quest for your father, many sub-quests offer insight into the world and development for your character. As in previous games, your actions and conversations with various NPC's alter the way the you are perceived by the world around you, which can lead to additional side-quests. Your actions also allow you to be joined by NPC companions, though you may only have one follower at any time. Additionally, you may be joined by a canine companion as well.

68431.name: Ultimate Spider-Man

videogamehonor.31776: 2005 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Nominee

68431.description:
From the game box:

Be legendary.

Be predatory.

Be both.

Swing to the rescue as Spider-Man then blaze a path of destruction as Venom. Play both sides in the most ground-breaking Spider-Man experience ever.

rpgitemversion.172008: La légion des âmes perdues - French edition

68432.name: The Legion of Lost Souls

rpghonor.14349: 2002 ENnie for Best Art (Cover) - Runner Up

68432.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Hell has come to the City of Ghosts.

As Raelthorne chokes the life from Corvis with his army of the strange and foreign Skorne, our heroes become the last chance to stop the Exile's dark plan. Hope lies in a wicked blade, an ancient legend, and a psychotic adolescent girl who doesn't know when to quit.

This is the final hour. This is the day of days.

Lock and load...


Return to the Iron Kingdoms in the third book of this award winning D20 adventure series. Experience a world of full metal fantasy, where the embers of ancient conflict fuel the fire in which heroes are forged.

Book Three: The Legion of Lost Souls concludes the Witchfire Trilogy and marches the Iron Kingdoms toward a date with destiny. Part adventure, part sourcebook, The Legion of Lost Souls will provide you with weeks of campaign material including new monsters, magical creations, and intriguing characters.

Haven't played through Book 1 or 2 of the Trilogy? No problem. This adventure can be dropped into any fantasy D20 campaign.

Requires the use of the Dungeons & Dragons Player's Handbook, Third Edition, published by Wizards of the Coast.

An adventure for characters of 5th - 7th level.

68433.name: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time

videogameseries.9580: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time

videogamefranchise.6404: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

videogamehonor.30583: 2003 EGM Game of the Year Winner

68433.description:
From the game box:

Deceived by the treacherous Vizier, I was led to unleash the Sands of Time curse upon the Sultan's kingdom. With little but an ancient dagger and a devious princess to aid me, I must undo my fatal mistake. Mine is a fight for survival... not glory.

68434.name: ULTIMATE COMBO: Boxing
68434.description:
It's a card game that simulates a boxing match. Both players draw cards from a single pile. Every card represents an specific action (jab, hook to the body, duck, clinch, etc) that can be linked to another action (jab-cross-left hook...) or countered by specific actions. The round lenght is commanded by the number of cards left in the pile. The match ends when one of the boxer's stamina reach zero (you lose one stamina point for every punch you get), or by instant KO (one KO punch) or TKO (three knockdowns in a single round).
There are 8 diferent types of punch, 4 dodge moves + 2 cancel moves making a total of 14!!! possible actions per boxer. AND aditionally you can play it with a board adding even more moves and strategy.

68435.name: River Raid
68435.description:
[User Summary]

River Raid is a top-down, vertically scrolling shooter, originally released for the Atari 2600. The player controls a small plane, flying over a river and between canyon walls. Points are earned by shooting down enemy ships, planes, and helicopters. The game also features a decreasing fuel gauge that must be frequently replenished by flying over fuel tanks.

The game is widely considered one of the best games released for the Atari 2600, and one of the most technically sophisticated. In addition to standard left-right movement, the game provided the ability to speed up and slow down, and the fuel gauge depleted at a corresponding rate. Most significantly, the game featured a large number of non-randomly generated levels, something which was very rare at the time due to memory constraints. The game achieved this by algorithmically (but not randomly) generating the terrain and location of enemies, rather than storing this information on the cartridge.

River Raid was designed and programmed by Carol Shaw, believed to be the first female video game designer.

68436.name: Mortal Kombat: Armageddon

videogamehonor.31813: 2006 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee

68436.description:
From the game box:

The fury of Mortal Kombat has brought the realms to the brink of total destruction. Every warrior has been summoned to this last epic battle, where survival depends on their ability to...FIGHT!

68437.name: Adventure (Atari)

videogameversion.139247: Android (Atari Greatest Hits Atari 2600 Emulation) edition

68437.description:
[User Summary]

In Adventure, the player (represented by a small square) explores a world consisting of mazes and castles. The world is populated by three dragons which will chase the player, and several items which the player may pick up and use. Items include:


keys, used to unlock the castles,
an arrow, used to slay the dragons,
a bridge, used to pass through maze walls,
a magnet, used to pull other items toward you, and
a chalice.


The player may only carry one item at a time. The game ends (and the player wins) when the chalice is returned to the starting castle.

The game is notable for being the first action-adventure game, and containing the first widely known "easter egg" in video game history--a secret item which when found and brought to a particular room displayed the name of the game's designer and programmer, Warren Robinett.

The game features three difficulty settings, which change the distribution of dragons and items and the layout of the map.

68438.name: Darksiders

videogamefranchise.6404: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

videogamehonor.40665: 2011 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Nominee

68438.description:
The Horseman Cometh
War, the first Horseman of the Apocalyse,

68439.name: Dragster
68439.description:
[User Summary]

Dragster is a very short racing game in which the goal is to get from one side of the screen to the other as quickly as possible. As in real drag racing, most races are over in just a few seconds.

The joystick button is used as the accelerator, pushing left on the joystick engages the clutch, and letting the joystick return to center shifts to a higher gear. Achieving fast times requires keeping the engine as highly revved as possible, while getting up to fourth gear quickly. But let the engine rev to high, and the engine will blow out--which is extremely easy to do.

The game was designed and programmed by David Crane.

[From box front:]

Drop your Dragster into gear, stand on the gas (but don't blow your engine!), pop the clutch and GO! Burn rubber!

[From box back:]

If you've ever dreamed about being a drag racer, wait 'til you buckle into your bid powerful Dragster and rev up the engine. Brrrm, brrrm ... feel the engine rumble as the countdown clock ticks ... 3, 2, 1, GO! It's you against the clock or another racer. You push in the clutch, shift, rev up, shift, rev, shift, rev (don't forget the clutch!) and try NOT to blow your big engine.

Dragster will hypnotize you. You'll practice for hours just to shave a hundredth of a second off your best time. It's all the action, fun, and thrills you can ask for in a video game.

[From the catalog:]

Drop your dragster into gear, stand on the gas, watch the countdown, pop the clutch and GO! Your motor revs up (watch that red line or you'll blow your engine!), you shift quickly through the gears and burn rubber across the screen to beat the competition or run the video quarter-mile in record time. You'll be hypnotized by Dragster by ACTIVISION.

68441.name: Fable

videogamefranchise.6406: Best of Platinum Hits (Select Best Selling Xbox Games, US)

videogamehonor.31747: 2003 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Nominee

68441.description:
User Summary:

From humble beginnings you will set out on a quest to change the face of the world forever. However, how history will remember your name will be entirely up to you!

In Fable every action will affect your skills, your appearance, and the way that people react to you. From childhood to your death you will change and evolve as a hero, a villain, or perhaps a two-faced opportunist. With each feat of strength your body will increase in muscle while with each act of gluttony you will appear more bulbous and flabby. Exposure to the sun will make you tan and battle wounds will become scars. Your fate is yours to decide in the ever-changing world of Fable.

68442.name: Sega Genesis
68442.description:
Technical specifications





Processor:

Motorola 68000 16/32-bit processor running at 7.67 MHz



Co-processor (Sound Controller):

Zilog Z80 8-bit at 3.58 MHz



Memory:

64K work RAM (68000), 64K video RAM, 8K work RAM (Z80)
Later hardware had an internal 1Kx8 ROM for the license display screen.



Display Palette:

512 colors (3:3:3 RGB)



Onscreen colors:

64 (normal) or 183 (shadow/highlight mode)



Maximum onscreen sprites:

80 (320-pixel wide displays) or 64 (256-pixel wide displays)



Resolution:

256×224, 256×448, 320×224, 320×448, (PAL and NTSC)
256×240, 320×240, 256×480, 320×480 (PAL only),
256×192 (SMS games only)



Sound:

Yamaha YM2612 5 channel FM and 1 channel FM/PCM, Texas Instruments SN76489 4 channel PSG (Programmable Sound Generator)




(From Wikipedia)

68443.name: Knights of the Dinner Table (Issue 5 - Mar 1997)
68443.description:
"Master of the Game"

Cover by Chris Adams

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

videogame.79690: Bioshock & The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion (Double Pack)

68446.name: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion

videogameexpansion.78342: The Elder Scrolls IV: Knights of the Nine

videogamehonor.31773: 2005 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Nominee

videogamecompilation.79690: Bioshock & The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion (Double Pack)

68446.description:
User Summary:

Daedra are on the loose on the continent of Tamriel as Oblivion Gates open across Cyrodiil! And it's up to you to save it (or ignore it if you'd rather).
The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion is the sequel to Morrowind and as was also true with the former, Oblivion allows you to do whatever you want, travel wherever you want, and play however you like. Play as an assassin, thief, wizard, alchemist, warrior, archer, or as any combination you desire! With ten races to choose from: four human, four elven, and two beast; the sheer number of different ways to play Oblivion are staggering.

As an RPG you create your character from scratch, picking their race, basic attributes, skills, and specializations, along with even more options. The main quest revolves around saving the land from daedra (demon-like beings) who keep appearing through Oblivion Gates (rift portals) and closing their access to the world of Nirn, which will be easier said than done. How you do it or if you do it, is up to you.

boardgamehonor.11078: 2011 Spiel des Jahres Kennerspiel des Jahres Winner

68448.description:
You are the leader of one of the 7 great cities of the Ancient World. Gather resources, develop commercial routes, and affirm your military supremacy. Build your city and erect an architectural wonder which will transcend future times.

7 Wonders lasts three ages. In each age, players receive seven cards from a particular deck, choose one of those cards, then pass the remainder to an adjacent player. Players reveal their cards simultaneously, paying resources if needed or collecting resources or interacting with other players in various ways. (Players have individual boards with special powers on which to organize their cards, and the boards are double-sided). Each player then chooses another card from the deck they were passed, and the process repeats until players have six cards in play from that age. After three ages, the game ends.

In essence, 7 Wonders is a card development game. Some cards have immediate effects, while others provide bonuses or upgrades later in the game. Some cards provide discounts on future purchases. Some provide military strength to overpower your neighbors and others give nothing but victory points. Each card is played immediately after being drafted, so you'll know which cards your neighbor is receiving and how his choices might affect what you've already built up. Cards are passed left-right-left over the three ages, so you need to keep an eye on the neighbors in both directions.

Though the box of earlier editions is listed as being for 3–7 players, there is an official 2-player variant included in the instructions.
68448.name: 7 Wonders

68449.name: Player's Handbook 3 (D&D 4e)

rpgissuearticle.24647: Class Acts: Runepriests - Lost Runes of Unmaking

68449.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Out of the Far Realm they came: creatures of horror and madness. As the gods rallied against the incursion, brave heroes arose with newfound powers of their own. Together they stood against this threat from beyond, just as they stand today.

This companion to the Player's Handbook (D&D 4e) and Player's Handbook 2 core rulebooks introduces the psionic power source-powers of the will brought to bear against evil's madness. Player's Handbook 3 includes 4 classes tied to the psionic power source: the ardent, the battlemind, the monk, and the psion. It also presents a new divine class (the runepriest) and a new primal class (the seeker).

This essential book for Dungeons & Dragons players contains other exciting options: new races, powers (including skill powers for all classes), feats, paragon paths, epic destinies, equipment, superior implements, and rules for hybrid characters.

68450.name: Chariot Arena
68450.description:
Chariot Arena is a Grim Trojan board game based on the chariot races of Roman times and the first of Grim Trojan’s Downloadable Board Games.

To keep the game fun for different levels and ages of players, optional rules have been created (the alternate rules follow the official rules).

This board game is very loosely based on historical records about chariot races. With that said, never forget the game is a board game and as such has been modified to keep game play fun. The arena is based (again, loosely) on Rome’s largest and oldest circus, Circus Maximus (called a circus because of the oval shape).

Attacks are allowed to simulate the whipping and bumping that occurred in a chariot race and the curves are more dangerous in the board game because they were in the real races.

Chariot Arena has two different playing boards to allow for better game play. The larger board comprised of four pages
with smaller hexes was designed for a larger group of players and for those who enjoy longer more detailed game play. The
smaller board comprised of two pages with larger hexes is designed to allow a smaller number of players to have more
interaction in few laps and its charts are less complicated. Try both and play the one that best suits your style of play.

As each player takes their turn, they must first move their pawn 6 hexes. They then have the option to stay where they are or roll 2d6 (two six sided dice) and moving their pawn across the board one hex at a time the number of hexes shown on the dice. Movement can be forward left, forward right or forward. Moving a pawn backward on the track is not permitted. Only one
pawn can occupy a hex at a time. If a pawn is in your way, you must move around it. The player also has the option to move
the pawn less hexes than indicated on the dice (example: a player rolling 10 can move only 7 hexes if they wish). If a pawn’s path is blocked by other pawns and it is impossible to move forward while moving the base 6 hexes, the player must choose which pawn to stop behind. The player and the owner of the other pawn must both roll from the Accident Chart.

68451.name: Chaos Crossing
68451.description:
Description from game pdf

Chaos Crossing is a game for 2 to 4 players. This game requires Pegable Pawns: 4 blue, 4 red, 4 orange, 4 yellow, 1 green, 1 grey, 1 white, 1 brown, 1 purple; 1 game board; 1 six sided die.

The object of the game is to send all of your pawns out onto the board to collect crowns and be the first to return all of your pawns, crowned, to the starting sphere.

68452.description:
Description from game pdf

Balloons In The Wind can be played by any number of players, but one player might not be very challenging and anything over eight might begin to get a little crowded. Grim Trojan recommends using the Ball Pawns for this game (just because they look good for it. Any pawn that fits in the grid’s squares will work).

The winner is the first player to cross the red line into the park at the North end of the board.
68452.name: Balloons in the Wind

68453.name: Puzzle Quest: Challenge of the Warlords

videogamehonor.31043: 2007 Spike Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

68453.description:
[User Summary]

A game that blends elements of the role-playing and puzzle games genres. As in a more traditional RPG, players move around on an overworld map; collect items, spells, equipment, and gold; gain levels to increase their character's stats; and progress in a story. The battles, however, take place in a competitive variant of the puzzle game Bejeweled. Characters match certain combinations of jewels in order to attack or use special abilities or spells.

Puzzle Quest: Challenge of the Warlords was published simultaneously for the Nintendo DS and PlayStation Portable. A surprise hit, both critically and commercially, it was later ported to several other platforms.

It was followed by a sequel: Puzzle Quest: Galactrix.

68454.name: Game Gear TV Tuner
68454.description:
The Game Gear TV Tuner is a peripheral for the Sega Game Gear. The TV Tuner plugs into the Game Gear's game cartridge slot, turning the system into a portable TV. The peripheral features a long antenna, and an analog dial for tuning into different frequencies.

Source: User summary (walkie).

68455.name: Master Gear Converter
68455.description:
The Master Gear Converter is a peripheral for the Sega Game Gear. One end plugs into the Game Gear's game cartridge slot. Sega Master System games can then be plugged into the other end, allowing Master System games to be played on the Game Gear. This adapter was possible because the hardware of the Master System and the Game Gear were extremely similar.

Source: User summary (walkie).

68456.name: Dragon (Issue 245 - Mar 1998)

rpgissuearticle.46813: Bazaar of the Bizarre - Dwarven Relics

68456.description:
Can you rise to the challenge? Dwarves for all occasions.

Vol. XXII, No. 8
Cover art by Matt Wilson

68457.name: British Sovereigns
68457.description:
This boardgame includes 56 pictures of British kings and queens from Egbert (died 839), the first English king, to Victoria (1819–1901).

The players are provided with a Card, containing nine Letters, nine Numbers, two Crosses and one Blank, which are to be cut up on the lines with a pair of scissors.

Each player, on drawing a number, is to place his letter on the same number in the Game. When it is his turn to draw another, he adds them together and advances his letter to that number which they make when so added, reading as before, and observing any directions which may be given him. But if he draw a cross, he is to draw again, till he obtain a number, which number is to be deducted from, instead of added to his former station, and his letter moved back accordingly. Each card to be returned to the bag after drawing. Whoever draws a blank, remains at his former number. After each player has drawn once, the boardgame is to be continued in the same manner, passing the bag round, till someone makes up the exact number 151, who wins the Game.

68458.name: Warcraft III: Reign of Chaos

videogamehonor.31717: 2000 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee

68458.description:
Blizzard returns players to Azeroth for the third full RTS experience in the series. Players will play through four different story campaigns. Each of those campaigns feature one of the playable races (Humans, Orcs, Night Elves, and Undead.)

When the single-player campaigns are finished, there is plenty more fun to be had on Battle.net. Free-for-all games, team games, ladder games, and custom games keep players coming back for years!

68460.name: Règles + Les louanges des mouches
68460.description:
From the game description:

Le syndrome de Babylone is an occult, mystic, modern RPG. It can be considered a "serie-game" as the different scenarios are following themselves in a coherent way.

The game is set in a big US city, big enough to house enough insane people. Which one in particular does not matter. The city described in the rules corresponds to Los Angeles, but any other will do.

User description:
This rule book is composed of 21 pages:
- a 1 page character sheet
- a 2 pages introduction to RPGs
- 6 pages of rules
- a 10 pages scenario

This game can be downloaded for free here:
http://www.xperyments.com/syndromedebabylone.php3

68461.name: Ecran 3 volets
68461.description:
User Summary:

This is the official 3-fold screen for the game.

It can be downloaded for free here:
http://www.xperyments.com/syndromedebabylone.php3

68462.name: Règles additionnelles
68462.description:
User Summary:

This extension contains additional rules and some errata for the core book. It is just a one page pdf.

68463.name: Les Voleurs d'Âmes
68463.description:
User Summary:

This is the second scenario for the Syndrome de Babylone RPG.

It takes place 2 months after the first one, the players are getting together and begin to learn more about their condition...

This adventure is supposed to last for four hours, but as it is mainly an investigation, the GM can adapt it to virtually any length.

68464.name: Les Modeleurs de Vies
68464.description:
User Summary:

This is the third scenario for the Syndrome de Babylone RPG.

It takes place 3 months after the second one, and is partly set up in dark clubs housing occult events.

This adventure is supposed to last for three to six hours but the GM can adapt it to virtually any length.

This scenario comes with many props to give to the player during the game.

68465.name: Rien n'est éternel
68465.description:
User Summary:

This is the last scenario in the serie. It was designed to last for four to five hours.

In this last scenario, the public begins to ear more and more about the Babylone syndrome, and start to panic... The player are pursuing their quest for truth, and it may come to an end...

This adventure, which comes with many props to give to the players, and can be downloaded for free here:
http://www.xperyments.com/syndromedebabylone.php3

68466.name: Wakfu
68466.description:
Wakfu is a French Collectible Card Game, named after the Massive Multiplayer Online Role Playing Game that reimplements Dofus.

Each player controls a hero, among 12 that have different stats and abilities, and a dimensional bag, in which 4 cards are safe.

A turn consists in playing new cards from hand to put new characters, equipment or zones in play, and performing one single attack against one single target. The defending player may block the attack with his own characters.

Cards, once in play, can be used either as resources to put new cards in play, or to activate their special abilities, or to attack. Either way, when used they are rotated and are not available until next turn. A rotated card may not be used to block the opponent's attack.

After each attack, some experience points may be awarded to either player. The heroes may level up when they reach 6 experience points, and again when they reach 18 experience points. There are two possible ways to win: either kill the opponent's hero, or level up twice with one's own.

Free translation from the back of the starter box:
Chose your hero and his dimensional bag and explore the world of Dofus and Wakfu. Develop your crafting skills, create powerful items, feed your pets and earn XP... create your own ideal game! Tournament play is awaiting you...

68467.name: Orb Quest
68467.description:
From the back of the box.

Orbquest is a Microquest adventure suitable for solitaire play, in The Fantasy Trip role-playing game system. It requires the Microgames Melee and Wizard or Advance Melee and Advance Wizard rules to provide the combat and magic rules for play.

Components: Rules, map and counters.

68468.name: Téte de la Course
68468.description:
Game, in which authors took a job to simulate cycling. The main game takes place in France on the Tour, on one track between Brest - Plumelec. Other side of the board is a timed circuit with completely new rules.
Each player takes care of one team (one colour) and moves his vehicles according to the dice throw. There are 3 types of terrain - down (dice throw x3), straight (dice throw x2) and hills (dice throw).
A few places behind you rides also your service vehicle, which can help in case of a defect (when you throw a six, there is a chance of defect).
Each player has also a pack of cards, which he can use in the race to speed up his cyclist for a couple of dice throws.
There are also fights for the yellow and striped dresses, which gives player advantages in next race. Weather has also influence on racer movement and is simulated randomly with a short forecast by a PC small program.

84688.name: Cars: Radiator Springs Rallye Small Expansion

68469.description:
Game takes place in Radiator Springs, a town created by a Pixar animation studios movie Cars.
Game is mainly for smaller children. The principle is simple: you create one of three possible race tracks (assembles as puzzle) as throw dice to be the first in the finish.
Many obstacles comes in your way: you must draw cards, you lose few turns or you have to go back by a few spots. Each tile is home of one of movie characters.
On the race track can be up to 6 cars made of plastic, but they are looking good. You have to assemble them first.
68469.name: Cars: Radiator Springs Rallye

68470.name: Princezny na plese
68470.description:
Game for little girls. You place pink cardboard hearts in a circle and in the middle you place another six blue hearts to form another, closer circle.
Four princesses take turns and run around on the outer circle, turn the hearts and find things as a lost dress, and so on. They have to find four pieces of clothing before they can go to the ball and find their prince. There are many obstacles in their way (a birdie,...).
When they are dressed, they step into the inner circle and are trying to find their prince (only one of the four is the right one for each princess).

68473.name: Matador: Et spørgsmålsspil om Korsbæk
68473.description:
The game is based on the highly popular television series "Matador", which was shown on Danish television in the eighties. It is not necessary to have followed the series, but the pleasure is greater if you have a little knowledge of the history and characters you will meet on the gameboard.
The game is about to correctly answering questions, collect the right number of cards and reach the goal, before the other players steals your cards. In addition to knowledge about the persons in Matador, their intrigue and relationships, you also need to play tactical, and to be part of the "right" alliances to win the game.
The game contains 1200 questions about the series and its personalities, and all question-cards are in addition to the 4 questions for adults, marked with a question, especially developed for children, (8 years), thus without a greater understanding of 'Matador' can participate on equal terms with grownups.

68474.name: Amusement in English History
68474.description:
At this gameboard portraits of 40 British kings and queens, in 80 playing spaces altogether, are shown with events from each of their reigns.

Rules:
The Card sold with the Game is to be divided. The Letters are to mark the players' position on the Game; the Numbers and Blanks are to be placed in a lady's reticule or bag. Draw for the first player; the highest number to begin. Each player on drawing a number is to place his letter on the same number on the Game, unless otherwise ordered in the directors, which must be read aloud. When it is his turn to draw again, he must add his number to the one where his letter stands, and remove it accordingly. If he draws a blank, he must remain where he is. Each card is to be returned to the bag. The game is to proceed in this manner till some player arrives at the Marriage of Queen Victoria, who wins the game. When a player is sent back, he is not to read the Directions, but wait his turn to draw again. The history of each reign may be read or omitted at the time of playing, as the players think fit.

68475.name: The Cottage of Content or the Blessings of Cheerfulness & Good Temper
68475.description:
A card game and a moral game and described on the front of the box as follows: "Showing how Good Dr Lovejoy did invite a party and award his nice Cottage of Content to Master Peter Placid and Miss Felicia Amiable and how it was their happy lot to be the means of converting their friends from their errors".

The game is to continue until all are placed upon the table. Then Dr. Lovejoy will give the Cottage of Content to Peter Placid and Felicia Amiable as a reward for their excellent behaviour, which had promoted so much mirth and good feeling amonst his party of visitors.

68477.name: Faces in the Crowd (Vol. 1)
68477.description:
Faces in the Crowd is a collection of 15 NPCs ready to use in any World of Darkness chronicle. The NPCs are diverse, including a Uratha, two vampires, a thaumaturge, a telepath and a host of troubled mortals. The power level of the NPCs is modest to provide a challenge for new characters. Each NPC comes wth an illustration, background and detailed stat block.

From http://unknownzine.blogspot.com/2010/02/faces-in-crowd-vol-i...

68478.name: Floating Fortress
68478.description:
Floating Fortress is a Print-n-Play game featuring a navel battle between two players using standard d6 dice. The game is played on a 8x8 board with each player having 2 bases and 14 ships under their control. Each turn a player may move a single ship or use multiple ships to fire on a single target. Ships have to reload their ammunition between shots and are controlled with attack and defense dice that determine their shots power, their movement speed, their firing range and how much life they have remaining. The object of the game is to be the first player to eliminate both of their opponent's bases.

The game requires each player to have their own set of 36 dice with the 2 sets being a different color and it can played on the back of the unfolded rulebook. The rulebook and board fit on a single sheet of printed paper.

68479.name: The Travellers of Europe, with Improvements and Additions
68479.description: Five players take the parts of The Travellers, who are from Austria, Sweden, Russia, Prussia and England. They must make their way to their respective capital cities each starting from a different city in Africa, or on the shore of the Mediterranean Sea. They play with a teetotum or spinner with four sides marked N,S,E,W representing the directions they must move in.

68480.name: Cognes
68480.description:
A game for 2 players (and possibly 3 or 4) requiring only a bunch of coins and a plane, non-slippery surface. Perfect for situations where no other game is at hand!

On their turn, each player tries to flip a coin, while always maintaining it in contact with the table, without it ever touching another coin.

68481.name: The Pirate and Traders of the West Indies
68481.description:
The gameboard consists of 8 sections mounted on linen and showing a map of the Caribbean. The title is at the top and the publisher's details at the lower left. It shows a map of the Caribbean islands together with shipping and latitude and longitude lines.

THE TRADERS are supposed to be trading between the West India Islands and other countries, and are about to start on their voyage from certain places on the coast of Mexico and in the Caribbean sea. These places are indicated by the four letters A,B,C,D, and each trader has a mark corresponding with one of these letters.

The PIRATE, who is to attack or capture the traders on their voyage, has his retreat marked on the coast near to New Orleans, and from this spot he starts at the beginning of the game.

68482.name: Dragon (Issue 246 - Apr 1998)
68482.description:
Need a hand? This issue is dedicated to henchman!

Vol. XXII, No. 9
Cover art by Michael Sutfin

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

68483.description:
A little girl said, "I’m a princess!"
Her big brother said, "You can’t be a princess! You’re not from
a royal family!" She just smiled, and knew better.

All it takes is a crown, and a little imagination!
From the Late For the Sky website:

Princess-opoly celebrates the imagination in all little girls. Players collect princess friends, give those friends a crown, and collect extra allowance each time another player lands on their space. (Yes, even a princess needs to earn an allowance!)

Modern day princesses are about A LOT more than finding Prince Charming. Princess-opoly celebrates strong girls with big personalities, and even BIGGER dreams!

So, grab your wand and advance to "Imagine!"

Get ready for an ENCHANTING experience!
68483.name: PrincessOpoly

68484.name: Die unsichtbaren Herrscher
68484.description:
(from the back of the book)
The Empire of Horas is proud of its glorious past, of the aggregation of knowledge sacred to Hesinde and of the recent results of its skillful diplomats and traders. What would be, however, if this was built "new order" was not stable, if documents from the glorious past turned out to be a game of diplomats and a product of hagglers? How would the heroes react if they were confronted with such knowledge? How would the officials react? And, above all: How would the secret societies, cables and circles react - the invisible rulers (Unsichtbare Herrscher) of the Empire of Horas?

68485.name: Final Fantasy II
68485.description:
From the game box:
The legend continues. A new evil threatens the land, and once more, a band of young heroes stands against it.

User summary:
Final Fantasy II was the second FF installment by Square. The game features a distinguishly darker "rebel army" scenario, and is infamous for its unique 'levelling' system – characters increased their HP by being wounded in battle, and players quickly realized that hitting yourself was the best way of getting wounded. Players ended up entering battle only to constantly hit themselves, attacking the real enemies only when they had lost enough HP to get a gain.

Not to be confused with Final Fantasy II, the US release of the SNES RPG Final Fantasy IV
This game and the sequel Final Fantasy III was originally not released in the US. The first SNES counterpart Final Fantasy IV however, was, and in an attempt to avoid confusion, it was renumbered to Final Fantasy II upon US release. As FFV also never got a US release, but FFVI did, getting the US title Final Fantasy III. Upon the release of Final Fantasy VII though, even the US title got the same numbering, and after that, all remakes of the earlier games have retained their original numbering.

Individual credits:
Hironobu Sakaguchi: Director
Nobuo Uematsu: Music
Yoshitaka Amano: Character & monster design

68486.name: Final Fantasy III

videogamehonor.29864: 2007 D.I.C.E. Best Role-Playing Game of the Year Nominee

68486.description:
From the game box:
A divine balance is disturbed as darkness encroaches on the world, and four chosen youths are entrusted with the final vestiges of hope.

User summary:
Final Fantasy III was the third and last FF installment for the NES. It was originally never released in the US. FFIII features a job-changing system, where the players could revert the player characters into warriors, mages, thieves etc, mid-game. However, the characters needed to stay in one class during a certain number of battle before being able to change again. The dark atmosphere from FFII is replaced with a light fantasy story regarding the restoration of nature's balance through the finding of the four crystals.

Not to be confused with the SNES Final Fantasy III, which is the US title of the game Final Fantasy VI
FFII and FFIII were never released in the US, so when FFIV was to get a US release, it was renamed to Final Fantasy II. FFV was also never released in the US, and consequently, when FFVI was released in the US, it was renamed to Final Fantasy III. When the FF series turned to the Playstation and FFVII was released, the US version got the same numbering and after that, all US releases of remakes of the earlier games have retained their original numbering.

Individual credits:
Hironobu Sakaguchi: Director
Nobuo Uematsu: Music
Yoshitaka Amano: Character & monster design

68487.name: Dragon (Issue 248 - Jun 1998)

rpgissuearticle.46964: Arcane Lore - Dragon Dweomers III: Draconic Priest Spells

68487.description:
Dragons!

Vol. XXIII, No. 1
Cover art by Fred Fields

68488.name: Final Fantasy IV
68488.description:
From the game box:
Follow the dark knight Cecil - Lord Captain of Baron's elite force, the Red Wings - as he embarks on a fateful journey riddled with trials, betrayals, friendship, loss and self-discovery. Plagued with uncertainty over his monarch's motives, can Cecil turn away from the path of darkness and destruction?

User summary:
Final Fantasy IV was Square's first Final Fantasy installment for the SNES. The game was early planned to be released for the NES, but was quickly changed for a SNES release when Nintendo announced it, thus hitting the SNES RPG scene before Enix' Dragon Quest V did.

As playing RPGs was still something new at that time, Square made an attempt to get new players into the RPG gaming by releasing a special version called Final Fantasy IV Easy Type. The most notable differences included marking all hidden passageways with white spots; replacing all the specialized status restoration items with a generic "Remedy" item that healed all status changes; and removing many character abilities from the battle system. Also, the secret "developer team" room that lies hidden in the full game was not accessible in Easy Type.

The American release: Final Fantasy II and the numbering
As FFII and FFIII for the NES were never released in the US, the title of FFIV was changed to Final Fantasy II for the US release, years later causing confusion. Notably, the American release was in reality "Final Fantasy IV Easy Type". Also, a short conversation scene in the starting town, where a dancer girl, being scared of the main character's Dark Knight appearance, throws off her dress and dances in her underwear, was deemed "inappropriate" and was removed. The dancer girl keeps her dress on in the US release. This caused internet rumours that the scene contained explicit nudity, which of course it didn't.

FFV also never got a US release, so FFVI, the last FF for the SNES, was named Final Fantasy III in the US.
